loans.name: Paskaziya

texts.en:
Paskaziya is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance who previously applied for a loan of 2000,000/= that helped her to buy food items and utencils for her restaurant but now is applying for another one of ugx2,500,000. She is a married woman with 2 children.

She is a business woman owning a restaurant and she is a hard working lady. However she is faced with the challange of competition and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She will use the loan to expand the eating area of the restaurant since she operates in a makeshift environment. This will help her to serve more customers at once and therefore increase her income. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

In the photograph is Paskaziya(left) with the group chairperson- she signed the waiver form too.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand the food eating area.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 46 years old married woman and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from their training, especially enterprise development.

She does vegetable farming and also sells motor bike spare parts. She is borrowing the Kiva loan to buy more spare parts which will increase her income. She will use part of the profits to renovate her family house.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to stock her motorbike spare parts shop which will increase her income and help her renovate her family house.

loans.name: Christelle

texts.en:
Christelle is a 25-year-old single lady who is studying Interior Design. She is working hard to graduate and start working in her career field.

Christelle has been working from her house providing beauty services for two years. This work is a hobby she is developing.

Her current home based business provides her with a good income to cover some of her university needs and living expenses.

Christelle is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her expenses while earning an Interior Design Degree, to graduate, and to start working in her career.

She is looking forward to graduating and establishing her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her expenses while earning an Interior Design Degree, to graduate, and to start working in her career.

loans.name: Angie Yulieth

texts.es:
Angie es una joven de 20 años de edad, la cual se dedica a prestar servicios de manicura y pedicura a domicilios, inició la actividad buscando recursos para estudiar y ayudar económicamente a sus padres, es una mujer muy noble, sincera, cariñosa y agradecida.
Angie actualmente se encuentra solicitando el primer crédito en su vida, lo necesita para comprar una moto y así poder desplazarse más rápidamente y atender un mayor número de clientes en el día lo que le significaría un aumento muy notorio de ingresos.
texts.en:
Angie is a young woman, aged 20, who provides manicure and pedicure services at homes. She has started the business searching for funds to study and to help her parents economically.
She is a very generous, sincere, affectionate and grateful woman.

Currently Angie is requesting the first loan of her life. She needs it to buy a motorbike and thus to be able to move around more quickly and to attend a larger number of customers during the day. This will signify a very remarkable increase of income for her.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and thus to move around more quickly

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina es una mujer que se dedica a realizar bisutería en murano y acero, actividad que aprendió a realizar gracias a su hermana y con la cual genera los ingresos complementarios para mantener a su hogar, pues tiene un esposo que la ayuda en el sostenimiento de la casa la cual es alquilada.
Tiene dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, trabaja por brindarles educación a sus amados niños y comprar una vivienda, quiere tener un local comercial, ser muy exitosa y hacer que sus accesorios sean usados en toda Antioquia.
Lina quiere seguir sacando a flote su negocio, producir una mayor cantidad de artículos y aprovechar la temporada de fin de año para catapultar su empresa y posicionarla.
Lina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de murano, comprar plata para elaborar manillas, anillos, aretes, collares e herramienta para trabajar estos materiales.
texts.en:
Lina is a woman who works making steel and glass bead jewelry. She learned this work thanks to her sister and it gets her the complementary income to upkeep her home. She has a husband who helps her maintain the house that they rent. She has two children, ages 6 and 12 and she works to give her beloved children an education and to buy a home. She wants to have a commercial shop, be very successful and to have her accessories be used in all of Antioquia.

Lina wants to keep going with her business, producing a greater quantity of articules and taking advantage of the end-of-the-year season to catapult her business and position. Lina wants to ask for a loan to buy glass beads and silver to make cuffs, rings, earrings, necklaces, and tools to work with these materials.

loans.use: to buy glass beads and silver to make cuffs, rings, earrings, necklaces, and tools to work with these materials.

loans.name: Lisbeth Sofia

texts.es:
Lisbeth es una mujer tierna y carismática de 30 años de edad la cual tiene un negocio de guardería, donde educa y prepara los niños para cursar primaría.
Ella tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 10 y el menor de 1, su objetivo con su trabajo es pagar la educación de sus muchachos, mejorar su vivienda y ser una mejor profesional cada día.
Pensando en expandir su local y cumplir los estándares de calidad para poder tener mayor número de niños la señora Lisbeth solicita un préstamo para remodelar el baño, adecuación al espacio donde los niños juegan ya que están en la sala de su casa, la idea es tenerlos en una habitación grande con juguetes para su diversión.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a loving and charismatic 30-year-old woman who has her own day care center where she educates and prepares children to enter primary school. She has two children who are 10 and 1 year old. She works in order to pay for her children's education, improve her house, and be a better professional each day.

Lisbeth plans to expand her space and comply with quality standards so she can increase the number of children she cares for at her day care center. She is therefore asking for a loan so she can remodel the bathroom and fix up the space where the children play since they currently use the living room in her house. The idea is to have them in a large room with toys for their amusement.

loans.use: to remodel the bathroom and renovate the space where the children play.

loans.name: Sreten

texts.en:
Sreten is a loyal client who is requesting a loan for the third time to buy seeds to plant wheat so that he can start planting wheat for selling and increase his income. He has been very satisfied with the loan process and results for his two previous loans and looks forward to continuing to have a positive experience once again.

So far, Sreten has been able to provide more income to his family, thanks to the Kiva loans. Now, in addition to his employment at the primary school as a technician, he sells milk and dairy products and is looking to sell wheat.

Sreten works hard and is always searching for ways to provide a better life for his family and to be able to save money for his children's education. He appreciates the continued support from the lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant wheat for selling and increase his income.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Zipporah. She is thirty two years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. Zipporah does maize, dairy and potato farming. 

She is grateful to HIH EA for enterprise training and inculcating in her a culture of saving. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to increase her maize production. She hopes to harvest more maize and potatoes, hence earn more income. She will use it for her family's needs, such as food, and to save for her sunset days.

Zipporah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase her maize production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Mary from Nakuru. She is fifty five years old, married and a mother of eight grown up children. She joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa in 2014.

Mary does maize and dairy farming, and weaves sweaters. She is grateful to HIHEA for their enterprise training and teaching her a culture of saving. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to increase her maize production. She hopes to harvest more maize and earn more income. She will use the increased income to cater for her family needs with food and savings for the future.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her maize production.  She hopes to harvest more maize and earn more income.

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan lives in a minority community with his wife and two children. He has operated a taxi business for the last three years, while his wife has been working as a nurse.

Milan's taxi is very old and needs to be replaced. He has tried several times to save money to obtain a new taxi but he has not been able to save enough money.

At this time he is requesting a loan of 2,000 euros to purchase a new vehicle. He hopes that this loan will help him to be able to have more clients because the new vehicle will be more comfortable and more reliable.

loans.use: to purchase a new taxi vehicle

loans.name: Holmann Yamid

texts.es:
Holmann es un hombre de 30 años de edad, una persona que desde pequeño creyó en sus habilidades, que soñó con un futuro, tener tierras, tener cultivos y se propuso a trabajar en ello y hoy en día cuenta con su finca propia y sus cultivos.
Tiene una pequeña hija de 8 años de edad, su propósito es seguir trabajando y pagar su educación, crecer como empresario nunca conformarse y no olvidar que empezó desde 0 ahora que está triunfando.
El cliente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas principalmente abonos, el monto es en relación a la cantidad necesaria para cubrir todo e l terreno y también está incluido la mano de obra.
texts.en: Holmann is a 30-year old man who, from a young age, believed in his abilities. He dreamt of a future, of having land and crops and he set out to work on it. Now he has his own farm and crops. He has a small 8-year old daughter. His intent is to keep working to pay for her education, grow as a businessman, never conform and never forget that he started from zero and is now succeeding. He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies, mainly fertilizers. The amount is related to the quantity needed to cover all of the land and also includes labor.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Con el ánimo de pagar la educación de sus dos hijos, de consolidar su empresa, contar con materia prima la señora Diana solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima para su negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende productos preparados para la elaboración de ensaladas y sopas.
El dinero será para comprar mesas, herramientas de mano, ella misma elabora los productos, los empaca y los vende afuera de su casa. 
Ella es una mujer honesta, que utiliza sus conocimientos para generar ingresos, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero fue formada con valores y uno de ellos es el de la perseverancia y el sentido de pertenencia con su familia.
v
texts.en: In an effort to pay for the education of her two children, consolidating her business, and having the raw materials, Diana is asking for a loan to buy the raw materials for her business selling vegetables. She sells prepared products to make salads and soups. The money will be used to buy tables and hand tools. She makes the products herself, packages them and sells them outside of her home. She is an honest woman who uses her knowledge to get an income. She did not have the opportunity to go to school but she was raised with values and one of them is perseverance and the feeling of belonging to a family.

loans.use: to buy tables, utensils and vegetables.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte, 62, lives with her husband in their suburban home located in a little northern town. They applied for a loan because they want to build a fence around their house.

"Without having a fence around we are fully exposed to any intruders, and our town is known for the highest crime rate in the country and we are afraid," said Marte in the interview.

Marte and her husband both worked for a very long time as turners in a large furniture plant. With the closing of the plant after the collapse of the regime, her husband started teaching carpentry to youth and is earning about $2.30 per hour.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Khayrulo

texts.ru: Хайруло счастливый отец и дедушка. Ему 54 лет. Он из города Курган-Тюбе. У него два сына в возрасте 29 и 26. Хайруло не смотря на свой возраст, трудится, чтобы обеспечить семью. Он главарь семьи. Хайруло имеет собственный и не большой бизнес. Он занимается производством колыбель  и сундук. Хайруло 20 лет продвигает свой бизнес. Это ремесло ему принесет большой доход. Ему в работе помогает сыновья. Хайруло хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для расширения ему нужно больше доска. По это причине Хайруло запрашивает кредит. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите его!
texts.en:
Khayrulo is a happy father and grandfather. He is 54 years old. He is from the city of Qurgan-Tube. He has two sons of the ages of 29 and 26. Despite Khayrulo's age, he works in order to provide for his family. He is the head of the family.

Khayrulo has his own small business. He works with producing cradles and trunks. He has promoted this business for 20 years. His craft brings in a good income. His sons help him with the work.

Khayrulo would like to expand his business. For the expansion he needs material. For this reason he applied for a loan. He trusts in you and your support. Please help him!

loans.use: to purchase material and expand his business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Nenita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a fifty one old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in Cattle fattening which serves as his main source of income. Apart from the cattle, he also grows coffee and maize. He got his start up capital from these sources and they continue to serve him with extra income. He has responsibilities to pay school fees for his children and look after his family. Charles faces challenges with inadequate capital and unreliable herdsmen that impact his business. However, amidst all these challenges, he has a dream of building a good residential house and starting up another source of income with a retail shop.
He needs money to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Yarledis

texts.es:
Yarledis es una mujer de 25 años de edad que quiere salir adelante y luchar por sus ideales, es madre de dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad mujer y hombre respectivamente.
Vive en unión libre con su pareja, se dedica a prestar servicios de manicura y pedicura, ella está capacitada para prestar servicios de salón de belleza pero no cuenta con los implementos ni el dinero para comprarlo, por esta razón acude a la ayuda de los prestamistas Kiva, para comprar los insumos necesarios para conformar un salón de belleza en una habitación de su hogar.
Con el dinero quiere comprar una plancha profesional, un secador, vitrina, lava-cabezas, los artículos necesarios para consolidar su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Yarledis is a 25-year-old woman who wants to get ahead and fight for her ideals.She is the mother of two children, a girl and a boy, who are 7 and 3 years old respectively. She lives in a civil union with her partner.

Yarledis's occupation is providing manicure and pedicure services. She is also trained as a beautician but does not have the implements nor the money to buy them. This is why she is applying to Kiva lenders for help getting the supplies she needs to set up a beauty salon in a room in her house. With the money from the loan she will buy a professional hair straightening iron, a dryer, a display case, hair-washing sink, and the articles she needs to set up her salon.

loans.use: to buy a hair straightening iron, dryer, display case, hair-washing sink, and the items she needs to establish her beauty salon.

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer casada de 50 años de edad, la cual se dedica a preparar tortas, cupcakes, postres, los cuales elabora en su casa.
Ella inicio su profesión por hobby, también quería tener una actividad económica que le ayudara a satisfacer sus necesidades y deseos, en esta actividad no solo ha encontrado una forma honesta de ganar dinero, también felicidad y utilidad.
Actualmente la cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de postres y cubiertas, su motivo para realizar dicho curso dictado por la corporación Interactuar, es el deseo de aprender mucho más de la profesión, observar procesos y ver como puede ser más eficiente.
texts.en:
Patricia, 50, is a married woman who earns a living making cakes, cupcakes, and desserts in her home. She started her profession as a hobby. She also wanted to have a job to help satisfy her needs and desires. With this job she has found not only an honest way to earn money but also happiness and usefulness.

Currently the client is requesting a loan to pay for a course on desserts and frostings.

Her motivation for taking this course taught by Interactuar is the desire to learn a lot more about the profession, to observe procedures, and to learn how to be more efficient.

loans.use: to pay for a course on desserts and frostings

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 23 años de edad, una mujer luchadora que reside en la zona de Sincelejo, un sector de postconflicto, ella se dedica a la venta de mercancía, un negocio que inició buscando generar recursos para mantener a su hija de 1 año de edad.
Ella es muy consciente de que vive en una zona donde escasean los recursos, pero igual las personas deben vestirse y comprar artículos de aseo personal, pero ella quiere hacer todo más fácil para sus clientes ofreciéndole créditos a cortos plazos para que sus clientes puedan acceder a sus productos.
Sus principales sueños son pagar la educación de su hija, comprar vivienda y quiere lograrlo creciendo como empresaria y constituyendo un local comercial.
Rosa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía como bolsos para dama, accesorios, calzado y ropa juvenil.
texts.en:
Rosa is 23 years old. She is a driven young woman living in the Sincelejo area, a post-conflict zone. She works selling merchandise, and started her business in order to make enough income to support her one-year-old daughter.

She is very much aware that she lives in an area with few resources, but people still need to dress and to buy personal care items. She wants to make things easier for her customers by offering them short-term credit in order for them to be able to access her products.

Her main goals are to pay for her daughter's education and to buy a home. She wants to achieve this by growing as a business owner and setting up a retail store.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy merchandise like women's purses, accessories, shoes and clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like women's purses, accessories, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda is 48 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a seller in the market. Sevda is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the region of Fuzuli, but she is now settled in Baku city with her family. Sevda has been in the tailoring business for five years. She wants to buy cloth and other items to improve her business. Sevda has applied to Komak company and she needs a loan in the amount of 2200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for the loan.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other items to improve her business.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.ru: Айша 54 летняя жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Она мать двоих детей. У нее один сын и одна дочь. Детям 24 и 19 лет. Сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он зарабатывает и помогает маме обеспечить семью. Дочь Айшы учится в мед колледже. Она  хочет стать врачом и помочь людям. Сама Айша после потеря мужа, начала зарабатывать и кормить семью. Для каждого человека потеря любимого человека нелегко принять. Но Айша нашла себе силы жить дальше, ради своих детей. Айша занимается торговлей деятельностью. Она продает, суха фрукт, миндаль, фисташки и другие. Айша за счет дохода торговлей обеспечить семью. У  нее другого источник дохода нет. Айша решила перевозить больше, суха фрукт и фисташки на продажу. Это ей поможет расширить торговля и увеличиться товарооборот. Путем увеличения товарооборот увеличиться доход, и она сможет хорошо обеспечить семью.  С такими надеждами Айша обратилась к Вам в помощи.
texts.en:
Aysha is a 54 yeras old woman from the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is the mother of two children. She has one son and one daughter. The children are 24 and 19 years old. Her son is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. He earns money and helps his mother provide for the family. Aysha's daughter goes to medical college. She would like to become a doctor and help people.

After the loss of her husband, Aysha started earning money herself to feed the family. The loss of a loved one is not easy to accept for anyone. But Aysha found the strength to live on for her children's sake. Aysha works with retail. She sells dried fruits, almonds, pistachios and similar. She provides for the family based on the income from the business. She does not have any other source of income.

Aysha decided to bring in more dried fruits and pistachios for selling. This will allow her to expand her sales and increase the turnover. By increasing the turnover, her income will increase, and she will be able to support her family well. With such hopes, Aysha turned to you for help.

loans.use: to bring in dried fruits and pistachios to increase her turnover

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de Jornalero, además cuenta con una granja de pollos, lo cual el permite cumplir con la demanda alimentaría de su hogar. Él tiene 53 años de edad y vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 13 años de edad a la que apoya para que estudie. José desea invertir en más pollos, para cumplir con la demanda de productos que le son solicitados, por lo que pide un crédito a FUSAI con el cual comprará pollos, vitaminas y concentrado para su granja y venta de pollos.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking man to works offering his services as a day laborer. Additionally, he has a chicken farm, which allows him to fulfill the food demand of his home. He is 53 years old and lives with his life partner and his daughter, 13 years old whom he supports so that she can study.

José wishes to invest in more chickens to fulfill the demand of products that are requested from him, therefore he is applying for a loan from FUSAI with which he will buy chickens, vitamins and feed for his farm and selling chickens.

loans.use: to buy: chickens, vitamins and feed for his farm and selling chickens.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 33 years. He is married to Caren and together they have been blessed with three children.

He runs a retail shop as well as a tailor's shop, which he has done for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

Charles has requested his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 105,582 which he will use to purchase cloth for his tailor work.

With the anticipated profits, Charles will be able to live a better life and educate his children to higher levels.

His hopes and dreams for the future is to always move forward and not look back in his life, family and business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for his tailor work

loans.name: Resmeel

texts.en:
Today, internet and computer shop businesses are in great demand all over the world, especially in the Philippines.

Resmeel, a 25-year-old Filipino has successfully started his computer shop business to raise his family. He is a married man, and lives in the town of Calape, Bohol. Recently, he was focusing on how to improve his business for his family. He plans to add more computer sets in his shop to enhance his earnings and improve their living. To do this, he decided to ask for loan to buy a new computer set. In this way, he will be able to reach his goal of improving his business.

loans.use: to buy a new computer set.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a 30-year-old mother of two, whose spouse provides additional income. She runs a food kiosk in Mombasa and has been in this business for the last three years.

This is her first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase maize and wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, milk, beans and green grams. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her kiosk. 

Her hope is to educate her children for life.

loans.use: to purchase maize and wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, milk, beans and green grams

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una mujer de 54 años de edad la cual sale adelante y genera ingresos gracias a su negocio de confección a terceros, es una mujer que diariamente sale a trabajar en su negocio, busca sus clientes, es recursiva y muy pulida en sus trabajos.
Gracias a las buenas referencias que ha tenido la cliente, se le abren las puertas a buenos contratos pero para ello necesita una máquina fileteadora para poder cubrir toda la demanda de trabajo que tendrá.
Ella se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar dicha máquina, este  dinero se convertirá en el mayor impulso laboral que ha tenido.
Su principal sueño es generar empleo, motivar a madres cabeza de familia que monte negocio, y mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a 54 year old woman who gets ahead and generates income thanks to her business of sewing for third parties. She is a woman who goes out to work daily in her business. She searches for clients, is resourceful and very polished in her work. Thanks to the good references that the client has had, the doors open to good contracts but for that, she needs an overlock machine to be able to cover all of the demand of work that she will have.

She is found applying for a loan to buy said machine. She will convert this money in the greatest job boost that she's had. Her main dream is to generate employment, motivate mother heads of households to start a business, and improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine, this will open doors to business with companies.

loans.name: Ayse

texts.en:
Ayşe is married and a mother of two. She makes dolma, cookies and other food at home and sells it. She makes her food by filling orders. With the help of this loan, she is planning to buy oil, butter and rice in bulk for her homemade food. She wants to expand her business and open a small restaurant.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ayşe hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Ayşe hanım evde yaprak sarması, kurabiye, ev yemekleri yapıyor bunları sipariş alarak satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan yaprak yağ, pirinç alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak istiyor. Ayşe hanım işlerini geliştirerek dükkan açmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy oil, butter and rice in bulk..

loans.name: Everlides Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ella es Everlides, una mujer humilde, trabajadora, del municipio de Sampues, ella se dedica a la confección, inició con su negocio en el año 1980, tiene mucho tiempo en el mercado, donde se ha preocupado más por el sostenimiento de su familia y aunque no cuenta con una empresa muy grande es feliz con lo que produce ya que puede satisfacer sus necesidades.

Ella trabaja 12 horas diarias, elabora ropa por encargo y también tiene una línea de ropa para vender en su hogar, no le falta trabajo y mientras tenga salud espera seguir trabajando y dando lo mejor de sí para el beneficio de su familia.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para producir ropa, principalmente telas, broches y accesorios decorativos.
texts.en:
Everlides is a humble and hardworking woman from Sampues. She works as a seamstress and started her business in 1980. She has been in the market for a long time and has always worked hard in order to support her family. Even though her business is small, she is happy with what she makes because it allows her to meet her needs.

She works twelve hours a day sewing custom-made clothing. She also has a clothing line, which she sells at home. She has lots of work and, as long as she is healthy, she plans to keep on working and putting her best foot forward for her family's well-being.

This borrower is requesting this loan to buy materials for making clothing, mainly fabric, clasps, and decorative accessories.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies, mainly fabric, clasps, and decorative accessories.

loans.name: Fatbardha

texts.en:
Fatbardha needs your compassion and financial help. She and her three children have been living under very poor conditions.

"It's very cold inside this home and so very unhealthy for my kids. I have started working as a janitor in a nearby kindergarten, and thank God I did, however, the money is as little as $78/month. I also continue doing crochet and other craft work", Fatbardha said to the loan officer who visited her at home to see how she was doing. That was when she expressed her interest in another loan to help her make some very basic improvements to the home, according to the loan officer.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to her home where she lives with her three children under very poor conditions.

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
A seller of slippers since she was young, Grace acknowledges that she has learned about this business from her parents’ experiences. Her greatest obstacle is a dearth of funds for her business, but she remains confident that once her capital is bolstered, her profitability will see a positive impact. In the photo, Grace is the one holding shirts, smiling and standing near Mary, the other member of the group Dromo. The group is located at the teshei province of Ghana.
Grace seeks a loan to purchase more slippers to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe wants to pay for her husband's medical bills, as he was hospitalized. Bardhe is with her husband Preng in the photograph; they have two children, 24 and 21 years old. They live in great poverty in a village in the northern Albania.

Preng worked in the mining industry for a long time; he's been suffering the from extreme unhealthy working conditions ever since. In 1997 the Catholic Church built a little house for them on property given as a gift from some acquaintances.

Their financial situation is as follows: Preng receives an early retirement pension, social assistance, and assistance from some Catholic church. They need your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's medical expenses; he was treated in a hospital specializing in lung diseases.

loans.name: Ermine

texts.en: Ermine's mother-in-law passed away recently and she received money to cover the expenses from acquaintances and relatives.  She now has to pay them back.  This is why she is seeking your compassion and financial help.  Erminne is 47 and a married mother of two.  Her children are 27 and 23 and they live in the rural south east part of the country. All these past ten years, she's been doing agriculture; her family owns about 12 dynym of agricultural land where they mainly plant beans, wheat and corn.  The annual earnings from selling such produce is: beans-$460, wheat-$550 and corn-$230. Five years ago Ermine also started working in a nearby cow stable for a monthly pay of $190.

loans.use: to pay for her mother-in-law's funeral expenses.

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.ru: Умная и добрая учительница района Хамадони, Зумратби. Она любить обучать детей. Зумратби уже 20 лет работает учительницей в школе. Она еще после школы у себя во дворе занимается животноводством. Она трудолюбивая и жизнелюбивая мать. У Зумратби трое детей. Детям 21, 17 и 12 лет. У нее две дочери и один сын. Младшие дети учатся в средней школе. Старшая дочка студентка, она учится в университете в городе Душанбе. Ее дочь сейчас она учится на втором курс. Сама Зумратби образованная женщина, и хочет, чтобы ее дети стали образованными. Зумратби очень старается и помогает детям в учебе. Она хочет, оплатит годовой договор обучения дочери. К сожалению, у Зумратби нет денежных средств, и по этой причине она просит Вас, ее помочь финансовыми недостатками. Она очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This smart and good teacher from the Hamadoni region is Zumratbi. She loves to educate children. Zumratbi has worked as a school teacher for 20 years already. She also works with livestock breeding in her yard, after school hours.

Zumratbi is a hardworking and happy mother. She has three children. They are 21, 17 and 12 years old. She has two daughters and one son. The younger children go to secondary school. The eldest daughter is a student. She goes to the university in the city of Dushanbe. Zumratbi's daughter is currently in her second year of studies. Zumratbi is herself an educated woman, who would like her children to become educated too. She strives to help her children with their studies.

Zumratbi would like to pay the tuition for her daughter. Unfortunately she does not have enough money. For this reason she requests you to help her with her financial shortcomings. She needs your support very much.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Jihane

texts.en:
Jihane is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband; she is the mother of two young children still attending school. Her husband provides the main income source to satisfy the necessities of life; she is a housewife dedicated for her family.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. This is her seven loan from Kiva, and she states that the loan will surely help her to register them with the coming school year. Being able to do this makes her very happy and willing to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of two children, both of them still attending school. Her husband provides the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life: he owns a coffee shop in his town and he is doing well so far.

Despite their bad financial situation, Fatmeh is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s registration fees for the coming school year. Being able to do this makes her very happy and optimistic. This is her first loan, but she insists that she will be a permanent Kiva client since it will allow her to ensure a good education for her child.

loans.use: to pay her child’s registration fees for the coming school year.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband who works as an employee in a company;  he is responsible for the family's expenses and provides the main income source in the family, allowing them to live in a good lifestyle. In order to pay her technical school fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Her goal is to achieve higher positions and being able to find a respectful job in a good company to help her husband by earning an extra income.

loans.use: to pay her technical school fees.

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es: Manuel tiene 35 años de edad, él vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años y 6 meses de edad en casa de su propiedad la cual adquirió con mucho sacrificio. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente con 14 años de experiencia, por lo que es muy solicitado, además él se dedica a la venta de plátanos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plátanos por mayor para vender y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Manuel is 35 years old, and lives with his life partner and his two-and-a-half-year-old son in his own house which he acquired with great sacrifice.  He makes a living by offering his services as an independent bricklayer with 14 years of experience, for which he is highly sought after.  In addition to this, he makes a living selling bananas.  This is why he is soliciting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wholesale bananas to sell and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bananas to sell and earn a better income.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 47 años de edad, una persona sería y correcta la cual atiende todos los días una tienda de abarrotes, la típica tienda de barrio, inició su negocio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, le gusta estar cerca de casa y manejar sus propios tiempos, pero lo que más le motiva es saber que todo esfuerzo, toda idea, todo sacrificio lo hace por su propio negocio.
Aprendió solo, se le ocurrió la idea y la materializo, es un hombre que no solo sueña que lucha por sus ideales y deseos y que ahora tiene como meta comprar una vivienda.
La temporada de diciembre es una época especial, no solo pro compartir en familia, en términos económicos representa el mes mal alto de ventas y quiere aprovechar todas las ganancias para expandir su local, por ello solicita un préstamo para abastecerse de un completo surtido de víveres, abarrotes, refrescos, productos lácteos, carnes frías, granos cervezas, frutas y verduras.
Espera tener unas excelentes ventas con las cuales pueda ampliar su negocio y estar al día con la deuda.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 47 year old man, a serious and correct person who tends to a grocery store every day, the typical store of the neighborhood. He started his business for fun and vocation to independent work. He likes to be close to the house and maintain his own hours, but what motivates him most is knowing that all effort, every idea, every sacrifice he makes he does for his own business. He learned by himself, the idea occurred to him and it materialized. He is a man who not only dreams of fighting for his ideals and desires and now has as a goal to buy a home.

The December season is a special time, not only for sharing in the family, in economic terms it represents the highest month of sales and he wants to take advantage of all of the profits to expand his storefront. This is why he's applying for a loan to

loans.use: to stock a complete assortment of food, snacks, sodas, dairy products, cold cuts, grains, beer, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a fisherman. He has been doing this for 13 years to raise his family and support their needs. He has an eight year old daughter to support and his partner takes good care of her.

In spite of the obstacles that Ramon encountered in his life, he was still determined to continue. With this in mind, he needs an amount to buy fishing nets. Part of the loan amount will be used to repair his fishing boat, specifically, he will buy plywood and paint. In this way, he will be able to keep his fishing boat in good condition and be able to improve his catch with his new fishing net.

Additionally, 49 year old Ramon plans to improve his livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair his fishing boat; specifically he will buy plywood and paint.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado y está acompañado, su esposa atiende un negocio en el mercado de la ciudad, tiene tres hijos, pero solo dos viven con ellos porque están estudiando.

Rafael, trabaja como motorista de camiones desde hace 5 años, aprendió este trabajo gracias a un amigo que le consiguió una oportunidad para trabajar de esa manera; aparte de eso también vende bebidas en el mercado de la ciudad, su lugar de trabajo está a una hora de distancia y viaja en bus.

Rafael, necesita el préstamo para comprar bebidas y granos básicos para incrementar su negocio, el préstamo mejorara sus ventas porque tendrá más mercadería.

Rafael, sueña con tener su propio camión y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Rafael, 33 years old, studied until seventh grade and is partnered. His wife tends to a business in the market of the city. She has three children, but only two live with them because they are studying. Rafael has worked as a truck driver for the past 5 years. He learned this work thanks to a friend that got him the opportunity to work in this manner. Apart from this, he also sells drinks in the market of his city. His place of work is one hour of distance and he travels by bus.

Rafael needs the loan to buy drinks and basic grains to increase his business. The loan will increase his sales because he will have more merchandise. Rafael dreams of having his own truck and that his business grows.

loans.use: to buy drinks and basic grains to increase his business.

loans.name: Dashiru

texts.en:
Dashiru is a maize farmer from Galadima village. As a Babban Gona member, Dashiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dashiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dashiru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize; he hopes for a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dashiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Dashiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Markus is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Markus will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Markus ca achieve his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alejandro Esteban

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 26 años de edad que diariamente se levanta a primera hora del día a trabajar en sus cultivos, los terrenos con los que cuenta son el fruto de sus esfuerzos de toda la vida, trabajando desde que era menor de edad para juntar dinero y tener su propio negocio.
Ahora que es empresario independiente y más maduro y experimentado en el tema, lucha por subsistir y encontrar clientes que adquieran sus productos a un precio justo.
Este humilde joven tiene como deseo ayudar a su madre, devolverle de alguna manera todo ese sacrificio y esfuerzo para criarlo y enseñarle los valores y ética con la cual ha formado un carácter.
Actualmente Alejando se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas para darle mantenimiento a sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 26-year-old man who gets up at the crack of dawn every day to care for his crops. The fields he owns are the fruit of his life-long efforts, working ever since he was a little boy to scrape together money and have his own business.

Now that he is an independent entrepreneur and more mature and experienced in the field, he struggles to survive and to find customers to buy his products at a fair price. This humble young man wishes to help his mother and pay her back in some way for all her sacrifice and effort in raising him and teaching him the values and ethics that have shaped his character.

Currently Alejandro is asking for a loan so he can buy fertilizer, irrigation, pesticide, and fungicide to maintain his fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation, pesticide, and fungicide to care for his fields.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Hannah. She is 37 years old, married and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

She grows maize, beans and potatoes as her main business. She has benefited much from training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise and financial management. This has enabled her to improve her budgeting, planning and record keeping.

Hannah is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seed. This will increase her yield resulting in more profits that will help meet her family's needs and manage her business well.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as. fertilizer and seed to increase her farm yield.

loans.name: Muong Phang 41 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chung, 32, is a Thai woman. She is married and has two children: a 12-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl, both of whom attend school full-time. She lives with her husband and her children in a traditional Thai house in a small village where people mainly rely on agricultural production for a living. Like other villagers, Mrs. Chung and her husband work hard at farming and animal husbandry, undertaking several activities, such as growing rice and raising pigs, chickens and ducks. This is the second time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs. She hopes that with the technical support of the agricultural workers, her production will go well, which will help her obtain a good income. Mrs. Chung dreams that her family will have a more sufficient life and her children will grow healthily, study well and have a bright future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Jane. She is thirty years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to learn and gain more experience in enterprise start up and development. She also learnt financial management skills which have helped her manage her finances prudently.

She does maize and potatoes farming to earn a living. She is taking a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her to increase her income and improve her business to be in a position to educate her children.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and lenders for the help and support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds that will improve her business and enable her to increase her income.

loans.name: Rabea

texts.en: Rabea is 36, married, and has 4 children. He has a small fattening project and makes cheese and butter. Rabea's wife helps him in the project by selling the products in the local market. He is requesting 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand his project and increase his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Gamalat

texts.en: Gamalat is 55, widowed, and has five children. Her late husband's pension income is very small and cannot cover the family's monthly expenses. She has a small clothing business and is requesting a 4,000 EGP loan to buy winter clothing to increase her sales this season and cover her family's monthly expenses.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru: Зебогул  живет и работает в Хуросоне. Там же у нее муж и дети. Ее дети учатся. Зебогул 49 лет. Она работает сама на себя, Зебогул разводит скотин. Она успевает, и заняться хозяйством и работой на скотном дворе. Работа с животными не легкий труд, но она не боится трудностей и дети ей помогают. Зебогул решила увеличить количество скотин. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Zebogul lives and works in Khuroson. So do her husband and children. Her children study. Zebogul is 49 years old. She works by herself; she breeds livestock. She manages both the household and working in the livestock yard.

Working with livestock is not easy, but Zebogul is not afraid of difficulties and her children help her. She decided to increase the number of livestock. For this reason she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to increase her herd

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de jornalero, además cuenta con una pequeña venta de elotes, la cual realiza muy feliz, ya que obtiene mejores ingresos económicos. Él vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos a los que apoya para que estudien y tengan una vida diferente. José desea invertir en más elotes por mayor, al no contar con la liquidez económica ha decidido solicitar a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: elotes por mayoreo para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard-working man who works as a day-laborer. He also has a small business selling corn on the cob for which he is very happy since he gets a better economic income. He lives with his life partner and three children whom he supports so that they can go to school and have a different life.

Jose wishes to invest in more corn on the cob wholesale. Since he does not have the financial capital, he has decided to ask for a FUSAI loan to buy corn on the cob wholesale so that he can fulfill the requests of his customers.

loans.use: to buy corn on the cob wholesale in order to fulfill the requests of his customers

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
La señora Deysi  de 47  años de edad , vive con su esposo tiene un  hijo  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace unos  06 años a la venta de abarrotería, también vende cosméticos y plásticos.
Doña Deysi su esposo se dedica a la actividad de pesca y le apoya económicamente  sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan y también los miembros de su iglesia, es una mujer trabajadora y bien humilde tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Doña Deysi está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra  de plásticos como vasos, tambos, platos, cosméticos, etc. porque viene la época de navidad y desea surtir su negocio, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos es su decimo  préstamo que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Deysi is 47 years old and lives with her husband. She has one dependent child. They live in a community in San Lorenzo, in Honduras' southern valley. She has her own home and for the past six years or so she has been working selling groceries, as well as cosmetics and plastics.

Deysi's husband is a fisherman and supports her financially. Her customers are mainly friends, people who come to her daily, and members of her church. She is a hardworking and humble woman, and she is very driven to get ahead.

Deysi is requesting this loan to buy plastic products like cups, plates, and barrels, as well as cosmetics, etc. The holiday season is approaching and she wants her business to be well stocked. She expects this loan to allow her to improve her income. It is her tenth loan through Prisma.

Her dreams are to improve her home and her business.

loans.use: to buy cups, plates, barrels, cosmetics, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. Her husband owns an electrical shop and he is the main income provider. Since she doesn't work, she focuses on her family and kids. 

Currently, her goal is to pay her children's study fees, so she is requesting a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She hopes to be a permanent customer and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children: this is the family's only goal.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children, all of whom are still studying. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to enhance their standard of living: he owns a furniture shop. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
Merceditha is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Merceditha has been in this business for 18 years. Merceditha earns additional income from raising pigs and her general store.

Merceditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dreams are to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Wilhelmina has been in this business for seven years. Wilhelmina earns additional income from food vending.

Wilhelmina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has been blessed with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years she has operated a farming business, selling at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of competition and water shortage in her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and hire more laborers for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and hire more laborers for her business.

loans.name: Edwin Esau

texts.es:
Edwin, de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, creció con sus padres, está casado, tiene 1 hijo de un año.

Edwin, se levanta temprano para ordeñar las vacas y luego sale hacía las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana; mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen.

Edwin, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, porque desea incrementar la producción de leche para percibir más ingresos.

Edwin, sueña con tener más ganado de ordeño y comprar un terreno donde poder pastarlos su ganado y dedicarse a la producción de lácteos.
texts.en:
Edwin, 23, is a farmer with crops and animals. He grew up with his parents, he's married and has a one-year-old son.

Edwin wakes up early to milk the cows and then he goes out to his parcels of land where he works all morning; his wife takes care of domestic chores and takes care of the cows they have.

Edwin is requesting this loan to buy a cow because he wants to increase milk production in order to generate more income.

Edwin dreams of having more dairy cattle and buying land for his cows to go pasture and then dedicate himself to the production of dairy products.

loans.use: buy a cow because he'd like to increase milk production in order to generate more income.

loans.name: Zuberu

texts.en:
Zuberu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Zuberu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zuberu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zuberu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Zuberu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Zuberu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Matea

texts.es: María, de 55 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez, quien tiene 2 hijos y vive en un sector del municipio de Choloma Cortes junto a su hija mayor. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas para fiestas desde hace 6 años, elabora variedad de diseños de dibujos animados. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y vende el producto en el mercado local y tiendas por pedidos. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos en la institución para mantener el negocio. Actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 Lempiras para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas como ser papel china de colores, pegamentos y alambre.  Con lo cual va suplir los pedidos pendientes que tiene con sus clientes y va obtener mas ganancias. Su meta es poder salir adelante con el negocio expandirse mas en el mercado y apoyar económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 55 years old, is a single mother by being widowed who has two children and lives in a sector of the Choloma Cortes municipality, along with her eldest daughter. She has worked making and selling piñatas for parties for the past 6 years. She makes a variety of designs and cartoons. She carries out this activity in her house and sells the product in the local market and in stores by order.

She has applied for various loans in the institution to maintain the business. Currently, she is applying for another for 20,000 Lempiras to buy materials for making piñatas like colored tissue paper, glues and wire. With which, she will fill the pending orders that she has with her customers and will obtain more profits. Her goal is to be able to get ahead with the business, growing herself more in the market and supporting her family economically.

loans.use: to buy materials like colored tissue paper, glues and wire for making piñatas.

loans.name: Makawo

texts.en:
Makawo is a maize farmer from Hana Aiki village. As a Babban Gona member, Makawo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Makawo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Makawo can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Makawo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Makawo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршеду из Шахритуса очень нужно купить машину, поэтому он просит кредит. Ему 26 лет, да и он начинающий таксист. У таксистов верный друг-товарищ и средство дохода - это машина. У Хуршеда есть жена и ребенок, и ему нужно найти определенный источник дохода и не искать кратковременные места работы. Хуршед может купить машину, зарабатывать и приносить в дом источник дохода. У него на сегодняшний день нет другого выгода, Вы можете сейчас поддержать этого джентльмена.
texts.en:
Khurshed, from Shahrituz, very much needs to purchase a vehicle. For this reason he applies for a loan. He is 26 years old and he is starting up as a taxi driver. A taxi driver's loyal friend and means of income - it is his vehicle.

Khushed has a wife and a child. He needs to find a source of income and not a short-term job. He will purchase a vehicle, earn money and bring a source of income to his home. Currently he doesn't have any other option. You may currently help this gentleman.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to provide a taxi service

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She cooperates with her husband, who is the main income source in the family, to help him with extra income. He works as a soldier in the Lebanese army and, as per her, she works from home as a private teacher in her town. 

Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children's school registration fees. She wants to provide them with a good education and ensure a safe future for them.

loans.use: to pay her children's school registration fees.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ramona es una mujer humilde de 42 años de edad que se dedica a prestar servicios de confección a terceros, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos adolescentes, se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora, buscando agilizar sus tiempos de producción y poder recibir mayor cantidad de mercancía.
Su propósito en la vida es trabajar arduamente para sacar su familia adelante, gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ramona is a humble 42-year-old woman who works providing sewing services to third parties. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her spouse and their two teenage children.

She is requesting this loan to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to increase production efficiency, since working faster will allow her to receive more merchandise.

Her purpose in life is to work hard and provide for her family, so that she can support her children in their education and they can all have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Hasene

texts.en:
Hasene is a mother of four, and her husband is deceased. She is making pickles and tomato sauce at home as well as making crafts and selling them. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulk quantities of flour, yogurt, tomatoes, peppers, and braid rope to make pickles and sauces, sell them, and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hasene hanım dört çocuk annesi eşi vefat etmiş. Hasena hanım evde tarhana, turşu, dometes sosları ve elişleri yaparak satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile de un, yoğurt, domates, biber ve örgü ipi alarak üreterek satış yapmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, yoghurt, tomatoes, pepper, and braid rope.

loans.name: Noe Lisandro

texts.es:
Noé, de 58 años de edad, creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron todo acerca de la agricultura y la ganadería, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos.

Noé, trabajan en las parcelas que alquila; junto a su pareja e hijos se dedican a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar las vacas que poseen y en la tarde él hace viajes en un vehículo para generar ingresos adicionales para el sustento de su familia.

Noé, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras para producir leche y que su esposa elabore queso para vender en los alrededores y entre los vecinos.

Noé, sueña con comprar un terreno donde sembrar y pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Noé, 58, grew up with his parents, who taught him everything about agriculture and animal husbandry. He studied up to grade 9, he has a partner and two children.

Noé works on the parcels of land that he rents; his partner and children take care of the domestic chores and the milking of the cows they own. In the evening, he makes trips in his car in order to generate additional income to support his family.

Noé is requesting this loan to buy two dairy cows for milk production and so his wife can make cheese to sell around their area and to neighbors.

Noé dreams of buying land where he can plant crops and put his animals out to pasture.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows for milk production.

loans.name: Melahat

texts.en:
Melahat is married and a mother of two. She is making local börek at home by getting orders and making a contribution to the family budget. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulks of flour, butter and eggs. She will make börek, sell them and make money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Melahat hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Evden sipariş alarak yöresel börek yaparak satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamış. Aldığı mikro kredi ile de börek malzemesi un, yağ, yumurta toptan alarak üreterek satışlarını yaparak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and eggs

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is 25, single and has a small fattening project. In his project, he fattens and sells calves and makes cheese, butter and milk in the market. He takes care of and is financially responsible for his aging mother.

Youssef is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand his project and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Shaáibu

texts.en:
Shaáibu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shaáibu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Shaáibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shaáibu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Shaáibu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 44, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a laborer and his income is very small so he cannot cover the family's monthly expenses. Amal has a small poultry project and is requesting 3000 EGP loan to buy birds such as chickens, ducks and geese to increase her sales and improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: To buy birds such as chickens, ducks and geese.

loans.name: Jormoh Group

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells bags and used cloths. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use a portion of loan to buy more stock of bags and cloths to improve profitability. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. This is her fourth loan with ID-Ghana. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

She is the group leader of jormoh which means peace.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags and cloths to increase profitability.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana es una mujer admirable que a sus 34 años de edad se dedica a atender su tienda de productos básicos desde hace 3 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindar lo necesario a su familia gracias a ello. Ella habita junto a sus 3 hijos y su esposo en vivienda propia desde hace 9 años. Ana desea invertir en zapatos y sandalias, por mayoreo para vender en la época navideña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar zapatos y sandalias por mayoreo para vender en su tienda en época navideña.
texts.en:
Ana is an admirable woman who works running a general store. She is 34 years old and has been in business for three years. She is happy to be able to provide for her family by working. She lives with her three children and her husband in a home they bought nine years ago.

Ana wants to invest in wholesale shoes and sandals, which she will sell at her store during the holiday season. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to do so.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes and sandals for the holiday season.

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es: David a sus 22 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de diferentes verduras y hortalizas, además de granos básicos, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con este negocio y sostener a su familia. Él vive con su madre y su grupo familia desde hace varios años, y es ella el motivo de su esfuerzo, ya que él le brinda todo su apoyo. David desea invertir en insumos para cultivar sus productos, lo cual le ha sido difícil, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: fertilizantes, abono y semillas para sus cultivos de jícama, maíz, frijol, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
David, at 22 years old, makes a living by growing different vegetables in addition to basic grains. He is very happy to be able to count on this business and to support his family. For several years he has lived with his mother and family group, and she is the reason for his effort because he offers her his full support.

David wishes to invest in the supplies to grow his products, which has been difficult. For this reason he solicits a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in fertilizer, compost, and seeds for his crops of jicama, corn, and beans, among others.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, compost, and seeds for his crops of jicama, corn, and beans, among others.

loans.name: Nermine

texts.en:
Nermine is an 18-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband with no children. Due to the bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband, who represents the main income provider in the family, in order to offer him additional financial support.

She opened a clothing shop in 2013, where she offers a great variety of clothes for men at good prices.

Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business, and therefore her income by a good percentage.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira de 46  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo y sus hijos  en su casa  propia,  se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, también vende tortillas y sus clientes son personas de la zona que tienen muchos años de comprarle sus productos.
Doña Elvira vive en un municipio de Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Doña Elvira está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como arroz, café, azúcar, huevos, pan, queso, harina, café, etc.  para surtir un poco mas su negocio y mejorar sus ventas,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo  mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientela para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in their own home. She has worked for 5 years selling groceries. She also sells tortillas and her customers are people from the area who have been buying her products for many years.

Elvira lives in the municipality of Choluteca in southern Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to more forward and strives every day in order to improve her quality of life.

Elvira is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as rice, coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, cheese, flour etc. in order to stock up her business a bit and improve her sales. With the support of this loan she will try to buy products wholesale and obtain better prices. At the same time, it will improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a client who wishes to continue working with Prisma.

Her dream is to grow her business and to have more customers in order to be able to improve her income and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, cheese, flour etc. for her business

loans.name: Ongemuiten Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jane. She is a member of the Ongemuiten Women Group. She is 37 years old with 4 children.
She practices maize and beans farming, and runs a salon along with selling cosmetics. 

Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings and enterprise development, she is able to run her business more effectively. She is borrowing a loan from kiva to use in purchasing cosmetics  for her salon business that will help to improve her productivity and hence to support her family. 

She is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand for the support, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics that will  help improve service delivery in her salon.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesús es un orgulloso campesino, arriero de pura cepa, nació y espera morir en el campo, trabajando desde primera hora, hasta que se oculta el sol.
Jesús quiere trabajar hasta que su salud se lo permite y esas ganas siguen intactas, ama lo que hace y llevar a la plaza un producto de calidad para el consumo.
Este luchador y pujante hombre solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos, con los cuales realizará el mantenimiento a sus terrenos, como abonos, riegos, pesticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en:
Jesús is a proud farmer, a pure-bred mule driver. He was born in the country and expects to die there, working from early in the morning until the sun sets.

Jesús wants to work as long as his health allows and he still has the desire. He loves what he does and he loves to take a quality product to market for consumption.

This persevering and energetic man is requesting a loan to buy inputs to maintain his land: soil amendments, sprinklers, pesticide, and fungicide.

loans.use: to pay for soil amendments, irrigation, pesticide, and fungicide to take care of his crops

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 21-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband, and mother of an only child.

Her husband is the main income source in the family. He works very hard to always be able to fulfill the family needs and live in a good lifestyle. She is a housewife and focusing on her university only.
