Today, in order to pay her university registration fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She said that her target is to achieve higher positions and be able to support her husband financially.

loans.use: to pay her university registration fees.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene una venta de productos básicos en la que vende diversidad de productos de uso diario, por lo que tiene mucha clientela, además presta sus servicios en una empresa obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. Él cuenta con 74 años de edad y vive con su esposa y su hija de 26 años de edad en casa propia. Humberto desea invertir en productos para su tienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: embutidos, lácteos, cereales, golosinas entre otros productos para la tienda.
texts.en:
Humberto, 74, lives in his own home with his wife and his daughter, 26.

He has a store where he sells a variety of basic products for daily consumption, so he has a lot of customers. He also provides services to a company to earn more income.

Humberto's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in products for his store, including cold cuts, dairy products, grains, and candy.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts, dairy products, grains, candy, and other products for his store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven de 21 años de edad que con el ánimo de apoyar incondicionalmente a su madre en todo aspecto, principalmente el económico quiere solicitar por primera vez en su vida para incentivar e impulsar su actividad de cría de animales y cultivos.
Él es el llamado a continuar las raíces campesinas de su familia, lo hace con gusto y espera mejorar la producción para gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
Para él sería un enorme beneficio tener el apoyo de todos, ya que no tener historial crediticio y ser una persona del campo le dificulta para lograr ayuda.
Roberto si recibe tu sí, invertirá el dinero en insumos agropecuarios, en pollos y alimento de engorde.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young man of 21 years of age with the desire to unconditionally support his mother in all aspects, principally economic. He is requesting a loan for the first time in his life as an incentive and to impulse his business of animal husbandry and agriculture.

He is the one who is chosen to continue the farmer roots of his family. He does it with gusto and hopes to improve production in order to enjoy a better quality of life.

For him, it would be a great benefit to his family to have the support of everyone because having no credit history and being a country person make it difficult to get help.

If Roberto receives your support, he'll invest the loan in agricultural items, chickens and food for fattening.

loans.use: buy agricultural items, chickens and food for fattening.

loans.name: David Alexis

texts.es:
David es un campesino de 27 años de edad, un orgulloso agricultor del producto más emblemático de Colombia, el café, heredo sus cultivos de sus familiares, fue su madre quien lo entrego, capacito y le entrego las tierras que ahora con tanto orgullo y nobleza trabaja. 
David es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja para su familia, por expandir sus terrenos, por vivir mejor, por ampliar sus terrenos es su único propósito y en el cual dará cuerpo y alma en el trabajo para lograrlo.
El cliente solicita un préstamo para comprar abonos para sus cultivos e insumos para preparar uno nuevos, ya que todo su proceso es por ciclos para tener cosecha durante todo el año.
texts.en:
David is a 27-year-old peasant. He is a proud farmer of the most symbolic product of Colombia: coffee. He inherited his crops from his family; it was his mother who gave it to him. She trained him and gave him the land that he now works with much pride and nobility.

David is single and has no children. He works for his family, to expand their land, and to live better. This is his only goal, and he puts his body and soul into the work in order to achieve it.

He is soliciting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for his crops and the supplies to prepare a new one, since his entire process is in cycles for harvesting throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance and beginning of coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Hugo De Jesus

texts.es:
Buscando salir adelante, darle una mejor calidad de vida el señor Hugo monto un negocio de cafetería, en el año 2005, ya que tenía una avanzada edad y se ponía bastante tedioso lograr un empleo.
Para Hugo lo más importante era generar ingresos para alimentar a su familia, peor no quería subsistir y ese negocio que montó ha significado grandes cosas en su hogar, viven, comen mejor, tiene una mejor salud, múltiples beneficios que espera seguir teniendo pues luchara diariamente por mejorar como empresario y tener esa tienda abierta para sus clientes.
Hugo se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecerse de surtido de cafetería para atender la demanda de diciembre, café, leche, bebidas, comidas preparas, snacks, bebidas alcohólicas entre otros.
texts.en:
In an effort to get ahead, and provide himself a better quality of life, señor Hugo set up a snack bar business in 2005. He was getting on in years and it was getting pretty tiresome to find employment.
For Hugo the most important thing was to generate income to feed his family. Even worse he didn't want to just subsist, and this business that he started has meant grand things to his household. They live and eat better, he's in better health; he hopes to continue having these multiple benefits and to that end he will struggle daily to improve as a businessperson and to keep the store open for his clients.
Hugo is requesting a loan to stock up on snack bar inventory to meet December demand: coffee, milk, beverages, prepared foods, snacks and alcoholic beverages among other things.

loans.use: to stock up with store inventory to serve demand in December.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años de edad, tiene tres hijos adolescentes, es una ama de casa amorosa, responsable y atento tanto con sus hijos como con su esposo, le fascina la cocina, es su hobby, sorprende a sus familiares con ricas preparaciones que aprende en la televisión o algunas por inventiva.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de cocina express, quiere capacitarse y así sorprender a su familia con delicioso aperitivos y comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and has three teenage children. She is a loving and responsible homemaker, attentive to her children as well as her husband. She is fascinated by cooking, which is her hobby. She surprises her family with delicious preparations, which she learns from television or sometimes makes up herself.

This borrower is currently requesting a loan in order to pay for an express cooking course. She wants to complete it in order to surprise her family with delicious appetizers and quick meals.

loans.use: to pay for an express cooking course.

loans.name: Roxana Zuleyma

texts.es:
Roxana, de 20 años de edad, es una joven mujer muy trabajadora, está acompañada y vive con su pareja en una casa muy sencilla, ellos aun no tiene hijos pero esperan muy pronto tener un bebé. 

Roxana, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero anteriormente trabajo como empleada en un basar de ropa, es por eso que ahora ella ha pensado en comprar ropa y vender para está temporada de fin de año y de esa manera generar ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su pareja. 

Roxana, necesita el préstamo para compra ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella quiere aprovechar esta época del año porque sabe que existe mucha demanda. 

Los sueños de Roxana, son tener su propio bazar de ropa y ser madre.
texts.en:
Roxana, 20, is a very hardworking young woman. She's in a common-law relationship and she and her partner live in a very modest house. They don't have children yet but they hope to have a baby very soon.

Roxana's a homemaker but she used to work as an employee in a clothing store. That's why now she's planning to buy clothing to sell during this end-of-the-year season to earn some income to cover her needs and her partner's.

Roxana needs the loan to buy clothing for women, men, and children. She wants to make the most of this season of the year because she knows there's a lot of demand.

Roxana's dreams are to have her own clothing store and to be a mother.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis enrique es un hombre honorable, responsable, un padre amoroso y buen esposo, se dedica a las actividades del campo, cultiva café, gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos para la alimentación y progreso de su amada familia.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abonar esos hermosos campos de café, todo el dinero será para comprar abonos y pagar la respectivas mano de obra para aplicar el producto.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is an honorable and responsible man, a loving father, and a good husband. He works in the fields, growing coffee. This business allows him to make enough income to feed and support his family, whom he loves very much.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to fertilize his beautiful coffee crops. All of the money will go towards buying the fertilizer and paying laborers to apply the product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina, 39, is shown here with Martin, her husband and the father of their five children. The two older ones are studying in public universities, one for social work and the other one for psychology.

The reason they are requesting this loan is that they want to build a stable for their animals. "Our animals now live all together and in a very little space, causing danger sometimes for the little ones, piglets or calves," said Rozina to the loan officer who disbursed the loan to her.

They have 18,000 square meters of land. Part of it they plant in seasonal veggies, corn and fodder for the animals. They also have some orchards, and the rest is used for grazing the animals.

Currently, they have two dairy cows with calves, two sows/pigs with piglets and also 30 chickens. Their family earnings come mainly from their rural activity in addition to Martin's pay of $360/month working in a nearby hydro-central.

In the background you see the primitive stable that they want to rebuild properly.

loans.use: to build a stable for their animals

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bello has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bello would have had to sell his maize at harvest (a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market) to meet his immediate cash needs with food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bello can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bello will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Bello is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gladis Anita

texts.es:
La señora Gladis Anita  tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 2  hijos y vive con su esposo en una comunidad  de Trojes, al oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y zapatos.
Doña Gladis Anita  cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de su negocio y es una persona muy responsable y respetada por su buen comportamiento y atención a sus clientes.
Doña  Gladis Anita  esta  solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc. para tener mercadería porque se viene la temporada navideña y vende mucho para esa fecha.
Doña  Gladis Anita  espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y le ayude a mejorar su calidad de vida, uno de sus sueños es crecer con su negocio y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Gladis Anita is 39 years old and a mother of two. She and her husband live in a community in Trojes, in eastern Honduras. Her main business is selling clothing and shoes. She has lots of experience running her business and is a very responsible person. She is well respected for her her good attitude and customer service.

Gladis Anita is requesting this loan to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. The holiday season is approaching and she wants to have plenty of merchandise, because she makes lots of sales this time of year.

Gladis Anita expects this loan to allow her to keep her business going and help her improve her quality of life. Her main goal is for her business to grow so that she can provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, su pareja se dedica al cuidado de su familia y él es agricultor. 

Oscar, desde pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre; la pobreza en la que vivía lo obligó a emigrar a Estados Unidos para buscar un mejor futuro para su familia, pero desde hace seis años está de regreso y trabaja en la agricultura con su esposa y sus hijos, el lugar donde siembra está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y su medio de transporte es un caballo.

Oscar, necesita el préstamo para comprar toretes de repasto, para obtener algunas ganancias extras. 

Oscar, sueña con tener mucho ganado y tener una pequeña hacienda; además desea que sus hijos se gradúen y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Oscar is 39 years old. He went to school up to the ninth grade. He is in a relationship and has three children. His wife works caring for the family and he is a farmer.

Since he was young, Oscar has worked in agriculture and ranching. He learned this work from his father. Due to the poverty in which he was living, he emigrated to the United States in order to search for a better future for his family. However, he has been back now for six years and he works in agriculture with his wife and children. The area that he farms is 1 kilometer from his house and his method of transportation is a horse.

Oscar needs the loan to buy young grazing bulls to obtain some extra income.

Oscar dreams of having a lot of cattle and a small ranch. He also wishes that his children graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy young grazing bulls in order to obtain some extra income

loans.name: Ozlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married and has one child. She is a housewife and wants to work to gain economic freedom. Wanting her own workspace, she opened a small textile shop with the support of her husband five years ago. She began selling lingerie. With her husband's investment she moved to a store in the provincial capital and continued her work. With her first loan, she'll buy pre-made textile products. This loan will help her expand her range of products, which she thinks will help attract more customers. Her dream is to expand her business into production and help her children get a good education.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Özlem hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Ev hanımı olan Özlem Hanım çalışmak, ekonomik özgürlüğünü kazanmak istemiş. Kendine ait bir iş yeri olmasını isteyince eşinin desteği ile beş yıl önce küçük bir tekstil dükkanı açmış. İç giyim satışına başlamış. Eşinin tayini ile geldikleri ilçeye dükkanını taşımış ve burada işine devam ediyor. Aldığı ilk kredi ile hazır tekstil ürünleri alacak. Bu kredi ürün yelpazesinin genişlemesini sağlayacak, çeşitlilikle müşterilerinin artacağını düşünüyor. Hayali işini daha da büyütüp imalatçılık yapmak ve çocuğunun iyi bir eğitim almasını sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy clothing products.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Bitrus can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bitrus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Bitrus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kurongeka Group

texts.en:
As Zimbabwe approaches summer, the weather can be brutally hot. For many, it is a time of happiness, as children can be seen playing or gathering in the shade, hiding from the intense sun.

One woman however, is more interested in working and not even taking any precaution against the hot weather. Her focus is to do the best she can for her children. She was always there when they took their first steps, as they walked unsteadily across the floor, all along encouraging and guiding them until they walked out of the door.

Winifilda, far left in the photo, has a smile that can brighten any moment. She is a member of the Kurongeka group, a vernacular name that means ‘to be well on plan’. The group has three super working mothers who developed strong ties from their church.

Winifilda raises chickens at her homestead in Chitungwiza and has 20 years specializing in the same business. She has been the pillar in her marriage as she helped her husband to send their children to boarding schools and to build their own house.

Winifilda has a big, well demarcated foul run with a capacity for 300 birds. She wants money from Thrive so that she can have birds at different stages. She is hopeful of having her own butchery for chickens in the near future. She has been more than grateful to receive training at Thrive Microfinance and has promised to bring other ladies so that they can receive the same benefits.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed to expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Karogoe Ukweli Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of Karogoe Ukweli Women Group. He is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

Joseph does maize and beans farming that he sells at a kiosk. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his crop farming business. He is now able to get more profits out of his business unlike before. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to start a poultry keeping business. This will improve his income so he is in a position to educate his children and provide for his family's needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks for poultry farming.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 33, single, and has one brother who works as a laborer. His father is a construction materials porter.

Ashraf has a small grocery store project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta and oil.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as rice, pasta and oil.

loans.name: Josselin Jazmin

texts.es: Josselin es una joven emprendedora que tiene 25 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de pollo, carne y lácteos, lo que le permite llevar el sustento a sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera y vive con sus hijos en casa de su propiedad. Ella desea invertir en su negocio, ya que cada día cuenta con más clientes, por lo anterior solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en pollo, embutidos, carnes, entre otros productos solicitados para vender.
texts.en: Josselin is a young 25-year-old entrepreneur.  She works selling chicken, meat and dairy products which allows her to support her children since she is a single mother.  She lives with her children in her own home.  She wishes to invest in her business since every day she has more customers.   Thus, she is requesting a FUSAI loan which she will invest in chicken, cold meats, meat and other requested products to sell.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cold meats, meat and other requested products to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
In her late 30s, Joyce is married and has three schooling children. She has been running a poultry business since 2003. Working from 8 am to 8:30 pm daily, she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, now fully repaid, to increase her number of chicks and buy medicine and feed for them. Happy with the loan, she used the resulting profit to pay school fees for her kids, repay the loan and cover household expenses. Joyce will use this loan to purchase more chicks and feed for them.

Joyce dreams of buying a sewing machine and opening a tailoring business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Edelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Edelyn has been raising livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en:
Mayranush is 53 years old and she lives in Ddmashen village of the Gegharkunik region. She has a high pedagogical education with the specialty of being teacher of secondary classes.

She was very young when she started to work at the kindergarden. She started to work at the school from 1993 and she is devoted to her pedagogical work till today. She mentions her great pleasure and love with which she works with each of her pupils, who are small, innocent and naive and ready to learn, helping them to know as much as possible.

Mayranush is married and she lives with her husband, who is also a pedagogue, and her son who is a policeman. She also has a daughter who is already married. Her family is also engaged in farming and agriculture and it brings more income for her family.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams that she asks for is because she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature for her self-development activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature for her self-development activities

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dauda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Saidu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

As a member of Babban Gona Saidu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Saidu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Saidu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell through her buy and sell banana business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a married woman with two children. She is 44 years old and one of her children is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analie has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Analie has been in this business for 6 years. Analie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her repair shop business.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Idris is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Idris will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Idris now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the coordinator of her group, Asesewa. This solidarity group is located in Teshie, a city famous for sales and purchases of general goods. Rebecca makes her home in a simple structure with one of her two children. Her other child has left home, but they visit often.

Rebecca is excited to take her eighth loan from ID-Ghana. She plans to use this loan to improve her business (a food stall that sells fresh fish especially for events and activities) by purchasing more fresh and smoked fishes. Rebecca says she enjoys this business, specially during the festive season.

Rebecca's biggest dream is to have a successful business and to produce enough income to have a tranquil life along with her family. She will continuing saving and re-investing her business profits. She thanks you all for your support!

*Rebecca is standing at the right side in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more fresh and smoked fishes to supply her regular customers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 30, married, and has 3 children. He has a small grocery store project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products, such as rice, pasta and oil to expand his project and increase his income for his family

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products, such as rice, pasta and oil.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 53, married, and has 5 children. He takes care of his aging mother since his father's death. He has a small cattle fattening project and is requesting 10,000 EGP to buy one head of cattle to increase his sales of milk, cheese and butter. This will allow his wife and daughter to sell these products in the market.

loans.use: to buy one head of cattle.

loans.name: Julia

texts.pt:
A senhora Júlia de 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de quatro filhos dos quais três frequentam a escola e um não tem idade escolar. O marido trabalha na Africa de sul nas companhias mineiras e ela tem uma mercearia e com este empréstimo vai comprar cervejas refrescos, farinha de milho e outros produtos da 1ª necessidade para revenda.
Ela sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e rentabilizar as suas vendas, contudo, o desafio é redobrar os esforços de forma a atingir seus objectivos, porem, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras.
texts.en:
Júlia is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Three of them go to school, and the other one is still very young. Her husband works in South Africa for the mining companies. She has a grocery store.

With this loan, she will buy beer, beverages, corn flour, and other essential products for resale.

She dreams of expanding her business and making it more profitable. Her challenge is to work double as hard in order to achieve her goals, but she faces financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy beer, beverages, corn flour, and other essential products.

loans.name: Milicah

texts.en:
Milicah is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will be a billionaire. She will use the anticipated profits to start other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old, married to Absolom, and blessed with two children, ages 10 and 4 years old. She has been into a business of selling malimali for one year and earns a monthly income of about Ksh. 8,000.

This being her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, she intends to buy more bales of plastics for resale in her shop as she anticipates to save and pay back the loan from the expanded business profits.

Rose hopes to have a well established malimali shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of malimali

loans.name: Kikonda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en:
Josylene ia a member of Kikonda Savings & Credit, where members guarantee each other when borrowing and paying back a loan. She is a 42-year-old married lady with 3 children, all living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She operates a business of mobile money, which she started by using her savings from her monthly salary. She had a dream of raising more income for her family. She faces the challenges of insufficient capital, heavy rains and network failure, which delays her dream of offering quicker services to her customers and becoming a bigger mobile money agent in the whole district.

Josylene has asked for a loan to boost her mobile money business by having enough money for withdrawing and sending to different people. The other two members in the group are savers, and are hoping to borrow in the next cycle. The extra people in the photo are group members with savings who have guaranteed others but have not taken a loan.

loans.use: to boost her mobile money business by having enough money for withdrawing and sending to different people.

loans.name: Eduart

texts.en:
Eduart is married and the father of the little one seen in the photograph.

Eduart has been practicing agriculture over these past 9 years. In 2005, he bought around 3,000 square meters of land where he planted orchards in such way that he could have fruit all year long as well as fodder and corn for his animals. In the yard outside his house, he plants seasonal vegetables and keeps 2 dairy cows, 2 pigs, and 30 chickens.

Eduart's family lives with his elderly parents who both receive a total monthly pension of $184 in addition to some social assistance of $27 each month. While Eduart has been working as a truck driver for the past 3 years, he notes that "our father's need for constant medication and other medical attention and visits to clinics and hospitals leaves us broke most of the time. It's very hard financially."

Eduart has requested a loan to pay for his father's medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his father's medical expenses.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A senhora Isabel tem 29 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de três filhos dos quais dois estudam e um sem idade escolar.
Tem o negocio a desenvolver no quintal da sua casa e com este empréstimo vai comprar tomate, cebola, refrescos, arroz, pimenta e outros produtos básicos para reforçar o negócio.
Esta senhora sonha em ampliar o negócio, tem uma mercearia bem recheada e concluir as suas dependências para arrendar. Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, tem o desafio de reembolsar o seu empréstimo dentro de prazo estabelecido.
texts.en:
Isabel is 29 years old. She is a widow and has three children; two of them study and the other one is not of school age yet.

She runs a business in her porch. With this loan she will buy tomatoes, onions, beverages, rice, pepper, and other essential products to strengthen her business.

This lady dreams of expanding her business, having a well-stocked store, and finishing building the rooms she wants to rent out. Despite the financial difficulties she faces, her challenge is to pay off the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, beverages, rice, pepper, and other essential products to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself as polite.

Josephine operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Josephine will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married with one child. After leaving her job and moving to a new city, Hatice felt lost. She wanted to continue her career and support her husband, so she opened a small store and began selling at markets.

She closed the store not long after because it was expensive to maintain, and then continued working at the markets. She sells various clothing items at her stall. With the loan, she will buy goods wholesale.

Hatice's dream is to send her daughter to school and buy a car so she can expand her stall and go to the market everyday.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hatice Hanım evli, bir çocuk annesi. Başka bir şehirden bulunduğu şehre taşınan Özlem hanım çalıştığı işden de ayrılınca boşlukta kalır. Çalışma hayatına devam etmek ve eşine destek olmak isteyen Özlem hanım bir buçuk yıl önce küçük bir dükkan açar ve aynı zamanda pazarda satış yapmaya başlar. Dükkanın giderlerinin çok olmasından dolayı kısa bir süre sonra dükkanını kapatarak pazarda işine devam eder. Tezgahında çeşitli giyim eşyaları satışı yapıyor. Aldığı kredi ile toplu malzeme alacak. Hayali kızını okutmak ve araba alıp tezgahlarını çoğaltarak haftanın her günü pazara çıkmak.

loans.use: buy goods wholesale

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be humble.

Riziki operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Riziki will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Yesim

texts.en:
Yeşim has been married two years and runs a fast food shop. Her dream is to open her own cute little place. Eight months ago, she achieved her dream of helping her husband materially and mentally. She says she did it without thinking, she just went for her dream and succeeded. With her first loan, she'll buy new stools and materials. Her dream is to grow her business step-by-step and open a bigger place and to be a mother.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yeşim Hanım iki yıllık evli. Fast food dükkanı işletiyor. Hayali kendine ait küçük şirin bir yerinin olması imiş. Sekiz ay önce hayalini eşi maddi ve manevi olarak yanında yer alarak gerçekleştirmiş. Olur olmazı düşünmeden başarmak için sadece hayalime gittim ve başardım diyor. Aldığı ilk kredi ile dükkanına yeni tabureler ve yeni malzemeler alacak. Hayali kademe kademe büyüyüp daha büyük bir yer açmak ve anne olmak.

loans.use: to buy new stools and materials

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
O senhor Jeremias de 47 anos de idade é pedreiro numa empresa do ramo agricola, casado pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 a estudar e os restantes já são maiores de idade e nos seus lares sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar duvets, mantas, lencois, panelas, amendoim, acucar, oleo para reforçar o seu negocio.
Planos para o futuro ampliar a sua casa com mais dois quartos, sala e varanda e crescer no negocio satisfazendo as necessidades de seus clientes.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e que para supera-los conta com ajuda de sua esposa que tem machambas e que lhe ajuda na dieta alimentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Jeremias is 47 years old. He works as a mason for an agricultural company. He is married, and the father of six children; four of them go to school, and the others are adults now and have their own families. He maintains two grandchildren who live with him in a house he owns.

With the requested amount he will buy duvets, blankets, bed sheets, pots, peanuts, sugar, and cooking oil to strengthen his business.

In the future, he plans to build two more rooms at home, a living room, and a veranda, and expand his business to fulfill his customers' needs.

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and that his wife, who works a small piece of land, helps him to overcome it and to feed the family.

loans.use: to buy duvets, bed sheets, pots, peanuts, sugar, and cooking oil to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is a 27-year-old married woman. The man shown with her in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and earns enough income to cover all the family's expenses.

For the improvement of her husband's business, Shaista has taken a Murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR because her husband needs to replace tires and purchase some spare auto parts so he can provide better services to his customers.

Shaista is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband and bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace tires and to purchase some spare auto parts.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and supports five people in her family. She has a computer services center, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has applied for her first loan with Visionfund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to add more stock

loans.name: Navruzmoh

texts.en:
Navruzmoh was born in 1976. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Navruzmoh also has been busy with the farming business for more than seven years. She grows crops and vegetables such as onions, wheat, beans, etc. Navruzmoh works in the field helping her husband. She sows twice in a year. She has four hectares of land.

Navruzmoh is going to start the new autumn season but she has no money to buy fuel and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season and to pay for the hired workers. She is asking for a loan of 9,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fuel and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season and to pay for the hired workers.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
Hilal is separated from her husband and lives with her two children, one of whom is a university graduate. After retiring from a public institution, Hilal opened a stall at a market and began selling women’s clothing for extra income. Because she was new, she started with one market, but now that she has begun to succeed she wants to expand to new markets. She’ll use her loan to buy a greater variety of products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hilal Hanım eşinden ayrılmış, biri ünüversite mezunu iki çocuğu ile yaşıyor. Bir kamu kurumundan emekli olan Hilal hanım ek gelir elde etmek için sekiz ay önce Pazar da tezgah açarak kadın kıyafeti satmaya başlamış. Daha çok yeni olduğu için tek pazar yeri ile başlayan Hilal Hanım başardığını gördükten sonra Pazar yerlerini çoğaltmak istiyor. Aldığı ilk kredi ile mal alıp çeşidini arttırmak.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing

loans.name: Milli

texts.en:
Milli is a 22-year-old simple girl from a village in Khurda district, Odisha, India. She has been a bright student throughout her career. Being an ambitious girl, Milli has never left any stone unturned to achieve her goal and make her parents proud.

This ambitious girl wants to pursue her technical course, but due to financial constraints, she is facing numerous difficulties in order to undertake the course. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a Certified Professional Accountant (CPA). She is interested in pursuing this course, as this is a growing field with a huge range of job opportunities. A competent professional accountant is an invaluable asset to a company.

Your loan amount can help Milli complete her course successfully with flying colors and get a job with a higher package and gain name and fame for her family. Milli is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her achieve her dream.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a Certified Professional Accountant (CPA)

loans.name: Merjeme

texts.en:
Merjeme's old refrigerator broke some time ago and since then she's been struggling without one. "Living in a village, a refrigerator is very important, because we usually buy food in larger quantities for our fresh produce and homemade dairy. We also never had a TV and now that the kids are grown, I thought it would be good to have one," said Merjeme, a married mother of 2 in their early 20s. Her daughter studies in a public university far from home, though her son is still unemployed.

Her husband suffers from mental illness and receives disability income of $102 per month while Merjeme receives some social assistance for taking care of her husband. She also works as a cleaner in a nearby restaurant for a few hours a day and earns less then $100 each month.

loans.use: to replace a broken refrigerator and purchase a TV.

loans.name: Ligoria

texts.es:
Ligoria, de 64 años de edad, una señora muy trabajadora, está acompañada, tuvo 5 hijos, pero todos ya están casados.

Ligoria, se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y también le ayuda a una de sus hijas con el cafetín que tiene en la escuela de la comunidad.

Ligoria, necesita el préstamo para comprar golosinas, bebidas, pan, dulces y galletas para el cafetín de su hija.

Ligoria, sueña con ayudar a sus nietos para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Ligoria, 64, is a very hardworking woman. She's married and had five children, but they're all married now.

Ligoria's a homemaker and she also helps one of her daughters with the café she runs in the community school. She needs the loan to buy candy, beverages, bread, sweets, and cookies for her daughter's café.

Ligoria dreams of helping her grandchildren get an education.

loans.use: to buy candy, beverages, bread, sweets, and cookies for her daughter's café

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en:
45-year-old Akhter followed in the footsteps of his teachers and has been running a school for over four years. After great struggle, he now has 197 students. More than 47% of enrolled students are female.

Akhter is highly committed to ensuring his students get the best education. Due to financial constraints, he could not ensure all facilities in his school. Therefore, Akhter requested a loan of 100,000 PKR for school construction and to buy chairs and desks for his students, as a recent increase in enrollment has led to a shortage.

loans.use: to pay for school construction and to buy chairs and desks for his students.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en février 2014. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent principalement dans le commerce  et l’embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
ASTOU  debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite  est l'emprunteuse, elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 filles et d'un garçon. Elle s'active dans l'embouche.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter deux moutons l'unité à 30 000 FCFA. Elle les élève et les revend à 50 000 voire 60 000 FCFA. Elle achète de l’aliment de bétail avec le reste du prêt.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va épargner et entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of 20 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created in February 2014. It is composed of women from the same village and nearby. They relate well to one another and are mainly active in commerce and in livestock farming. The group meetings are conducted in a nice ambiance.

Astou, standing at the left in the photo with her right hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is 42 years old and the married mother of two girls and a boy. She is active in the fattening of livestock.

With this loan, she is going to purchase two sheep at 30,000 francs CFA each. She raises and then resells them at 50,000 or even 60,000 francs. She is buying feed with the rest of the loan.

With the profits, she will save some money and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep

loans.name: Marina Carmen

texts.es:
Marina es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo recién nacido, y su negocio es la cafetería.
Ella es alegre, espontánea y muy divertida. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Achumani’ zona residencial caracterizada por las viviendas de lujo y por el clima cálido a pesar de encontrarse sobre las alturas, a 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Marina es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su bebé que acaba de nacer, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cafetería vendiendo comida como; desayuno, te, café, jugos de frutas naturales, sándwich de pollo y de res, de mortadela y queso, “sólo existen 2 restaurantes en la zona que no abastecen la demanda, por eso voy a ampliar mi negocio vendiendo almuerzo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda para mejorar su servicio, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar una máquina espiadera de pollo. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea comprar una máquina espiadera para ampliar su menú y vender almuerzo y cena. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marina solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina espiadera para vender pollo al espiedo.
texts.en:
Marina is a young 21-year-old woman.  She lives with her partner and a new-born son.  Her business is a cafeteria.
She is joyful, spontaneous and fun.  Her business is done in the Achumani area, which is a residential area characterized for luxurious houses and a warm climate in spite of its height located 3,600 meters above sea level.
Marina has dark skin, short height and is thin. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks in it to her family.  She also speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business.  Her life is shared with her partner who works in the same business with their new-born baby.  They live in a rented room made of concrete and it has running water, electricity and sewage.  Their business is a cafeteria selling food such as breakfast, tea, coffee, freshly squeezed juices, chicken, beef, ham and cheese sandwiches .  “There are only two restaurants in this area that fulfill the demand, this is why I will expand my business selling lunch” she indicates.  The advantage of her business is that she has the demand to improve services and the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a machine to roast chicken.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She wants to  buy a rotisserie machine to expand her menu and sell lunch and dinner.  This is her first loan with the institution in the two years she has had this business.

These are the reasons why Marina requests a loan to buy a rotisserie machine to sell chicken.

loans.use: To buy a rotisserie machine to sell chicken for lunch and dinner and expand her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Agnes will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en: Viktorya from Sevan city of Gegharkunik region, is greatly pleased with her first Kiva loan, which she quickly paid back. She is now asking for the second loan and partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon. Viktorya is a pedagogue with higher education and has been working at the school as a teacher of chemistry for 11 years.  She likes her pedagogical activities and explains each lesson in a way that her students manage to learn and get interested in the subject. Viktorya is married and has a daughter (who is a student) and a son who is school-aged. This time Victorya asks for a loan of 450.000 Armenian drams, since she must take part in pedagogical training courses which have fees.  She also needs to buy a scanner.

loans.use: she must take part in pedagogical training courses which are paid, and she also needs to buy a scanner

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 42-year-old married woman who has been running a school for the last five months. She has great enthusiasm to serve the community children and is determined to be successful. She has a passion to provide a quality education to her students. Currently she has 50% female students, whereas in total 135 students are enrolled in her school.

Uzma has a desire to expand by enrolling more students. A loan of PKR 100,000 will allow her to furnish her schools to provide a comfortable learning environment. Uzma is to continue running this school for the long run and to expand by enrolling more students.

loans.use: to furnish her schools to provide a comfortable learning environment .

loans.name: Carlos Omar

texts.es:
Carlos, de 21 años de edad, es bachiller opción contador, pero debido a los pocos recursos económicos, ya no pudo seguir en la universidad , esta acompañado y su pareja trabaja en una tienda, ellos aún no tienen hijos solo viven en su casa el y su  esposa .

Carlos, inicio con una pequeña tienda desde hace seis meses con su esposa, el dice que su sueño es de tener su propio negocio, antes de colocar la pequeña tienda trabajó en una cooperativa como administrador, él se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana porque a las 5:30 abre la tienda y trabaja hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. 

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, pan y detergentes y para comprar recargas de saldo para telefonos. 

El sueño de Carlos, es tener una tienda más grande o un mini-super para poder dar empleo a otras personas y comprar un terreno para poder construir su propia casa .
texts.en:
21-year-old Carlos graduated from high school with a major in Accounting. However, he could not afford to go to the university. He is married. His partner works in a store. They do not have children yet; they live alone.

Carlos opened a small store with his wife six months ago. He says that his dream is to have his own business. Before opening this small store, he used to work for a cooperative, as the manager. He wakes up at 4:30 am, because he opens the store at 5:30 am. He works until 6:00 pm.

Carlos needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, bread, and detergents, and prepaid phone cards.

Carlos dreams of having a larger store or a minimarket, employing other people, and buying a piece of land to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice, sugar, bread, and detergents, and to buy prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Nafeesa

texts.en:
34 years old and married, Nafeesa has been running a low income private school for 3 years. Nafeesa desires to provide a quality standard school to her community with maximums facilities. But, due to lack of resources, she is not able to provide these facilities to the children.

Nafeesa's school has 144 enrolled students, out of which 45% are female students. She desires to have trained teachers in her school. She is providing the children of her rural community the opportunity to change their lives and secure a better future.

Nafeesa has requested a loan of 150,000 PKR to purchase facilities for her school such as furniture and blackboards.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and blackboards for her school.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira always had a desire to educate the children of her community and after completing her education, decided to open her own school. She is 27 years old and started her school 3 years ago. Today, there are almost 140 students at the school, 40% of whom are female.

Saira is an efficient school manager and focuses on providing an inclusive learning environment for her students and teachers. Now, she requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to purchase chairs, desks and white boards to accommodate more students, and to provide a comfortable learning environment. Saira feels her school has the potential to grow and needs help to improve the infrastructure and facilities of the school

loans.use: to purchase chairs, desks and white boards to accommodate more students and to provide a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Tsigiro Yamai Group

texts.en:
It’s never an easy job to endure the long, tiring hours on a bus journey. However, in search for a means of survival, one never notices the entire ordeal she is facing. Such perseverance is needed in an individual to succeed. Sekai has an inspirational statement that keeps her going: “Never give up; the beginning is always difficult."

Sekai is a 42-year-old married mother of three children. She resides in Southlea Park in Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. Sekai is a member of Tsigiro Yaamai group, which consists of five members. The members are highly self-motivated and empowered women of similar ages. They decided to support their spouses in taking care of the family out of the proceeds of their businesses. Tsigiro Yaamai simply means "motherly support." This is in support of their noble deed of taking care of their families.

Sekai never allows challenges to break her. She never grows weary of traveling in the cold, rainy, or hot conditions. She travels mostly by road to South Africa, Botswana, and Mozambique to restock products such as clothing for males and females, young and old. She also restocks blankets, shoes, and different types of traveling bags. Additionally, she restocks plasticware like slippers, toys, dishes etc. from the central business district of Harare.

Sekai has a flea market located at a very busy shopping complex. Her flea market is always filled to maximum capacity with various clothing goods, plasticware, shoes, and bags. She has gained a lot of customer loyalty because her products are of high quality and are available in different colors, shapes, and sizes.

Sekai applied for a loan of $400 (her portion of the loan). With this amount, she intends to expand her operating space to increase the maximum capacity and to fully restock her flea market. This is to ensure that all different clients' needs are sufficiently met. She is also targeting the festive season, which is usually associated with massive spending. This season is when businesses will be at the peak as most families will be enjoying the fruits of their labor.

loans.use: to expand space for her sales and to restock clothes, shoes and other items ahead of the festive season.

loans.name: Nashat

texts.en: Nashat is 40, married, and has three children. He has a small clothing project and his wife makes some clothing sales from home. He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy winter clothing for the season to expand his project.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing for the season.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Sanobar is widowed. She is a kind woman. Sanobar lives in North Tajikistan. She has a higher education and is a teacher in a local school. She has worked there for some years but her salary is not satisfactory so she has additional income from animal husbandry. Sanobar works hard every day to earn a living. Sanobar always tries to have a good living standard. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy medicines because she is ill and she must buy medicines. Sanobar awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Maria Cristabel

texts.es: María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que lleva realizando 3 años y que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella tiene 22 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 6 años de edad, a la que apoyan para que estudie y tenga una vida mejor. María desea invertir en más pollos, ya que en época de navidad las ventas aumentan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: pollos, concentrado, vitaminas, etc., para su granja de pollos.
texts.en: Maria’s business is to raise, grow and sell chickens; activity that she has done for three years and that allows her to earn a living for her home.  She is 22-years-old and lives with her life partner and their 6-year-old daughter.  They support her to study and to have a better life.  Maria wants to invest in buying more chicken, because during Christmas season sales increase.  This is why she requests a loan to FUSAI to invest in chicken, feed, vitamins, etc. for her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy chicken, feed, vitamins, etc. for her chicken farm.

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace 20 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos, además elabora cestos de mimbre para vender, los cuales son de diversos tamaños y diseños. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa de su propiedad. María desea invertir en pollos y alimento para su crianza de pollos, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, vitaminas y concentrado para su granja de pollos.
texts.en: María is a hard-working woman who has sold chickens for 20 years, for which she has a large quantity of customers who request her products. She also makes wicker baskets to sell, which are of various sizes and designs. She lives with her life partner and their two children in a house they own. María wants to invest in chickens and feed for raising chickens, for which she is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: chickens, vitamins and feed for her chicken farm.

loans.use: invest in: chickens, vitamins and feed for her chicken farm.

loans.name: Chicken Little Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liễu is 49 years old and she is married with two children. Liễu lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 
Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. The income from this business is unstable because when some disease happens to her poultry, they could die, which would leave her nothing to sell. So she would be in financial trouble.
The main hardship that Liễu faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Liễu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Since then, she was able to fix the hen-coop to improve productivity and raise more chickens. She is the leader of "Chicken Little", which consists of five members. In the future, Liễu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en: To earn a living, Pablito has been driving a motorcycle. This motorcycle is a common mode of public transportation in most rural areas in San Dionesio, Iloilo and other neighboring regions. It has been his source of income for the past 10 years for his family. Pablito’s wife stays home and takes good care of their child. They have a six months old daughter who is the center of their lives. Pablito is asking a loan for motorcycle maintenance and to buy gasoline to sell. Definitely, they are engaged in gasoline retailing business that will also help them enhance their livelihood. Thus, he wishes for a sustainable livelihood to have enough money to send his child to school and have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and gasoline

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old, married to Kiboen and blessed with five children between 14 and 25 years old. She has been selling vegetables and milk for 17 years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 9,000.

This being her fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, she intends to buy more vegetables and milk for resale in Kaptildil as she anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their child from the expanded business profits.

She hopes to settle down in a good house.

loans.use: To buy milk and vegetables

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 38 years old. He is married to Linah, and they are blessed with 3 children aged between 10 and 6 years. He has been involved in his business selling tea and milk for 8 years and he earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This being his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, Samwel intends to use the loan to buy more tea and dairy feed for his cows.

Samwel anticipates buying another calf for breeding from his increased business profits. He hopes to grow his business to great heights.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed and green tea.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 48 years old. She is married with one child.

Petronila has had a fish monger business for seven years. She will be using the loan to purchase more roasted fish for selling. She hopes this will help her to educate her child and provide sufficient food and clothing for her.

Petronila's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and be financially stable. She is in her first loan cycle and has borrowed 10,000 KES to be repaid in 6 months

loans.use: to purchase more roasted fish

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, age 46, earns her living by operating a general store. She has been in this business for three years. In her store, she sells a variety of grocery items such as snack foods and noodles, as well as personal use goods like diapers.

She and her husband have three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan finds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Lorna would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr: Mawazo est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise «Umoja ni Nguvu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32 ans. Elle est vendeuse des poissons dans un marché du centre commercial depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en quatre cents poissons. Elle débuta par le premier fonds reçu de son mari qui est chauffeur. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en:
Mawazo is a merchant and the president of the banque villageoise "Umoja ni Nguvu," a client of IMF Hekima. She is married and 32 years old. She has been selling fish in a market in the shopping center for 10 years.

She will buy 400 fish. She started with funds received from her husband, a driver. She wants to grow her business, and to educate and feed her children.

In closing, she wants to thank Hekima for their support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 400 fish.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan, 45 years old married woman lives in small village Tsutskhvati. She has school-aged daughter and husband, who works as a custodial servant and gets 200-300 GEL per month. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Ketevan is engaged in cattle and cow breeding and in cultivation of family-owned agricultural land. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income.

According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Ketevan has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an serving activity. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Ketevan will purchase a special tractor and she will get the additional source of income for her family's well-being. Ketevan and her husband will make the tractor work on private orders. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly, especially during the season. They will be able to create better living conditions for their child and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor and increase the family's income.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Ahmad is 30, single, and has three children. He has a blacksmith workshop and is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy new equipment and tools to generate more income and afford his marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy new blacksmith equipment and tools.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 27 years old. She has helped her mother since a very young age. Her mother opened a school in 1982 with few students. Now, Rabia is running the school with 195 schoolchildren.

Rabia's students cannot pay fees, and that is why she has a very limited amount of money to cover school expenses. Rabia plans to run this school for a long time. This is why she requires 75,000 PKR for furniture and school construction. She has some savings, but it is not sufficient for what the school requires.

loans.use: to pay for school construction and to buy furniture.

loans.name: Kashawn

texts.en:
When Kashawn was 16 years old, his mother lost her home, so he frequently moved from place to place. Through this experience, he learned the challenges of moving and also became an expert. He also has experience working for a friend who was a mover, and this also sparked his interest in the moving industry.

Kashawn established his business, Kush Movers, after his friend was doing a similar type of business and connected him to the U-Haul University. Kashawn completed the course to receive a contract with U-Haul and has since been performing the majority of the work through them.

Kush Movers is a "green" moving company, performing both residential and commercial moving services. The company utilizes energy efficient vehicles and recycled boxes to remain "green."

Kashawn will use the $2,500 Kiva loan for payroll as the business continues to expand and towards the purchase of additional equipment.

With Kiva lenders' help, Kashawn will be able provide an income for his family.

loans.use: to hire new employees and purchase additional equipment.

loans.name: Los Sauces Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal de “Los sauces”  que está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo, en la provincia del Cusco departamento del Cusco.

El socio Alejandro en una persona trabajadora y el desea salir adelante con su trabajo, el se dedica a l trasporte.
Su trabajo lo realiza todo el día es por eso que su herramienta de trabajo que es su auto, necesita mantenimiento y repuestos, para ello es lo que solicito el préstamo.
El socio necesita comprar llantas y aceite de carro para su vehículo, así podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus usuarios y viajar con seguridad.

La fotografía que esta  adjunta con la imagen grupal pertenecen a un socio que pidió permiso y llego tarde por motivos de trabajo.

Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante, a la venta de gaseosas y cerveza y a la venta de productos alimenticios
Los socios se comprometen a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The members belong to Los Sauces Communal Bank, located in the district of San Jerónimo in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Alejandro, is a hardworking person who wants to get ahead with his job. He earns a living in transportation. He works every day, so his car is his tool for work.

Alejandro requested the loan because his car needs maintenance and parts. He needs to buy tires and motor oil for his vehicle so he'll be able to offer his customers better service and travel safely.

The other members work in a restaurant business, soda and beer sales, and grocery sales. They promise to make their payments punctually.

The photograph attached to the group image is of a member who had permission to arrive late because of work.

loans.use: to buy tires and motor oil

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: 20 years ago  Fatima, who is 63 years old now, started a small level school with the support of her son (also shown in the photo). With the passage of time it gained popularity and she decided to upgrade her low cost private school. There are 153 students in her school 46% of whom are female. When asked what motivates her, Fatima replied “My parents struggled to keep me in school when I was young. We lacked resources and they could not afford good quality school. Today when I teach students I feel that I am enabling the youth of a rural community to change and secure a better future in the long run!” Fatima has requested for Rs.100,000 for the purpose of construction and furniture.

loans.use: with construction and furniture at her school,

loans.name: Mayerly

texts.es:
Mayerly es una joven de 21 años de edad, residente del municipio de mariquita, una joven luchadora, la cual con trabajo y perseverancia ha logrado convertir en una vendedora de pollos competidora, la cual vela por el cuidado de su familia.
Tiene una pequeña de 1 año de edad, es su adoración, su fortaleza, su inspiración, quiere convertirse en una gran empresaria para darle una casa, un estudio, sacará su familia adelante y cambiara su realidad, teniendo como objetivo lograr tener  un futuro próspero.
Actualmente la cliente solicita un crédito para ampliar sus galpones y aumentar su cantidad de pollos, el objetivo principal de esta inversión es tener ciclos de producción,
texts.en:
Young Mayerly is 21 years old. She lives in the municipality of Mariquita. She is a hardworking young woman, who has become a competitive entrepreneur in the poultry sector thanks to her hard work and perseverance. She takes care of her family.

She has a one-year-old daughter. She adores her, because she gives her strength and inspires her. She wants to become a businesswoman to give her a house and pay her studies. She will get ahead with her family and will change their current living conditions. Her goal is to achieve prosperity in the future.

She is requesting a loan to enlarge her chicken coops and buy more chickens. The main goal of this investment is to start producing in cycles.

loans.use: to enlarge her chicken coops and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is 56, a widow, and has 5 children. She has a small clothing project and is requesting 7000 EGP loan, to buy winter clothing to increase her sales in this season.  The loan will also help her children's education.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is a 33-year-old single woman. Two years ago, she started her own school. Misbah's dream is to educate all the children in her community. Today, her school has over 91 students.

In order to buy furniture and construct rooms for her students, Misbah has requested a loan of 80,000 PKR. She has worked hard to bring her school to the level it is at today and wants to continue to strive to make her school even better. She does not shy away from the hard work and dedication required to do so, both for her students and for her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture and to construct rooms for her students.

loans.name: Neiza

texts.es:
Neiza es una mujer de 30 años, casada, tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por ser el brazo manufacturero de producción y por recibir la migración campo ciudad de todo el país.
Neiza es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño lo usa largo y ojos marrones, su lengua materna es el Guarani que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de micro y con su hijo que aún es un bebé, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama como; sabanas, edredones, frazadas, colchas, cubrecamas y otros, “vendo ropa de cama de temporada, en esta temporada las ventas se deben a las sábanas de algodón…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende ropa de temporada, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar ropa de cama de verano. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el centro de la ciudad, ella desea comprar ropa de cama brasileña. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Neiza solicita un préstamo para comprar sabanas de algodón para vender en verano.
texts.en:
Neiza is a 30-year-old woman, married, and the mother of an eight-month-old son. She sells bed linens. She is an enterprising, independent, and very responsible woman. She works in the southern side of the city, which is known for its manufacturing companies and for receiving the migrants that come from the rural areas from all over the country.

Neiza has dark complexion, brown eyes, and wears her brown hair loose. Her mother tongue is Guaraní. She speaks it at home, and speaks Spanish due to cultural and professional reasons. She shares her life with her partner, who drives a minibus, and her son, who is still a baby. They rent a room built with bricks and cement, with a corrugated metal roof, and served with drinking water, electricity, and sewage.

She sells bed linens, such as sheets, quilts, blankets, and bedspreads. "I sell seasonal bed linens. During this season, I mostly sell cotton bed sheets," she says. The advantage is that she sells seasonal bed linens. The disadvantage is the lack of funding to buy summertime bed linens. Her dream is to open a store in the center of the city.
