She would like to buy Brazilian bed linens. This is her first loan from the institution since she started her business one year ago.

This is why Neiza is requesting a loan to buy cotton bed sheets to sell in the summertime.

loans.use: to buy cotton bed sheets to sell in the summertime.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 41 years old and lives with her large family in the city of Sevan, in the Gegharkunik region. She has a vocational medical education and a specialty as a nurse. Starting from 1993 till today, she has worked in her specialty at one of the city’s polyclinics (healthcare facilities that treat a variety of illnesses). She likes her work and she finds it very useful for her family.

Lilit is married and has two sons; the eldest is a student and the smallest is in the army now, passing his military service. Lilit’s husband works at the bread factory. The family has some financial hardships. Lilit's health is not good and she needs to be examined. This loan of 1.200.000 Armenian drams will be so helpful for Lilit to solve her health problem and to undergo a medical exam at the hospital. Then, she can finally get rid of the weakness that she feels every day.

loans.use: to solve her health problem and undergo a medical exam at the hospital. Then, she can finally get rid of the weakness that she feels every day.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 35-year-old woman who is highly passionate about child education. She decided to open a school that will serve only her community. Farhat has been running this school for four years. Of her 138 enrolled students, 55% are female.

Farhat requires 75,000 PKR to buy school furnishings and stocks of stationery. She believes that hard work is the key to success but it is achieved through struggle. She is struggling to achieve her goal of quality education through comprehensive education techniques.

loans.use: to buy school furnishings and stocks of stationery.

loans.name: Saniya

texts.en:
A 30-year-old single woman, Saniya started her school 7 years ago with the aim of educating the children in the rural area where she lives. Today, out of her 138 enrolled students, 55% are female.

The 100,000 PKR loan Saniya has borrowed will help her increase the quality of her school’s facilities by purchasing furniture, computers, etc.

Saniya dreams of providing her community with a greater awareness and appreciation for education despite the challenges she faces in a low-income community.

loans.use: to increase the quality of her school’s facilities by purchasing furniture, computers, etc.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kabiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to a 60,204 NGN loan and support from Babban Gona, Kabiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time, then sell it later at a higher price.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
A senhora Fatima de 37 anos de idade é operária agrίcola,  casada mãe 2 filhos todos a frequentar o ensino primario vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar areia, cimento, pedra, aros e janelas para dar inicio a construção de sua casa tipo 1.
Planos para o futuro iniciar a construção de sua casa  tipo 1 e com o passar do tempo ir ampliando para confortar a sua  familia.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos e que para superá-los conta com ajuda de seu esposo e também faz machambas e que com o valor do emprestimo anterior legalizou o seu espaço.
texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old farm worker. She's married and has two children, both of whom are in primary school. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase sand, cement, rocks and window frames so that she can start building her one-bedroom house.
Her plan for the future is to start building the one-bedroom house and then gradually enlarge it as a way to provide comfort for her family.
She states that her biggest challenge is the lack of funds. In order to overcome that, she gets help from her husband and also does farmwork. With the amount from the previous loan she secured the deeds to her property.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, rocks, and window frames so she can build her one-bedroom house.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
A cliente Esperança, comerciante de 56 anos de idade, casada e mãe   de 05 filhos, dos quais 04 já são maiores de idade e independentes,  01 a frequentar o ensino secundário, vive  na casa própria,  não sustenta a mais ninguém .
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar blocos, cimento, ferro, pedra, areia, e pagar mão-de-obra para fazer o seu muro de vedação.

A cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua obra, construir uma barraca, futuramente comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no seu negocio e ver a sua família feliz .

Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Esperança is a 56-year-old vendor. She's married and has five children, four of whom are already independent adults and one is in secondary school. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase bricks, cement, iron, rocks and sand, and also pay for labor so that she can build her fence wall.
Esperança's dream is to finish the construction work, build a stall, and someday buy a vehicle to help her in her business. Another dream is to see her family happy.
Her main challenges are financial, and she has been working hard. She intends to obtain other loans in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, iron, rocks and sand, and to pay for labor to build a fence wall.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a school for four years. Mussarat was always interested in providing education to the children in her community, and was determined to be successful.

Two years ago, she saved enough to buy her own building for her school, but it still requires some work. She has 176 students in total and 75 % of enrolled students are female. A loan of PKR 100,000 will allow her to buy furniture and renovate the school building for her students. It will also help her to construct a gate for her school. Mussarat's mission is to improve the building structure and give a play lawn to students. She also hopes to expand by enrolling more students.

loans.use: to buy furniture and renovate the school building for her students. The loan will also help to construct a gate for her school.

loans.name: Shanaaz

texts.en:
Shanaaz, a 33-year-old married woman, has always had a desire to educate the children of her community. She decided to open her own school after completing her education. In the school's first year, she had very few students. Today, there are almost 103 students, 59% of which are female students enrolled in the school.

Shanaaz is an efficient school manager and focuses on providing an inclusive learning environment for her students and teachers. She feels her school has the potential to grow. She needs help to improve the infrastructure and facilities of the school to accommodate more students and to provide a comfortable learning environment. For this, she requires a loan of PKR 65,000.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure and facilities of the school to accommodate more students and to provide a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With a 67,566 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from the marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time, then sell it later at a higher price.

loans.name: Alhaji Usaini

texts.en:
Alhaji Usain is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Alhaji Usain would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support and a loan of 36,584 NGN he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Usain will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize harvest and sell it at a later date at a higher price.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 56 years old; she is married to Peter and blessed with ten children aged between 34 and 16 years old. She has been in the vegetable and fruit selling business for eight years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 6,000.

This is her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She intends to buy more vegetables for resale in the village as she wants to help her husband pay the school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

She dreams of becoming a supplier of fruits and vegetables in various schools.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hermenia is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Hermenia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Hermenia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Hermenia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is a 47-year-old married woman and runs her school with the support of her husband. She started the school in 2010. Riffat and her husband run this school in a very efficient manner. There are 173 students enrolled, of which 48% are female students. She has requested for Rs. 100,000 for a computer lab and to install a solar energy system to save energy. Riffat's new initiatives help students to learn about change, as change is important for education.

loans.use: obtain a computer lab and to install a solar energy system to save energy.

loans.name: Dorocas

texts.en:
Dorocas is a married woman and has been blessed with nine children, seven of whom attend school. She lives in her own house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Dorocas operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She faces disease outbreak which causes losses; this is a challenge to her business. Dorocas dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is maize farmer from Doka village. As a member of Babban Gona, Saidu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Saidu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Saidu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira  is a 39-year-old, married lady shown in the photo with her husband. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of sewing. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to increase her earnings.  She wishes to spend her earnings on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to increase her earnings

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema, 22, always wanted to educate children in need. Her mother opened a school fifteen years ago, and Haleema is now running this school with the support of her mother. Her school has an enrollment of 523 students with 63% of them girls.

Haleema School has insufficient furniture and too little room for its students. For this reason she has applied for a 65,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy additional furniture and pay for repairs on her school. Her plan is to renovate the building so as to provide a good learning environment for her students.

loans.use: to buy additional furniture and pay for repairs on her 523-student school.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is the owner of a small catering business starting in 2012. She runs the kitchen and manages all the orders alone. Three years ago, her idea started as a way to turn her hobby, cooking, into a business and it has been working very well since. She prepares food and delivers tasty meals to homes and offices upon request which has helped her to become well known in the area.
She is 52 years old, single, and lives with her sister in a rented apartment located in Beirut. 
She needs a 2,313,613 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to buy new equipment for her kitchen. In fact, she needs to upgrade some of her tools that she has not replaced since she established her kitchen. Investing in new equipment will allow her to work in better conditions and focus on preparing quality meals which should increase incoming orders and her income.

loans.use: to upgrade her kitchen's equipment.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has a small grocery store project. He is requesting 7000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta and oil to expand his project and increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta and oil.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 29-year-old single man from Yata, Hebron city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Imad has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Imad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвару 39 лет. Он из района Хамадони. Анвар семейный человек. У него прекрасные дети. Анвар очень любить свою семью. Он заботливый и хороший отец. Его жена не имеет работу, она домохозяйка и следит за домашними делами и ухаживает за детьми. У Анвар есть талант. Он хочет воспользоваться талантом. Анвар умеет заниматься ремонтом автомашин. Он решил открыть автомастерскую у себя во дворе. Ему только нужен компрессор для покраски автомашин. Анвару не хватает приобрести компрессор. И решил взять кредит и купить необходимое средство. Анвар верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Он хочет хорошо обеспечить семью.
texts.en: Anvar is 39 years old.  He comes from the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  He has some beautiful children and he truly loves his family.  He is a good and caring father.  His wife doesn't have a job; she is a homemaker who takes care of the household and looks after the children.  Anvar has a special skill, which he would like to put to good use.  He knows how to repair cars, so he has decided to open a car repair shop next to his house.  The only thing he still needs is an air compressor to paint cars.  Anvar doesn't have enough money to buy a compressor.  For this reason, he has decided to take a loan to buy what he needs.  Anvar is confident that he will receive your support.  His goal is to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de elaboración y venta de panes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida por ser cliente de Arariwa y se ha comprometido a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota a tiempo.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA. She continues to work at her business preparing and selling bread. She has had success with her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She is a determined and entrepreneurial woman and hopes, through her business, to obtain greater earnings and in this manner continue supporting her family.

This member is applying for the loan to buy flour, sugar, and other items.

This member is very grateful to work with Arariwa and has promised to complete the repayment of her loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as being patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as being inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is 53 years old and a mother of six children; four adults and two-school- aged.

She and her husband earn a living by doing a fishing business. They have been doing this livelihood for 30 years to support the needs of their children and able to provide food for the family. Alma’s only goal in life is to sustain and have enough money to send her school-aged children to college. She wants them to finished their degree and become professionals someday.

Alma needs an amount to repair their fishing boat. That is why she is asking for a bigger loan to buy materials to repair their boat, such as plywood, paint and fishing boat glue. In this way, she and her husband will be able to continue use their fishing boat and able to earn a living.

In addition to this, Alma successfully pays her previous loan amount, amounting to PHP35000.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair their boat, such as plywood, paint and fishing boat glue.

loans.name: Dionedisa

texts.en:
Dionedisa is 62 years old and married with two children.

Dionedisa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Dionedisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Dionedisa has been in pig fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dionedisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hermemia

texts.en:
Hermemia is 63 years old and married with six children.

Hermemia is in the agricultural business: farming bananas in the Philippines. Hermemia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Hermemia has been farming banana for 6 years, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Hermemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and has 6 children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Teodora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, sticky rice, etc. for her food production business.

Teodora has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, sticky rice, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Mahmoona

texts.en:
Mahmoona is a 25-year-old unmarried woman. She has been running a school with the support of her brother (also shown in the photo) for the last 5 years. After years of struggle and hard work, today her school boasts over 206 students, 57% of which are female students.

Mahmoona has always emphasized the quality of education imparted at her school and goes to great lengths to ensure that the children at her school are learning. She needs a loan of PKR 200,000 to buy computers and furniture and to repair her existing furniture to provide her students with a comfortable learning environment. She desired to have model school in her village with full facilities.

loans.use: to buy computers and furniture and to repair her existing furniture to provide her students with a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
Gladys and her fellow group members deal in the sales of clothes and food stuffs. Their previous loan helped Biakoye to expand their business. From the additional income generated from their businesses, members could cover their family's daily expenses without high-interest local loans. Additionally, the members are planning to use additional income to buy more stocks. This will improve their access to affordable and reliable business resources.

With a new loan, Gladys aims to purchase more white bed sheets and blankets of high quality. The entire group wants to thank the Kiva community for their critical, generous support.

loans.use: to purchase more white bed sheets and blankets of high quality.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 26 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a farming rice business in the Philippines.

Alicia requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Alicia has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en:
Bashiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bashiru is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Bashiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Bashiru will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Bashiru now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hermosila

texts.en:
Hermosila is 29 years old and married with one child. With that child currently in school, Hermosila works very hard to provide for her family.

Hermosila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Hermosila has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, etc.

Hermosila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and she has 9 children. She is married, and 4 of her children are still in school.

Nenita is in the agriculture business, farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nenita has been farming corn and vegetables for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to help her sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Charlene works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Charlene is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business.

Charlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi a married woman and has been blessed with four children, three of whom attend school and one who is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a farming business of planting vegetables and tomatoes selling at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos Andrés es un hombre de 28 años de edad, persona responsable, hombre honorable el cual vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos,al ser padre tan joven optó por trabajar y con sus cultivos ha sacado su familia adelante, persevera todos los días por ser un mejor empresaria y darle a las personas que tanto ama una excelente calidad de vida.
El cliente solicita un préstamo para cancelar un saldo de un crédito anterior y comprar insumos agrícolas principalmente abonos y venenos, seguirá trabajando diariamente por pagar la educación de sus niños y llevar el alimento a la mesa de su hogar.
Carlos Andrés es un hombre de 28 años de edad, persona responsable, hombre honorable el cual vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 8 y la menor de 1, al ser padre tan joven optó por trabajar y con sus cultivos ha sacado su familia adelante, persevera todos los días por ser un mejor empresaria y darle a las personas que tanto ama una excelente calidad de vida.
El cliente solicita un préstamo para cancelar un saldo de un crédito anterior y comprar insumos agrícolas principalmente abonos y venenos, seguirá trabajando diariamente por pagar la educación de sus niños y llevar el alimento a la mesa de su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos Andrés is a 28-year-old, responsible, honorable man who lives in a common law marriage with his partner. He has two children. Being such a young father, he chose to work, and with his farming he has raised up his family. He perseveres every day to be a better entrepreneur and to give the people he loves so much an excellent quality of life.

Carlos Andrés is requesting a loan to pay the balance of a previous loan and to buy agricultural supplies, mainly fertilizers and pesticides. He will continue working every day in order to pay for the education of his children, and to put food on the table of his home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, primarily fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: El Lanchon Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 12 mujeres emprendedoras de la etnia miskita, viven en la comunidad de Wawa Boom, conocida por el río Wawa, que se localiza aproximadamente a 80 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Decidieron nombrar al banco comunal EL LANCHO, porque es como un ferry de hierro que traslada los vehículos y a la población de un extremo a otro del caudaloso río, para conectarlos a municipios de Puerto Cabezas y Waspam, con el Triángulo Minero, en el Caribe Norte. En este ferry al lado izquierdo las integrantes de la Asociación Comunal han colocado mesas de madera con sombrías para protegerse del sol y la lluvia, con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y ofrecer sus productos de venta de frito de pollo, cerdo, pescado, tamuga, gaseosas, refrescos, venta de queque de yuca, banano.

MARY LEE: Es la coordinadora del banco comunal, tiene 39 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos: 4 adolescentes que estudian su primaria en la escuela de comunidad de Wawa Boom y 3 menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como pescador artesanal. Con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar, desde hace 6 años se dedica a venta de pescado frito a la población que cruza el río Wawa, por medio del Lanchón. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, gaseosa, filipitas, sal, aceite, vinagre, repollo, tomate, pollo, pescado y yuca, para elaborar fritos y tamuga. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa y tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 12 enterprising women of Miskito ethnicity. They live in the Wawa Boom community, known for the Wawa River, which is located approximately 80 kilometers from the city of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They decided to name the communal bank El Lancho, because it is like an iron ferry that moves vehicles and the population from one side to the other of the mighty river, so they can reach the Puerto Cabezas and Waspam municipalities, and Triángulo Minero in Caribe Norte. The members of the communal bank have placed wooden tables with umbrellas to protect them from the sun and rain on the left side of this ferry in order to be able to rely on their own source of income and to sell their fried meat products of chicken, pig, fish, and tamuga, carbonated drinks, sodas, and yucca and banana cakes.

Mary Lee is the coordinator of the communal bank. She is 39 years old, married, and has 7 children. Four are adolescents who attend elementary school in the community school of Wawa Boom, and three are underage. Her husband works informally as an artisanal fisherman. She has been working selling fried meats to the population that crosses the Wawa river on the Lanchón for 6 years with the intention of providing for her family. She asks for this loan to buy: snacks, carbonated drinks, filipitas (a variety of banana), salt, oil, vinegar, cabbage, tomato, chicken, fish and yucca, to make fried meat and tamuga (a Nicaraguan snack). Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman and to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy: snacks, carbonated drinks, filipitas (a variety of banana), salt, oil, vinegar, cabbage, tomato, chicken, fish and yucca, to make fried meat and tamuga (a Nicaraguan snack).

loans.name: Ekome Feemo-Krobo Bukom Group

texts.en:
Patricia is a 29-year-old woman who is married and has a lovely family, with a son aged 5 years. This humble family lives in a community in Teshie Krobo.

To generate the necessary income and provide for her family, Patricia sells plates, cups and clothes. She has pursued her business for the last five years.

With hopes of improving the quality of her customer services, Patricia has decided to request a loan to purchase more stocks sell to her customers. With this investment, she hopes to generate greater customer satisfaction.

Patricia's aspirations in life are to have her own business location, to pay for her son's studies, and to improve her income.

She is the leader of the Ekome Feemo-Krobo Bukom group and located at the left side of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abdelaziz

texts.en: Abdelaziz is 31, married, and has 3 children. He has a small fattening project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales of milk, cheese and butter, so he can afford education for his children.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола душевно приятная женщина. Ей 41 года. Она живет с мужем и детьми. Она работает в детском садике. Однажды произошла трагедия и в результате семейная пара погибла, и у них остался ребенок. Зилола с мужем усыновили их ребенка. Теперь приемный ребенок живет у них. Ему уже 19 лет. Он учится в Государственном Университете города Худжанд. Зилола как его мать поддерживает и помогает ему. Его обучение платное и скоро будет нужно оплатить следующий год обучения, но у Зилолы и у мужа нет таких средств, но у Зилолы не возникает вопросов на счет продолжения его обучения и она сделает все, чтобы он продолжил учебу. И по этой причине он обращается за кредитом.
texts.en: Zilola is a sincere and pleasant 41-year-old woman.  She lives with her husband and her family and she works in a preschool.  Unfortunately, the family was struck by a tragedy and lost two children, leaving them with just one child.  Zilola and her husband decided to adopt another child, who lives with them and is now 19 years old.  This young man studies at the State University of the city of Khujand.  Zilola, as well as the child's biological mother, supports and helps him.  His studies are not free and the next year's tuition will soon need to be paid.  However, Zilola and her husband do not have enough money for this payment.  For Zilola, there is no question that her adopted son needs to pursue his education, and she's doing everything she can to ensure that he gets an education.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's studies.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
La socia Soraida pertenece al banco comunal “Hatun Sayhua” , ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene 37 años y una familia por quien  velar y por quienes trabajar casi todo el día, la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales y a su tienda de abarrotes , su deseo es ampliar su negocio por fin de año.
Soraida  solicito el préstamo para comprar azucar , cereales y leche, para abastecer sus tienda de abarrotes y complacer a sus clientes.

La socia está contenta y complacida con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Soraida belongs to the communal bank "Hatun Sayhua." She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She is 37 years old and has a family that she looks out for and for whom she works almost all day. She raises animals and has a grocery store. Her wish is to expand her business for the end of the year.

Soraida applied for the loan to purchase sugar, grains, and milk to stock her grocery store and satisfy her customers.

She is happy and pleased with the loan because this way she will continue forward, and she promised to make her agreed-upon payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, grains, and milk.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 38 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Daisy has been farming corn and vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is 60 years old and he lives with his unmarried and disabled son in the city of Hrazdan in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. His wife died several years ago, and so he cares for his son, house and farm by himself.

On his farm Edik has cows, a pig and several piglets. He earns an income mainly by raising pigs and farming wheat. He sells his hogs to several butchers in the area and his wheat directly from his farm. He works hard but still earns barely enough to properly care for his son.

Edik has applied for a 500,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to buy wheat seedlings and fodder for his animals.

loans.use: to buy wheat seedlings and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina pertenece al banco “Hatun Sayhua”, ubicado en el distrito de Lamay , en la provincia de Calca y departamento del Cusco.
Reina  se dedica a  su negocio que es  crianza de animales menores.
La socia tiene 38 años de edad, tiene su familia, es por ellos que ella lucha a diario. 
Reina  solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y pasto, para dar de comer a sus animalitos, que luego los vende en el mercado. Su deseo es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

La socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Reina belongs to the "Hatun Sayhua" communal bank, located in the district of Lamay, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Reina works in her business of raising small animals. She is 38 years old, and she has a family. It is for them that she works hard every day.

Reina applied for the loan to purchase corn and fodder to feed her little animals, which she will then sell in the market. Her wish is to have a better quality of life.

This [communal bank] member is happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy corn and fodder.

loans.name: Yahuar -Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YAHUAR -CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Muriel se dedica a su Quinta Campestre, ella es muy trabajadora, tiene 2 hijos por quien salir adelante cada día. Por eso le pone todo el empeño a su negocio.
La socia Muriel tiene 37 años y solicito el préstamo para ampliar su negocio, ya que es la única forma de tener más ingresos, y obtener la tan ansiada calidad de vida.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar manteles y platos, ya que es importante renovar capital de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de farmacia.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio.
texts.en:
The members belong to Yahuar-Cusco Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Muriel, earns a living in her rustic restaurant. She's very hardworking and has two children to make progress for every day, so she puts all her effort into her business.

Muriel, 37, requested the loan to expand her business, because it's her only source of more income and of realizing the quality of life she so desires. She's buying tablecloths and plates because it's important to update her working capital.

The other members work in an Internet business, a grocery store business, a pharmacy business, and clothing sales.

Muriel's grateful to those who share in her dream through this loan.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths and plates.

loans.name: Jose Edgar

texts.es:
José Edgar con 31 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de edad de 9 y 6 años de edad, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café a la fecha cuenta con 1 hectárea de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad, esta en segundo año de producción, actividad lo realiza hace 10 años en terreno propio. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz amarillo criollo duro, a la fecha tiene 1 hectárea, así mismo a la cría de animales menores como (patos, gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes), cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátanos, vitucas, frutas y otros), Siendo estos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José Edgar es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en: Jose Edgar is 31 years old and has a domestic partner. He lives in his own house of rustic material in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca in Peru, with his partner and their two young children, 9 and 6 years old. He has very good personal and work references. The inhabitants of this town work mainly in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. He works in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee. Up to now, he has 1 hectare of the Catimor variety, a plantation which is 3 years old and in its second year of production. He has done this business for 10 years in his own land. Additionally, he works cultivating yellow creole corn. Up to now, he has one hectare of it. He also raises small animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, pigs and guinea pigs, and he cultivates basic staples such as cassava, bananas, vitucas, fruits and other things, some which are for his own consumption and sometimes to sell. The loan will be to invest in maintaining his crops. With it he will obtain better production and better income so he can improve his quality of life and that of his family. Jose Edgar is a recurrent partner of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing the loan with his domestic partner.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his crops.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old and from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mariano, who is into a buy-and-sell business. Life in a developing economy has many challenges, but Filipinos are known to be resilient and do their best to make ends meet.

To augment their income and send their child to college, Julieta opened a small general store. It has been doing quite well for three years already. She buys essential food items and toiletries from wholesalers and then sells them at retail prices.

Julieta is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. to sell at her small store, and partly to pay for some direct-selling personal products. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial aid that will be given to her.

Julieta dreams that someday she will own a bigger grocery store and that her daughter will finish her college education. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and it is there that she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and some direct-selling personal products.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 58 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Simplicia has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Simplicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is 50 years old. He lives alone in Zugdidi district. Mamuka grows nut trees on the family owned agricultural land. He sells harvested nuts locally at a good price. Mamuka wants to start animal husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1000 GEL. With the received credit Mamuka will purchase a cow and will start husbandry business. He already owns a shed for the cow and is experienced in this activity. He will start producing dairy products and will improve the living conditionsfor himself.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start husbandry business

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a maize farmer from Sarkin Noma village. As a member of Babban Gona, Anas is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Anas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the price at harvest.

Anas is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada owns a women's clothes shop in her hometown, located in Chouf, Lebanon. She opened it around ten years ago when her children graduated from school in order to support her family financially. She loves clothes and knows her clients well, which allows her to choose the right collections for her shop.

She is now 52. Her husband is a school bus driver, and her children traveled to work abroad, which allows them to send their parents some money every month.

Nada is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She plans to use the loan to buy new collections of clothes for her shop. She sells women's clothes and lingerie in her shop and is expecting an increased demand before the holidays. Increasing her stock will therefore allow her to maximize her sales and income by satisfying her clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 38 years old. She lives with her brother in Batumi district. Madona is unemployed and wants to open a food market.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit, she will open a food market and will work there. This will give her a chance to generate a stable income and expand the business in future.

Madona is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market and generate a stable income.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a banana vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Munta Royal School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Benon. He is the Executive Director of Munta Royal School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mityana with 800 students.

Munta Royal School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Munta Royal School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Benon ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Julita Lyn

texts.en:
Julita Lyn is 37 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Julita Lyn has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a 42-year-old woman and a resident of Carles, Iloilo where fishing is most likely their main sources of income. Like the other people in her community, she and her husband are doing this livelihood to earn and sustain every day. Aside from helping her husband in fishing, Jonalyn successfully runs a small sari-sari (variety) store in their house. And she was doing this for a year. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy stocks for her store such as snack foods, toiletries, spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs and cooking oil. Other part also of her loan amount is to buy new fishing net and fishing rope. In this way, she and her husband were able to enhance their catch and increase their earnings as well. In the future, Jonalyn dreams to let her daughter finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net and fishing rope; buy stocks for her store such as snack foods, toiletries, spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs and cooking oil

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mística está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Paula quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de su sacrificio quiere salir adelante y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas y venderlas, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad de mejorar y crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group "Rosa Mistica" is in its fourth [loan] cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. In addition, they are in the program to eliminate poverty, working and striving to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Señora Paula, who sells food. She is very good at what she does, and it is for that reason that she has a very good clientele. She is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead and grow through her sacrifice.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies in order to be able to make and sell her foods, such as meat, condiments, bakery products, and other items, and in this way be able to continue with her sales. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve and grow in her business undertaking.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food, such as meat, condiments, bakery products, and other items.

loans.name: Yefrin Adonay

texts.es: Yefrin, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero, vive con su madre en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, y en busca de obtener más ingresos hace 3 años comenzó con el cultivo de café, el cual vende en húmedo, seco y en uva en el mercado de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de café y la limpieza del mismo, con ello espera tener una mejor cosecha en su finca al brindarle una mejor asistencia. Su meta es formar una familia, salir adelante y cultivar más área de café.
texts.en: Yefrin is 24 years old, single, and lives with his mother in a small town in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He has always worked in agriculture, cultivating maize and beans. Looking to obtain greater earnings, three years ago he began to grow coffee, which he sells rain or shine in the local market. He is applying for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras (Honduran currency) to purchase fertilizer to cultivate and clean the coffee crop, and thereby have a better crop in his farm to provide him with greater earnings. His goals are to have a family, be successful and cultivate more coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate and clean his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 24 years old. She lives with her mother in Akhmeta district. Ana is unemployed and wants to start her own activity and requested a loan. The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of food products and will open a market. This will give her a chance to generate stable income. With increased income Ana will expand the business in future. She is very motivated a awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market and generate stable income

loans.name: Peace-Shalom Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Augustina, age 45, is a Ga ethnic woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her a son. The family is living in Teshie district.

Her family’s main income is from selling okra and firewood, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to expand her business to sell, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the business; selling much okra and firewood will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from ID-Ghana on time.

Augustina is the group representative of the Peace-Shalom group.

loans.use: to purchase more okra and firewood for constant delivery to her customers.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en:
Ubale is maize farmer from Sabon Gari Daji village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ubale is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ubale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ubale can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ubale is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is 31 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children and her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Afshan has also been doing her business of clothing selling for the past 4 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Afshan needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose therefore She has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Afshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 26 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 7 children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of her family. Shahida is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahuza has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support he can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahuza will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. She is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Virgen de Guadalupe  está en el 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de ropas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha y se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados y también para la compra de ropas variadas para poder seguir con sus ventas.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en: The group is called "Virgen de Guadalupe" It is in its second loan cycle of the program of the Women's committee. They are doing a poll on poverty elimination and they are struggling and working hard to move ahead. One of its members is Estela who works selling cosmetics and clothes. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who works hard to improve her life conditions through her work and effort. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying diverse cosmetics and also to buy diverse clothes to continue with her sales. She is grateful for the given opportunity to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy diverse cosmetics and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores - Poroy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al Banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES DE POROY", ubicado en el departamento del Cusco.

La socia Vilma pertenece a este banco comunal, ella tiene cuatro hijos y se dedica a la venta de frutas en una carretilla.
La socia saca adelante a su familia y todos los días sale muy temprano a laborar, ella tiene 33 años y es muy dedicada su deseo es salir a delante junto con sus hijos.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar sandia y plátanos.
La socios que sale en la foto adjunta pidió  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, venta de refrescos, venta de comida, venta de huevos y venta de golosinas.
Los socios agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These are members of the community bank "Señor De Los Temblores de Poroy" (Lord of the Tremors of Poroy), located in the department of Cusco. Vilma is a member of this community bank, she has four children and sells fruit from a wheelbarrow. She raises up her family, every day going to work very early. She is 33 and is very dedicated in her desire to get ahead with her children.

Vilma requested a loan to buy watermelon and bananas. The member who appears in the superimposed photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons. The other members are engaged in selling vegetables, selling soft drinks, food sales, selling eggs, and candy sales.

The members give thanks for the credit granted and promise to pay their repayments punctually.

loans.use: [to buy] watermelon and bananas.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Kuña Guapa Aty” es un grupo nuevo formado en Ciudad del Este, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una se destaca por su entusiasmo y esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marta, quien se dedica a las confecciones, hace ya mucho tiempo que tiene este trabajo y es por medio de el que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones. 
Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder crecer y mejorar en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña Guapa Aty" is a new group formed in Ciudad del Este. The members are in the program for eliminating poverty, where each one stands out for her enthusiasm and efforts.

One of the members is Señora Marta, who does dressmaking. She has already done this work for a long time, and it is through it that she has the means to be able to help her family. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabrics in quantity and in this way be able to continue with her dressmaking.

They are grateful for the opportunity that everyone is receiving to be able to grow and improve in their business undertakings.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in quantity for sewing.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Her name is Mely, 51 years old, from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Felisisimo, her business partner and they two children in College and two more who are already working. Being a strong, business-minded woman, she finds ways and means to earn as much as she can to provide for her family's basic needs and to send her children to College. 

Mely is thankful for KIVA's cause and its lenders who support small businessmen like her. She runs a "carinderia", a local eatery selling and serving affordable viands for the masses. To sustain her eatery she hopes that you could lend her an amount of Php 10,000 which she will use to pay for meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings to prepare dishes to sell at her food stall. 

She prays that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She dreams to see her children become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for meat, veggies and seasonings for her small  eatery.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a resident of Estancia, Iloilo. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 21 years old, while her youngest child is three years old. Her husband raised them through fishing; thus, her husband is a fisherman while Luzviminda sells imported used clothes known as “ukay-ukay”. She has been doing this for how many years to earn and helps her husband in providing the needs of her children. With this, Luzviminda is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy imported used clothes to sell. In this way, she will be able to enhance her livelihood and augment her profit.

loans.use: to buy imported used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elvie

texts.en:
Ma. Elvie is 45 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Ma. Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elvie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, eggs, etc. to sell.

Ma. Elvie has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, eggs, etc. 

Ma. Elvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her buy and sell dried coconut meat business.

Leonida has been in this business for 12 years. Leonida earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, two of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past six years, selling meat goat . She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Salamatu now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: : to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi learned sewing from her mother as she was growing up. She is 22 years old and lives in Tripoli with her parents and four brothers who still go to school. Her mother is unemployed and her father works as a carpenter.
After graduating from school, Hanadi decided to start a career in sewing by fixing and sewing clothes for her friends and relatives. After a few months, she started receiving orders from other clients who liked her work. She works from home and with almost three years of experience, she is planning on starting to improve her business.
She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy a faster sewing machine that will allow her to decrease her processing and delivery time. With this improvement in her productivity, she will be able to serve more clients, increase her income and continue supporting her younger brothers financially.

loans.use: to buy a faster machine

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance who has applied for a loan of UGX1000,000/=. He is a business man owning a depot of soda. In bid to increase on his working capital /expand on the business, he has applied for a loan of UGX2000,000/=, however he is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

He is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since he is now able to fund her business.
Pictured is Joram and the UGAFODE Credit officer in charge of his loan.

loans.use: to boost business by buying more stock of soda

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 26 years old and is a single mother of a 6 years old girl Soledad is a cook and she presents good dishes at many fairs and she is also attending college at night as she is studying

Soledad lives at her parents' house. She and her child occupy only one room because the place is small and the place where she lives is very cold Soledad needs a loan to fix the kitchen at her parent's house because that is the place where she cooks the dishes she sells, as you can see in the picture

loans.use: to fix the kitchen at her parent's house because that is the place where she cooks.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y juntos tienen seis hijos, pero solo cinco viven en su casa.

Marcos, se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño, su padre le enseño a trabajando en el campo y gracias a eso el aprendió esta actividad y ahora puede hacer sus cultivos y de esa manera mantiene a su familia.

Marcos, necesita el préstamo para comprar malla metálica para proteger sus cultivos y para comprar 1 saco de abono fertilizante, de esta forma tendrá mejores cultivos libres de plagas y así podrá tener mayores ingresos económicos.

Marcos, sueña con hacer mayores siembras y además desea ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios para que puedan desarrollarse mejor y puedan tener un mejor trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos, who is 52 years old, studied until the fifth grade, and is married. His wife dedicates herself to the household work. Together they have six children, but only five are living at home.

Marcos has been engaged in agriculture since childhood. His father taught him how to work in the field and thanks to that Marcos learned this activity; and now he can grow his crops and thus support his family.

Marcos needs a loan to buy metal mesh (chicken wire) to protect his crops, and to buy 1 bag of fertilizer. Thus he will have better crops, free of pests, so that he may have a better income.

Marcos dreams of sowing larger crops, and also he wants to help his children with their studies so that they can develop better and may have better jobs and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal mesh (chicken wire) to protect his crops and to buy 1 bag of fertilizer.

loans.name: Radjen

texts.en: Radjen is 57 years old and lives together with his wife and 2 married sons. He works as a school watchman and needs a loan of srd 10.000 to expand his small wooden house with a living room and a kitchen. Radjen sons are fish salesmen and will help their father to repay this loan.

loans.use: to expand his small wooden house with a living room and a kitchen.

loans.name: Maisarah Islamic School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Abdallah. He is the Director of Maisarah Islamic School, a mixed school in the urban area of Bwaise Kazo in Kampala with 350 students. Maisarah Islamic School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Maisarah Islamic School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Abdallah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Horqueta-Concepción, la cual es una zona de conflicto social, se encuentra en crecimiento por lo que las integrantes están esforzándose por mejorarla.
La Sra. Minerva es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, comenta que pese a la competencia que hay hoy en día, de todas maneras se esfuerza por poder salir adelante. Minerva es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esmera por poder crecer y Salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, y otras prendas y de esa forma tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) is in its third [loan] cycle in the women's committee program. It is located in the city Horqueta-Concepción, which is a zone of social conflict. It is growing, and so the members are making an effort to improve it.

Señora Minerva is one of the members who works in selling clothing of all types. She comments that in spite of the competition that there is now, she make an effort in every way to be able to get ahead. Minerva is a very hard-working woman who goes to great efforts to be able to grow and get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various articles of clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other items, and in this way have a good variety to offer her customers and continue with her sales as she has been doing.
