loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Solofomboahangy Hanitriniaina

texts.fr:
Solofomboahangy a 35 ans, elle vit en concubinage avec le père de son enfant. Le couple a 3 enfants dont deux scolarisés (13-11 ans). 
Elle confectionne et  vend des shorts et  barboteuses depuis 2011 jusqu'à ce jour. Le lieu de de vente se situe au marché du village. Avant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise en zone franche. En situation de chômage, elle a créé cette activité. L’activité s’est bien développée d’où cette demande de prêt pour l’augmentation de stock  des matières premières.
Le ménage vit dans une maison en bois. Elle projette de construire une maison à partir de l’épargne constituée afin d’éviter de payer un loyer.
texts.en:
Solofomboahangy is 35 years old and lives with the father of her child. The couple has 3 children, 2 of whom (11 and 13 years old) are enrolled in school. She has been making shorts and rompers and selling them in the village market since 2011. Before that, she was working for a company in a free trade zone. 

She started this business while she was unemployed. The business has thrived, so Solofomboahangy is requesting this loan to increase her raw materials inventory. The family lives in a timber house. Solofomboahangy plans to use savings to build a house so she doesn't have to pay rent.

loans.use: buy fabric, sewing thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 21 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, las Integrantes se encuentran contentas por formar parte del comité por contar con una oportunidad de poder trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos.
La Sra. Sunilda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer comidas, todos los días se levanta muy temprano a preparar sus comidas y después las vende por su barrio, comenta que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar en su emprendimiento, ya que a través de él puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas para la venta, como ser carnes, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 21 women inspired by a better, higher quality of life. The members are content with being part of the committee, as they rely upon the opportunity to be able to work and generate their own incomes.

Ms. Sunilda is one of this group's members. She earns a living making food. Every day, she wakes up very early to prepare food and then sells it in her neighborhood. She says that she is making her greatest effort to be able to improve her undertaking, since through it she can have the means to be able to help her loved ones.

She requests this loan to be able to invest it in purchasing food making supplies to be able to make her food for sale, such as: meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables, and others. In this way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food such as: meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a man in his early 50s. He has been married for a long time to a loving wife. However, not so long ago he was blessed with an unexpected daughter. He is very happy with her but thinks he is a little old to raise a daughter. Nevertheless, he dedicates his life and work to being a good father and provider. He is very proud of his daughter who does well at school.

Jose is looking for a 15,790 MXN loan which will allow him to do 3 different things: first he will make improvements to his house, such as fix the ceiling and change the floor; then he would like to fix the van he uses to transport items for his food stand; and finally he would also like to buy materials to stock his business such as food and sodas to resell.

To make his living, Jose runs a food stand outside a construction site. He has been doing well for the last 3 years, and lucky for him, the construction is going to take much more time.

loans.use: to fix his house, restock his business, and fix his van.

loans.name: Diana Zobeyda

texts.es:
El ayudar a los demás ha sido una de las mejores experiencias de Diana, una joven de veinte años de edad, que decidió estudiar medicina para cumplir el sueño de pequeña y apoyar a las personas que no tienen acceso a la salud de calidad. Ella ya había solicitado un préstamo anterior, con el cual pudo pagar un año de la universidad y se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le apoyaron, porque tiene muchos planes que sabe que con su esfuerzo podrá lograr.
Actualmente solicita un nuevo préstamo para pagar otro año de aranceles de sus estudios y así poder garantizar la continuación de sus estudios y seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos. En sus metas está estudiar una especialidad y crear su propio consultorio, mientras tanto planea salir con honores de la universidad.
texts.en:
Helping others has been one of Diana's best experiences. She is a 20-year-old young woman who decided to study medicine to fulfill her childhood dream and to support people who do not have access to quality healthcare.

She had already requested a previous loan, with which she was able to pay for a year of university, and she feels very grateful to all the people who supported her. She has many plans that she knows she will be able to achieve with her effort.

She is currently requesting a new loan to pay for another year of school fees and thus be able to guarantee the continuation of her studies and continue enriching her knowledge. Her goals are to study a speciality and to build her own practice. Meanwhile, she plans to graduate with university honors.

loans.use: to pay for another year of education fees.

loans.name: Lucio Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Lucio tiene 24 años de edad,  es soltero y vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la reparacion y venta de celulares y computadoras y sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.

Lucio su negocio es su mayor fuente de ingresos y estos le han permitido salir adelante con su familia, esta solicitando el prestamo para la compra de carcasas, tintas de impresora y accesorios para poder reparar los celulares y computadoras, es un joven muy trabajador y espera que esta inversion le permirta salir adelante con su negocio.

Lucio sueña que su negocio en un futuro que sea uno de los mas reconocidos y poder emplear a mas personas para que le ayuden con su negocio.


Trojes, Honduras  - Nobiembre  del 2015.
texts.en: Lucio is 24 years old. He is single and lives in a community of Trojes, in the eastern region of Honduras. His main business is to repair and sell cell phones and computers, and his customers are the friends and neighbors of his community. Lucio's business is his greatest source of income, and this has allowed him to move ahead with his family. He is requesting the loan to buy cases, printer ink and accessories in order to repair cell phones and computers. He is a very hardworking young man, and he hopes that his investment will allow him to move ahead with his business. Lucio dreams that in the future his business will be one of the most recognized ones, and that he will be able to employ more people to help him with his business. Trojes, Honduras, November 2015.

loans.use: to buy cases, printer ink and accessories for his business.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres en Acción está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comités, son 21 mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por poder crecer, capacitarse y salir adelante.
La Sra. Graciela se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras frescas, ella comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella, ya que tiene productos frescos cada día. Graciela se unió a este grupo para poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y es por ello que pone su mayor entusiasmo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para la venta, como ser bananas, naranjas, peras, piñas, tomates, cebollas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) is in its 4th cycle of the committee program. They are 21 hard-working women who are striving to grow, to learn, and to succeed.

Señora Graciela is engaged in selling fresh fruit and vegetables. She says that she has a good clientele who always buy from her, because she has fresh produce every day. Graciela joined this group in order to be able to learn and improve her living conditions, and it is for this that she puts forth her best effort.

She requests this loan in order to be able to buy fresh fruits and vegetables for resale, such as: bananas, oranges, pears, pineapples, tomatoes, onions and others. This way she will be able to continue with her sales and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables for resale, such as: bananas, oranges, pears, pineapples, tomatoes, onions and others.

loans.name: Onua-Do-2 Group

texts.en:
Mercy is a widow with three siblings and a child who all go to school. She is a baker and operates a retail shop in a trading center dealing in general merchandise. She is strategically located and boasts of a wide range of home product sales that she offers her customers. At times she gets challenged with limited capital to provide the variety of items in demand. She has applied for a loan from ID-Ghana to buy more beverages, food items, stationery, toiletries,and other items that she will sell to her customers.

Mercy is the group leader of Onua-Do group of four members.  She is wearing a white-blue dress in the middle of the picture.

loans.use: to buy more beverages, food items, stationery, toiletries, and other items that she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 36, married and has four children. Her husband works in a factory in Cairo, and she has a small grocery store.

Nadia has applied for a 5,000 EGP loan through Kiva's field partner Together Association to buy some groceries to sell such as oil, pasta and rice. She is working to increase her income and afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy some groceries to sell such as oil, pasta and rice.

loans.name: Porfirio Jose

texts.es:
La agricultura es una tradición que nadie mata en las familias rurales, Porfirio es parte de una de estos grupos que creció en el campo, donde aprendió de su padre a sembrar y no fue hasta 25 años que emprendió por si solo para poder sustentar la alimentación en su hogar con una esposa y cuatro hijos. Ahora cultiva frijoles, sorgo y maíz, teniendo siempre el apoyo completo de su familia.
Durante el verano Porfirio viaja a un país vecino, pues quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos y a su esposa.  A sus 43 años no deja de trabajar y expresa que siente que está empezando apenas, por lo que decidió invertir en su agricultura y solicitar un préstamo para comprar abono, urea y refrescantes, así mismo para pagar a los trabajadores que le ayudan. Esto le permitirá tener mejor rendimiento y ahorrar un poco para comprar más tierras.
texts.en:
Agriculture is a tradition that nobody kills in rural families. Porfirio is part of one of these groups that grew up in the countryside. He learned to grow from his father but it wasn't until he was 25 that he started out on his own so as to be able to provide the food for his household with a wife and four children. He currently cultivates beans, sorghum and corn always having the total support of his family.

During the summer Porfirio travels to a neighboring country as he wants to provide the best for his wife and children. At 43 years of age he doesn't stop working and he says that he feels like he is barely beginning. So he has decided to invest in his farming and request a loan to buy manure, urea, drinks as well as pay the workers who help him. This will allow him to have better output and save a little to buy more land.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, drinks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Noralba

texts.es:
Ella es Noralba es una dama de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida con la cual genera los ingresos para alimentar a su familia, ella tiene dos hijos, es madre cabeza de familia, separada de su esposo y aunque este la apoya, le toco asumir la mayoría de los gastos del mantenimiento de la casa.
Su propósito es seguir trabajando aumentar su producción para generar recursos, a esta combativa mujer le sobran pantalones para asumir esta responsabilidad la cual afronta con mucha madurez y compromiso.
Actualmente la señora Noralba se encuentra solicitando un apoyo para mejorar la cantidad de alimentos diarios que produce, con el objetivo de aumentar los ingresos, dicho apoyo será para la compra de utensilios de cocina e inventario para preparar tamales y fiambres, entre ellos, grano, hoja de plátano, arroz, fríjol,  verduras, carne.
texts.en:
This is Noralba. She is a 48-year old lady who makes her living selling food that she prepares, which generates the income she uses to feed her family. Noralba has two children. She is head of her household, as she is separated from her husband. Although her husband helps her out, she is the one who takes on the majority of the costs of supporting her household.

Noralba's plan is to keep working toward increasing her production to generate more money. This spirited woman is more than equipped to take on this responsibility, which she faces with great maturity and commitment.

Señora Noralba is currently requesting some help to increase the quantity of food she can produce each day. Her goal is to increase her income. The help she is requesting will be for purchasing kitchen utensils and inventory so she can make tamales and "fiambres" (cold-cut salads), including grains, banana leaves, rice, beans, vegetables and meat.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and inventory for making tamales and "fiambres" (coldcut salads), including grains, banana leaves, rice, beans, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Sebastiana Victoria

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una campesina de 67 años de edad, una persona que nació y se crío en el campo y que espera que sean el lugar de su muerte.
Ella se dedica a la cría de animales y el cultivo, aprendió de dicha actividad gracias a sus padres y la ejerce hace más de 20 años.
Ver trabajar a esta mujer que tiene una edad considerable es de admirar, sus alientos, ganas, ímpetu y esfuerzo que coloca en sus campos es la razón de porque ha subsistido y no ha pasado necesidades todo este tiempo.
Esta luchadora mujer solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, necesita principalmente abonos, pesticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en: Sebastiana is a 67 year old farmer. She was born and grew up in the countryside, and she hopes that it is where she will die. She works raising animals and in agriculture. She learned this activity thanks to her parents, and she has worked doing such for more than 20 years. To see this woman work at her age is admirable. Her motivation, desire and the effort she puts in her fields is the reason why she has moved ahead and has been able to support herself this whole time. This hardworking woman is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs for her crops. She specially needs fertilizers, pesticides and fungicides.

loans.use: to buy specially fertilizers, pesticides and fungicides to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Virginia Maria

texts.es:
Virginia es una joven emprendedora residente del municipio de montería, un sector que actualmente es considera en postconflicto.
Ella tiene una razón para luchar y querer salir adelante, su hijo de 5 años que representa todo para ella, es su razón de ser y trabaja diariamente en un negocio que constituyo de venta de misceláneas para llevar el alimento y pagar los gastos educativos de su hijo.
Su negocio nació de su creatividad, ella se rebusco el dinero, la mercancía todo fue obra de ella, lo que tiene es el fruto de un gran esfuerzo que espera seguir realizando para crecer día a día, hasta consolidar un enrome negocio de venta de mercancía.
Actualmente esta joven luchadora, emprendedora y sonriente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecerse de surtido para la temporada de fin de año.
Comprará productos de papelería, juguetes, y decoraciones navideñas.
texts.en:
Virginia is a young entrepreneur who lives in the municipality of Monteria.  This neighborhood is currently considered as post-conflict.  She has a reason to fight and wants to get ahead, because her 5 year-old son is everything to her.  He is her reason for living and for working daily in her business, which consists of selling a variety of miscellaneous goods.  This way she can bring food home and pay for her son's educational expenses.

Virginia's business is a product of her creativity.  She gathered together the money, and the merchandise was all her doing.  What she has is the result of a great effort that she hopes to continue forward with, growing the business day by day and even building up to a huge business selling merchandise.

At this time, this young, tenacious, enterprising, and smiling woman is requesting a loan to stock her store with merchandise for the end of the year sales.  She will buy stationery items, games, and Christmas decorations.

loans.use: to buy stationery products, games, and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Nicarnor Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Nicarnor es un hombre de 42 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, los cuales cría en las porquerizas ubicadas desde su hogar para reducir costos, tiene la cerda de cría y solo debe invertir en alimento de engorde para estos.
Un hijo de 8 y una princesa de 5 son la felicidad del señor Nicarnor, son sus hijos por los cuales se encuentra trabajando 12 horas diarias en su negocio, incluso más para generar mayores recursos que le permitan mejorar su hogar, su empresa y brindarles educación.
El cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando para abastecerse de crías de cerdos ya que las ventas han estado buenas, también comprara alimento de engorde y activos para su negocio el cual atiende al aire libre.
texts.en:
Señor Nicarnor is a 42-year old man who makes his living selling pork. He raises the pigs in the pigpens located around his home, which reduces his expenses. Señor Nicarnor owns the sow, so he only needs to invest in animal feed for the piglets.

An 8-year old son and a 5-year old princess are señor Nicarnor's joys. It is for his children that he works twelve hours a day at his business. Sometimes his works even more to earn the income that allows him to improve his home and his business and to give his children an education.

Señor Nicarnor is currently requesting a loan to get himself some more piglets, as his sales have been good. He will also purchase animal feed and assets for his business, which is an open air business.

loans.use: to get himself some more piglets, as his sales have been good.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Angela es una dulce vendedora de alimentos la cual tiene 52 años de edad, es muy sonriente, carismática y tierna, ella es una mujer soltera sin hijos, trabaja para pagar la renta de la casa, para pagar servicios públicos, su alimentación y demás cosas que resultan en el día a día.
Inicio su negocio como independiente en el año 2013, buscando generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que veía que su sueño de comprar vivienda estaba muy lejano siendo empleada.

Ella busca abrir nuevos locales para generar empleo, pero debe primero preocuparse por consolidar y posicionar su negocio en la mente de los clientes.

Solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de productos como obleas, cremas, solteritas, diferentes productos que son aperitivos dulces, ella distribuye la materia prima al por mayor a vendedores de calle.

Espera que con este inversión pueda mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Angela is a 52-year-old sweet foods seller. She is very smiley, charismatic, and tender. She is a single woman without children. She works to pay her house's rent, to pay for public services, her food, and the other things that come up day to day.

She started her independent business in 2013, searching to generate better income in order to improve her quality of life. She has already seen her dream of buying a home--she had been very far from her employment.

She is looking to open new shops to generate employment, but she should first concern herself with consolidating and positioning her business in her clients' minds.

She requests a loan, which she will invest in buying products such as wafers, creams, and solteritas--different products that are sweet snacks. She distributes the raw materials wholesale to street vendors.

She hopes that, with this investment, she can improve her sales, expand her clientele, and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy products such as wafers, creams, solteritas--different products that are sweet snacks.

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Juana es una dulce y espiritual mujer de 37 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender alimentos pero con el aliciente que lo hace para personas de tercera edad que tiene una alimentación y trato especial.
Ella es feliz realizando dicha profesión, la llena espiritualmente y le permite mantenerse. Juana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de sabanas, utensilios de cocina, enseres y diferentes alimentos para la preparación de alimentos.
texts.en:
This is Juana a sweet and spiritual 37 year old woman. She works selling meals but with the incentive of doing it for senor citizens who have a special diet and treatment.

She is happy to carry out this profession, it fulfills her spiritually and it allows her to support herself. Juana wants to request a loan to buy sheets, cooking utensils, equipment and a variety of foods to prepare meals.

loans.use: to care for retired people buying sheets, equipment and special foods for these people.

loans.name: Filimon

texts.es: El Sr. Filemón y su esposa la Sra. Filomena viven en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quienes se dedican a la actividad Agropecuaria que es el único sustento familiar con el que cuentan actualmente ya que ambas personas mayores de edad viven solas en su domicilio, en la actualidad están empezando a desarrollar la actividad de la Apicultura (producción de miel) ya que recibieron capacitación de ONG´s. como la fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda de Acción Bolivia, razón por lo cual requieren del préstamo para poder implementar su producción en la apicultura y producir miel, para hacer conocer que dichas personas se dedicaron toda su vida a la actividad agropecuaria y es el único medio que tienen para su sustento diario y otros gastos; con esta nueva actividad obtendrán mayores ingresos y de esa forma vivir en mejores condiciones de vida en el futuro.
texts.en: Filemón and his wife live in the community of Cumandayti, in the municipality Villa Vaca Guzmán, in the department of Chuquisaca. They earn a living farming and raising livestock, which is currently their only source of income because both are older and they live alone in their home. They are beginning to take up beekeeping (producing honey) since they were trained by nonprofits such as the Nor Sud y Ayuda de Acción Bolivia foundations. For this reason, they need this loan: to begin their beekeeping work and produce honey. Both he and his wife dedicated their lives to farming and raising livestock, which is the only way they have to provide for themselves. With this new business, they will obtain more profits and, in this way, have a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: carry out his beekeeping and produce honey to sell so he can earn more profits for his wife.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José con 41 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Copallin,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo y producción de arroz, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas y 1 hectárea de variedad silva(2 meses de trasplantado) y 1 hectárea de variedad Esperanza(por trasplantar) resistente a enfermedades y plagas.Con una experiencia en el rubro hace 20 años. Adicionalmente se dedica ala venta de animales menores.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de arroz variedad Silva,en fase de cultivo, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
41-year-old José is in a civil partnership and lives in his own home made of rustic materials together with his partner and his four children in Copallin district, Bagua province, Amazonas department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from some of the area's residents. The majority of this town's inhabitants earn a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He earns a living in agriculture, specifically cultivating and producing rice. To date, he has two hectares: one hectare of silva variety (transplanted at two months) and one hectare of esperanza variety (through transplantation) which is resistant to sickness and plagues. He has 20 years of experience in this line of work. Additionally, he earns a living selling small animals.

The loan's destiny will be to invest in maintaining one hectare of Silva variety rice, which is in its cultivation phase, assuring good production for the 2016 season. This will be reflected in a greater volume of sales, and consequently, he will obtain better income and thus be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

José is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing with his partner.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining a hectare of silva rice.

loans.name: Surley Yenines

texts.es: Surley de 29 años es una madre amorosa de una niña de 5 años, ellas viven en un humilde barrio de Barranquilla y encontró la oportunidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia a través de la propuesta que su pareja sentimental le realizó, la cual consistía en comercializar ropa y calzado de su país de residencia, el vive en el extranjero y allí consigue muy buenas ofertas de productos en diferentes marcas que se las envía a Surley para su negocio. En la actualidad lleva 5 años vendiéndoles a amigos, familiares, vecinos, conocidos y referidos con muy buenos resultados.  Como la temporada que se avecina es de alta demanda, ella requiere de un capital suficiente para cumplirles a todos sus clientes, por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar camisas, pantalones, vestidos, fragancias, splash, talcos entre otros. Su mayor anhelo es tener visa para encontrarse con su amor y realizarse como una familia.
texts.en:
29-year-old Surley is the loving mother of a 5-year-old girl. They live in a poor neighborhood of Barranquilla.

Through her partner's suggestion, she found the opportunity to generate an income to support her family by selling clothing and shoes from her country of residence. He lives abroad, where he obtains very good deals on products from various brands and sends them to Surley for her business.

She currently has 5 years' experience selling them to friends, family members, neighbors, acquaintances, and references, with very good results.

Because the season of high demand is approaching, she needs enough capital to satisfy all her customers. For this, she is requesting a loan, a CrediKiva. It is an opportunity to join the financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and to buy shirts, pants, dresses, fragrances, splashes, talcum powders, etc.

Her greatest desire is to get a visa to meet up with her love and become a family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, dresses, fragrances, splashes, talcum powders, etc.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman; she has three children, one of whom attends school. Dorothy owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dorothy has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition and transportation challenges in her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Lina María una mujer de 33 años de edad que se dedica a prestar servicios de manicura y pedicura a domicilio, ella se desplaza en bicicleta, optó por esta medida por economía y por miedo a las motocicletas. Felizmente casada, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, por los cuales quiso volverse independiente y tener trabajo, el deseo de verlos crecer, estudiar y que nunca pasen necesidades es lo que le brinda fortaleza para salir todos los días con una sonrisa dibujada en su rostro a prestar un excelente servicio que sea capaz de fidelizar a sus clientes.
Lina Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual quiere usar para reparar y darle mantenimiento a su bicicleta de trabajo, comprar surtido de esmaltes, removedores y decoraciones para uñas y cancelar un saldo de un crédito anterior.
texts.en:
This is Lina María. She is a 33-year old woman who makes her living offering in-home manicures and pedicures. She gets around on a bicycle. She decided on this mode of transportation because it made sense financially and because she is afraid of motorcycles.

Lina María is happily married and has two children who are 11- and 5- years old. For their benefit, she decided to go out on her own and get work. Her desires to see her children grow, study and never want for anything give her the strength to go out each day with a smile on her face and offer service excellent enough to build customer loyalty.

Lina María is requesting a loan to repair and maintain her work bicycle, to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover and nail decorations and to pay off the balance on a previous loan.

loans.use: to repair her work bicycle, to purchase supplies for offering manicures and to pay off a previous  balance.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Liezl has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Ana Maria dreams that, one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen food. Lorena is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 47 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Cecelia has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from frozen food.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is 33 years old and he lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region.

Vahan is married and he has two pretty daughters. His wife is employed as a saleswoman at a food market. Vahan works as a distributor at a private company.

Vahan has some plans which he hopes to accomplish before the winter months and he asks for this financial support to make it a reality. He asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD to replace the windows of his flat, which are old and worn out. Changing the windows will keep his flat warmer and more comfortable for his nice family, especially for his children, who are little and attend kindergarten.

loans.use: to replace windows at his flat in order to keep his flat warm and more comfortable for his family.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital. She is applying for a loan of $ 1000,00. Her husband is a business man also. She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

She will buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including rice, sugar, onions, nuts, cooking oils, card gambling, shampoo, slippers, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, because with this loan she can be improving her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, onions, nuts, cooking oils, card gambling, shampoo, slippers, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to improve her business. She is selling kerosene. She started to sell kerosene a few years ago with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy her kerosene every day, and she also brings her kerosene to sell in the market, when it is the market day. She wants expand her business but she does not have enough money, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital. After that she will use it to buy more kerosene.

loans.use: To buy kerosene.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia Adelaida ,la socia continua con su negocio de  crianza de animales menores como pollos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos”, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia s requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos.
La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member is Adelaida. The member is continuing her business of breeding small animals, such as chickens. The member spends a good time at her business, which is going well thanks to the determination she puts into her business every day. The member belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Juntos" ["Always Together"]. The member continues breeding her small animals to later sell them to her clients who order them. The member wishes to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

The member requires the loan to buy chickens and feed.

The member is grateful and appreciates the loan. She promises to complete the payment of her monthly installments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 36-year-old man, supporting eight people in his family. He has a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the past eight years, and he earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

He has applied for his first loan with Visionfund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more stock of goods.

He will use the anticipated profits to put back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shop items for resale.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: El Sr. Teófilo vive en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quien en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria, siendo el único ingreso con el que cuenta por el momento, tiene un hijo que depende de la unidad Familiar por lo que requiere de recursos económicos como apoyo para poder iniciar la actividad de apicultura (producción de miel) ya que cuenta con el conocimiento necesario para afrontar la actividad por la capacitación recibida de ONG´s. como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda de Acción Bolivia, actualmente vive en su domicilio junto con su Familia, el préstamo que requiere es para implementar su producción apícola para producir miel y hacer conocer que dicha persona se dedicó desde muy joven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos de la Familia, con esta nueva actividad obtendrá mayor ingreso y de tal manera poder vivir en mejores condiciones de vida con toda su Familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Teófilo lives in a Cumandayti community that is a part of Villa Vaca Guzmán and Chuquisaca Department. He currently makes his living in agriculture, which is the only income he has for the time being. Sr. Teófilo has a son who is dependent on the family, which is why Sr. Teófilo needs some financial resources to help his start his bee-keeping (honey) business. Thanks to the training he has received from NGOs, such as Fundación Nor Sud and Ayuda de Acción Bolivia, Sr. Teófilo has the knowledge he needs to start his new business.

Sr. Teófilo currently lives in his home with his family. The loan is he requesting is to start his bee-keeping and honey-producing venture. He wants it known that he has made his living in agriculture from a very young age, and it is the only means he has to provide for and cover expenses for his family. With this new business, Sr. Teófilo will earn a greater income and therefore he and his family will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to start production on his bee-keeping business and produce and sell honey so he can generate an income to support his son.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old and married with eight children. With four of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is separated from her husband and she has two sons. After separating from her husband, she tried various jobs to be able to support her children.  Three years ago, she began selling scarves with her oldest son at markets. She goes to markets three days a week. 

With her loan, she wants to buy more items to increase her sales. Her goal is to go to the market every day.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Aynur hanım eşinden ayrılmış, iki oğlu var.  Aynur hanım eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra çocuklarına bakabilmek için çeşitli işlerde çalıştıktan sonra üç yıldır büyük oğlu ile pazarlarda eşarp, fular satışı yapıyor.  Haftanın üç günü pazarlara çıkıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile mal alıp satışını arttırmak istiyor.  Hedefi haftanın her günü pazara çıkmak.

loans.use: to buy more items to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jenna

texts.en:
Jenna is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Jenna has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, spices, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Faviola

texts.en:
Faviola is a 36-year-old woman. She lives under the marital state of Free Union with her boyfriend, with whom she has a seven-year-old daughter who is attending elementary school.

Faviola is not responsible for the biggest household expenses; those are covered by her partner. Nevertheless, Faviola enjoys playing a contributing role when there is need. In order to contribute to the household income, she runs a bakery and sells cakes.

To increase her production and keep growing, she is looking to buy some fixed assets. More specifically, Faviola wants another oven. To buy it, she is applying for a 10,527.00 MXN loan. 

She has had previous loans at other places, but has been suffocated by the interest. She did pay those loans on time. 

Faviola knows she can achieve her goals, especially because she know that she can count on her partner's support.

loans.use: to buy an oven for her bakery business.

loans.name: Sonat

texts.en:
Sonat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the north-west of Cambodia. She is 27 years old. She lives in a small wooden house with her parents and her 4 brothers and sisters. Her family owns 2 hectares of rice fields, 2 hectares of cassava fields, and 1 pig.

In May 2014 Sonat was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in their village.

Sonat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and the preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan was offered to Maria to improve her business. Maria lives in Liquisa. She married and she is a business woman. As most of her daily income is from her business that she is doing every day, she is happy to do her business.

Maria started her business a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods in the future. And she wants to have good management for her business. She will use this loan to buy more items like water, sardines, sugar, cooking oils, milk, candles, soap, hand and body products, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy water, sardines, sugar, cooking oils, milk, candles, soap, hand and body products, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia has been involved in business activity for a few years, with her own working capital. She is married and her husband is in agriculture. She was also one of the entrepreneurs and her business is selling pigs. Her husband is very supportive of selling the pigs.

So now she is requesting a loan of $ 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to their capital to buy more pigs, because It's become their activity. She was very happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because she could use this loan for improving her management. She is selling pigs and she also cultivates animals like dogs and pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda continua con su negocio  de  crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos”, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member Hilda is continuing her business of breeding small animals such as guinea pigs. The member belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Juntos" ["Always Together"]. The member continues breeding her small animals to then sell them to her clients who order them. The member is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

The member requests a loan for purchasing guinea pigs and feed.

The member is grateful and appreciates the loan. She promises to very responsibly fulfill the payment of her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: Jhon Darwin

texts.es: El Sr. Jhon Darwin vive en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quien en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria que es el único ingreso con el que cuenta y al ser una persona jóven y de escasos recursos económicos es que requiere de dinero como apoyo para poder tener encaminarse a la actividad de apicultura, actualmente vive en domicilio junto con sus padres (inmueble Familiar), en la actualidad esta empezando a desarrollar la actividad de la Apicultura (producción de miel) ya que este recibió capacitación de ONG´s. como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda de Accion Bolivia y al tener la capacitación y el conocimiento para realizar esta nueva actividad es que requiere del préstamo para poder implementar su producción en la apicultura y producir miel, vale hacer conocer que dicha personas se dedicó desde muy jóven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos y con esta nueva actividad obtendra mayor ingreso y de esa forma vivir en mejores condiciones de vida y poder algún día cumplir su sueño anhelado de tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhon Darwin lives in a Cumandayti community of Villa Vaca Guzmán, Chuquisaca Department. He currently makes his living in agriculture, which is the only income he has. Because he is young, Sr. Jhon Darwin has few financial resources, which is why he needs financial help to start on the bee-keeping path.

Sr. Jhon Darwin currently lives at home with his parents (family property). He is starting up a bee-keeping business (to produce honey). Since he has received training from NGOs, such as Fundación Nor Sud and Ayuda de Accion Bolivia, he has the necessary knowledge to start this new business. He needs the loan to start apiculture production and start producing honey.

It's worth noting that Sr. Jhon Darwin has made his living in agriculture from a very young age. It is his only means of supporting himself and meeting his expenses. With this new business, Sr. Jhon Darwin will earn a larger income, improve his standard of living and be able to one day reach his longed-for dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to start producing and selling honey so he can earn a better income for his family.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando hails from the rural town of Carmen, Bohol. He is married and has two children ages 13 and 16 years old, respectively. They're both attending school.

Fernando raises and sells hogs to be able to meet the needs and expenses of his household.
He has been raising hogs for almost two years now.

He faces challenges in his livelihood: first, the lack of capital to increase the number of livestock, and second, the high cost of piggery maintenance .

Fernando has requested a loan from CEVI to invest in feed and piglets. These are essential tools that could help him raise quality hogs. He could also increase the number of pigs slowly, to boost his earnings. In that way, he could set aside and continue to expand his project.

With his previous loan, Fernando was able to repaid it back successfully and now he is requesting a new loan to continue to rebuild his hog raising livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in feed and piglets

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Josefina dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.en:
Luis is 61 years old. He’s a farmer and he lives with his wife and two children in Ambuqui, a small town located in the rural zone of Imbabura in northern Ecuador. Agriculture is the principal income for him and his family. His oldest son is 21 years old and works with him in the field since one year ago. Thanks to government projects, his oldest son can return to school and next year, he will finish his secondary education. His youngest son is 15 years old and still in school. He helps his parents on weekends.

Luis has two fields. In the first one, he has planted lemons and avocados. Twice a month, he delivers those products to the city market and this income helps support his family and pay for basic services. In the other field, he’s going to plant sugar cane. 

He will use the loan to purchase herbicides, pay for irrigation and pay for plowing.

Last year, Luis lost half his crops because he didn’t have enough money to purchase herbicides and avoid pests. He trusts in your support because he needs to grow good sugar cane so that he can sell it at a better price to the sugar cane customers.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, pay for irrigation and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is requesting a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She has a kiosk in front of her house. She opened her kiosk a few years ago with her own working capital.

She earns a good income from this business. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy in her kiosk every day. She wants to make her business a bigger but her money is not enough, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital and she will use it to buy more items such as sardines, cooking oils, biscuits, sugar, tea, candles, hand body lotion, cigarettes, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy sardines, cooking oils, biscuits, sugar, tea, candles, hand body lotion, cigarettes, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes. She started to do this business a few year ago, with her own working capital.

Cecilia is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy them, and they are cheap and unique, If compared to new clothes.

She is taking a loan because she wants to use it to buy more items like shorts, pants, jackets, woven blankets, and others. She has planned to improve her business with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin. She also cultivates animals like dogs and pigs.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, jackets, woven blankets, and other items.

loans.name: Oswaldo Germanico

texts.en:
Oswaldo is 59 years old and Afro-Ecuadorian. He’s married and a father of six children, all of them grown. For that reason, he lives alone with his wife in Ambuqui, a small town located in the rural zone of Imbabura. This area is characterized by agricultural potential, but most of the population doesn’t have money to invest in their land.

Oswaldo has two small fields, one where he has lemons and beans, and another where he’s going to plant sugar cane. Very often his wife helps with the fumigation of the crops and his youngest son does the same. Oswaldo works extra hard on Thursdays and Fridays to harvest crops so his wife can sell them in Quito’s market. She has to travel four hours on Saturday. 

Oswaldo will use the loan to purchase herbicides and pay for irrigation of his crops.

With your support, he could reach his dreams and improve his family's future. Since he was very young, Oswaldo was dedicated to agriculture and knows that today, there is a valuable opportunity to invest in his crops.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and pay for irrigation of his crops.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio César con 44 años de edad ,de estado civil soltero,vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Buenos Aires,provincia de Morropon,departamento de Piura,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al servicio de transporte en su mototaxi,con una experiencia en el el rubro hace más de 3 años. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en realizar el mantenimiento a motor de moto-taxi, y tramitar su Soat y tarjeta de circulación que se le a vencido. Esto le ayudará a brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros.

Julio César es socio recurrente para la Edpyme Alternativa, teniendo un buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Julio César, 44 years old, is single and lives in his own house, in the Buenos Aires district in the Morropon province, Piura department, in the country of Perú. He has many good references both personal and work-related from the residents of the area. The residents of the town work mostly in agriculture, shops and the cattle industry.

Julio César works in transportation with his moto-taxi. He has more than three years experience in this line of work. The loan will go to investment in carrying out maintenance for the moto-taxi engine, applying for his car insurance and his driver's license, which has expired. This will help him to offer better service to his passengers.

Julio César is a recurring member with Edpyme Alternativa, and has a good record of payment.

loans.use: to carry out engine maintenance on his moto-taxi, and apply for car insurance and his driver's license.

loans.name: Loribeth

texts.en:
Loribeth is engaged in a business that doesn’t need to have high starting capital, but does need passion and dedication to be successful. Loribeth is thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped her by granting her previous loan.  To join a certain company and buy and sell their products, you need to have enough money for the membership fee and to stock items also. 

Loribeth is grateful for having the business as it has become a medium for her to sustain the family's daily needs. She works hard to make the business flourish which is one of her dreams. She believes that CCT and all of the lenders are instruments of God for her to continually support the education of her children.

This year, Loribeth wants to apply for a loan of PHP 50,000 to have additional products to put in her display cabinet.  Availability of the products is one thing that should be considered in this type of business because customers will not wait for weeks just to receive the products. She will also buy grocery products for her variety store business. She’s anticipating that her request will be granted and this will be a big help for the business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Loribeth makes time to attend CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually, hear testimonies from other CCT partners, hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell in her business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s blessed that her previous loan of PHP 20, 000 was granted and she wants to extend her deepest appreciation to lenders for participating in the Kiva program. The amount was used to buy additional products for the business.  The daily profit is just enough to sustain their day-to-day expenditures.  

Emelita aims to have a one one-stop-shop someday where she can offer an array of products. However, most of her customers are her neighbors; that’s why she could not avoid lending products. To compensate, Emelita decided to apply for another loan of PHP 40, 000 to add stocks of items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, and grocery items. She’s hopeful that CCT will once more grant her request so her business can have a wide variety of choices.

Carolina has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners.  This made her become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Shehu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shehu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Shehu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Teresa continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos”, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y alimentos.
La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Teresa continues with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She belongs to the community bank “Siempre Juntos” [Always Together]; she continues raising her little animals to then sell them to her customers who ask for her. The partner is an enterprising woman who wants to be able to keep working, to in this way keep supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed. She appreciates and values the loan and agrees to comply with payment of her monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second-hand clothes, and her shop is in the center of the market. She started to do this business a few years ago, with her own working capital of $300.

Ines is earning a good income from selling her second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them; they are cheap and unique if compared to new clothes. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes according to people's likes, such as T-shirts, nightgowns, skirts, shorts, pants, woven blankets, and bed linen.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, nightgowns, skirts, shorts, pants, woven blankets, and bed linens.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael con 57 años de edad,de estado civil viudo, vive sólo,en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de cafeto, de la variedad Catimor sembrando 1 hectárea de cafeto de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserío Palma Central del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a la agricultura hace 14 años y hace 3 años cultiva cafeto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Ismael es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma sólo.
texts.en:
At 57 years of age, Ismael is a widow and lives alone in his own home made of rustic materials in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from some of the area's residents. The majority of this town's inhabitants earn a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He earns a living in agriculture, specifically in cultivating coffee trees of the Catimor variety. Planting one hectare of coffee trees on his property, his plot is located in Caserío Palma Central of Santo Tomas district in Cutervo. He has earned a living in agriculture for 14 years and 3 years in cultivating coffee trees. Additionally, he earns a living in breeding and selling small animals and in cultivating basic food crops. He has a lot of experience in this field.

The loan's destiny will be to invest in maintaining the aforementioned crops, with which he will obtain good outputs and better income to thus be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Ismael is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He signs alone.

loans.use: para invertir en el mantenimiento de dicho cultivo.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga has been involved in her business since a few years ago. She started her business with her own working capital. She is married and she is a business woman. Her husband is in the agriculture business, so her husband is very supportive of her doing her business. 

Olga has a kiosk in her house and she also sells gasoline. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD because she wants to buy more items that customers like, such as rice, aqua, sardines, milk, coffee, sugar,  candies, noodles, soft drinks and other things, and she also will use this loan to buy gasoline. 

She hopes with this loan that she can improves the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, aqua, sardines, milk, coffee, sugar,  candies, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell, and also to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Fidelia is requesting a loan of $700.00 to improve her business. She is selling pigs.  She is earning a good income from this business, so she still happy to do her business. Fidelia became involved in business activities a few year ago; she started with her own working capital. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, she said that with this loan she will to improve her management of her business so she can run a bigger business in the future. She is taking this loan to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She also engages in farming and grows rice.

She is a married woman and has four school-aged-children. Her husband is a farmer. She resides in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

For the past two years, she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store situated in front of her home, serving neighbors and nearby residents.

Gemma would like to improve the inventory of merchandise to attract potential buyers. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and groceries like soft drinks, canned goods and beverages. With the presence of that, she could be able to cope with demand and manage her business properly. It will also improve the yield of her farm, producing a bountiful harvest.

In that way, Gemma could start to expand her both livelihoods to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and groceries like soft drinks, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos”.
El socio Gerardo continua con su negocio de elaboración de colchones, él socio lle4va buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le v a bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dio a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso el socio espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar  apoyando a su familia.
 El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de resortes  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Juntos" ["Always Together"].

The member Gerardo is continuing with his business of making mattresses. The member has a good time at his business, which is going well thanks to the determination he puts into his business every day. The member is a responsible and determined person. The member hopes to be able to earn more profits with his business to in this way be able to continue supporting his family.

The member is grateful and appreciates the loan. He promises to very responsibly fulfill the payment of his monthly installments.

The member requests the loan for purchasing springs, among other things.

loans.use: to buy springs, among other things.

loans.name: Esparanza Janeth

texts.es: Esperanza tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera su niño tiene 6 años de edad Patricio estudia en una escuela del sector vive con su hijo y hermano, es muy humilde y trabajadora se ha dedicado hace 6 años  a la crianza de chanchos ella va a recoger los restos de papa que quedan luego de una cosecha  para engordarlos después de algún tiempo los vende. Esperanza necesita el dinero para comprar más cerdos incrementaría sus ingresos para poder seguir pagando los gastos del hogar ya que el dinero es muy escaso.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 30 years old, she is a single mother, her 6 year-old boy, Patricio, attends a local school. She lives with her son and brother; she is very humble and hardworking.

For 6 years she has worked raising pigs. She goes out to collect the potato leavings that remain after a harvest to fatten her pigs. After a certain amount of time she sells them.

Esperanza needs the money to buy more pigs. This would increase her income, in order to be able to keep paying for household expenses since money is very scarce.

loans.use: buy more pigs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina pertenece al  banco comunal “Siempre Juntos”.
La socia continúa  dedicándose a trabajar como asistente en una veterinaria, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su trabajo para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de medicamentos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the "Always Together" community bank.

The member continues dedicating herself to work as a veterinary assistant. She is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman. She hopes to earn more income in her work so she can continue supporting her family. She feels grateful for the loan provided and promises to comply with the established payments.

Continuing in this way, she brings up her family. She's seeking the loan to buy medications, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with payments.

loans.use: to buy medicine, among other things.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio con 42 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa,en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café de variedad Catimor, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se desempeña como peón agrícola , así mismo el y su esposa venden comida los días domingos. El préstamo lo utilizará en el cultivo de café, en el mantenimiento de finca y gastos de abono (capital de trabajo).

Porfirio es socio recurrente y exclusivo de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Porfirio, 42 years of age, married, lives in his own house with his wife, in the district of Canaris, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque, Peru. He has very good work and personal references among area residents. The people of this town work mostly in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of the Catimor coffee crop. He has more than 15 years’ experience in this line of work. He works in addition as a farm laborer; he and his wife sell food on Sundays as well. The loan will be used for the cultivation of coffee, farm maintenance and fertilizer expenses (working capital).

Porfirio is a recurrent and exclusive partner of Alternative Edpyme.

loans.use: in the cultivation of coffee, farm maintenance and fertilizer expenses.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El socio Eloy pertenece al banco “HATUN SAYHUA”, el tiene 47  años y es maestro de obra de construcción.
El socio es una persona trabajadora y luchadora, su deseo es tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguridad al trabajar, y para un futuro tener un negocio que le sustente.

Eloy solicito el préstamo para comparase sus instrumentos de trabajo, para poder laborar de forma segura. El  utilizara el dinero para comprar botas de jebe, guantes y casco.

El socio está agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en él y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas del crédito puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eloy belongs to the "Hatun Sayhua" community bank. He's 47 and teaches construction work. He's a hardworking, striving person. His wish is to have a better quality of live and work security, and in the future, to have a business that sustains him.

Eloy is seeking the loan to buy his work tools to be able to work securely. He will use the money to buy rubber boots, gloves and a helmet. He is grateful for the Kiva lenders for trusting him and promises to make his loan payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy boots, gloves and a helmet.

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.es: Silvia habita junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 24 años en vivienda propia, ella se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, lo cual le permite salir adelante cada día, aunque lo hace con mucho esfuerzo, ella se siente bien de tener una manera de ganarse la vida. Silvia habita en una vivienda muy humilde, ya que está hecha de láminas deterioradas como puede observarse en la fotografía, por lo que buscando mejorar su calidad de vida ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas de las paredes y techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia has lived in her own house with her family for 24 years. She earns a living as a domestic worker, which allows her to get out eery day. Although she puts in a lot of effort, she feels good having a way of earning a living.

Silvia lives in a very humble home which is made of deteriorated sheets, as you can see in the photo. As a result, she's decided to take out a loan to improve her quality of life. She will buy sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to change the sheets on the walls and roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to change the sheets on the walls and roof of her home.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es:
Bremilda con 68 años de edad,de estado civil viuda,vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo por kilos,desde hace más de 25 años de experiencia en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de pollo por mayor para su venta. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Bremilda a tenido 5 préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, el último fué de S/.1,000.00 y lo a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Bremilda is 68 years old, a widow, and lives in her own home in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. She has very good personal and professional references. The majority of this town's residents earn a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

She earns a living selling chicken by the kilo. She has more than 25 years of experience in this field. She requests a loan to buy wholesale chickens for her sales. In this way, she will make her business grow more, obtain more income, and be able to improve her quality of life.

Bremilda has had 5 loans with Edpyme Alternativa. The last one was 1,000 PEN and she has paid it off punctually.

loans.use: para la compra de pollo por mayor para su venta

loans.name: Jose Nabor

texts.es: Nabor  tiene 44 años de edad es padre soltero su hijo Daniel tiene 12 años, estudia en una escuela gratuita del sector, desde los 11 años tuvo que buscar trabajo en una ladrillera no tenía la oportunidad de continuar estudiando por la falta de recursos económicos, el aprendió muy bien el oficio  hace un año atrás tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir una ladrillera a pesar de que las ventas han bajado el piensa que será momentáneo y mantiene la esperanza de que este pequeño negocio mejorara. Nabor necesita el dinero para pagar a las personas que trabajan, mientras vende el ladrillo. El aspira con el tiempo crear más fuentes de trabajo para  ayudar a sus coterráneos.
texts.en:
Nabor is a 44-year-old single father. His son Daniel is 12 and studies in a free school in the region. When Nabor was 11, he had to look for work in a brick factory and didn't have the opportunity to continue studying due to a lack of economic resources.

He learned the work very well, and a year ago, had the opportunity to buy a brick factory. Although sales have declined, he thinks this will be temporary and maintains hope that this small business will improve. Nabor needs the loan to pay workers while selling brick. With time, he hopes to create more sources of work to help his countrymen.

loans.use: to pay workers while selling bricks.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de tripas de cordero y cabeza de cordero, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo e esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cabezas ,tripas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank Always Together ("Siempre Juntos"). She continues to earn a living selling lamb heads and intestines. She is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman. She hopes to earn more income from her business to be able to continue supporting her family.

She continues to sell in one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She feels grateful for the provided loan and promises to comply with established payments, in this way bringing up her family. The member is seeking the loan to buy heads and intestines, among other things.

loans.use: to buy lamb heads and intestines, among other things.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria pertenece al banco “Hatun Sayhua”, y se dedica a la agricultura, ella es muy trabajadora y empeñosa.
Ella cultiva frutas y tuberculos.la socia tiene 54 años y unas ganas de seguir progresando, para tener la tan ansiada calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar abono, necesario para que sus cultivos produzcan de mejor calidad y cantidad.

La socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the bank “Hatun Sayhua” and she works in agriculture. She is very hardworking and earnest. She grows fruits and tubers. She is 54 years old and has the desire to keep progressing, in order to have a longed-for quality of life for herself and her family.

She requested the loan to buy fertilizer, necessary for her crops to yield better quality and quantity. She is happy and grateful to KIVA investors for the loan and agrees to make the payments on time.

loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en:
Danjuma is a maize farmer from Ubangida village. As a Babban Gona member, Danjuma is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Danjuma would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.
