As a Babban Gona member, Danjuma can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Danjuma no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Danjuma hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Masaudu

texts.en:
Masaudu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Masaudu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Masaudu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Masaudu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Masaudu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Masaudu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es: José, es un publicista que emprendió su negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años, el cual es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia, que está conformada por él, su esposa y sus dos hijos, además asegura que es un trabajo el cual disfruta mucho al realizarlo, porque conoce gente nueva y muy agradable. Es por eso que sus herramientas de trabajo (computadoras, impresoras, entre otras cosas) son de mucha importancia para él, el crédito que solicita es para darle el mantenimiento adecuado a las computadoras, para que sigan funcionando de manera óptima. Además, José aspira a más, ya que planea seguir dando a conocer su trabajo en otros municipios de Rivas, para llegarle a más personas y de esta forma generar más ingresos y seguir conociendo gente muy agradable.
texts.en:
José is an advertising agent who launched his business approximately five years ago. This is the primary source of income for his family, which is made up of him, his wife, and their two children. In addition, he claims that it is a job which he enjoys carrying out very much because he meets new and very friendly people.

It is because of this that his work tools (computers, printers, among other things) are of great importance to him. The loan he requests is to give adequate maintenance to his computers so that they may continue functioning optimally.

In addition, José aspires to more, since he plans to continue introducing his work to other communities in Rivas to reach more people and in this way generate more income and continue meeting very friendly people.

loans.use: to give adequate maintenance to his computers.

loans.name: Dúo Inspiración Group

texts.es: Dúo inspiración la conforma la señora Sabina de 63 años de edad,  viuda y originaria de Pueblo Nuevo Suchitepéquez, Doña Sabina sigue dedicándose a la venta de  ropa variada para niño, caballero y dama, también colchas, sobre fundas y cubre camas, doña Sabina viaja una vez al mes al departamento  de Escuintla a vender su mercadería,  y los días siguientes de forma ambulante logra vender a sus vecinos y localidades más cercanas, doña Sabina ve una buena oportunidad en ventas por aproximarse la época navideña y ha decidido  invertir en mercadería(ropa nueva para vender. esperando lograr obtener buenas ganancias y sobre todo quedar bien en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Sabina, 63, a widow and native of Pueblo Nuevo Suchitepéquez, is a member of the group Dúo Inspiración. Doña Sabina continues to sell various children’s, men’s, and women’s clothes, also quilts, pillowcases and bedspreads. Doña Sabina travels once a month to the department of Escuintla to sell her merchandise. On other days she manages to sell to her neighbors and in nearby locations as a street vendor.

Doña Sabina sees a good sales opportunity due to the approach of the Christmas season, and she has decided to invest in merchandise (new clothes to sell), in the hopes of managing to obtain good profits and above all do well in the payment of her loan.

loans.use: buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith  pertenece al banco comunal "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", la socia sigue  trabajando en una entidad pública, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su trabajo para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo e esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su laptop.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the community bank "Siempre Juntos” (Always Together). She continues to work for a public entity. She is an enterprising and responsible woman. She expects to obtain more income in her work and in this way to continue supporting her family. She is grateful for the credit granted and she agrees to comply with its repayment schedule. In this way she raises up her family.

She requests a loan to complete the upkeep of her laptop.

loans.use: to complete the upkeep of her laptop.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María es una mujer de 67 años, cuyo amor por la familia la incitó a iniciar su negocio de venta de mercancías varias, ella está casada y es madre de cuatro hijos a quienes con el apoyo de su cónyuge educó y ofreció estudios, los cuales les permitió tener un buen porvenir. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en la venta de productos por intermedio de catálogos, específicamente ropa interior y exterior, así mismo en la sala de su vivienda ubicada en un barrio de Barranquilla, instaló una vitrina mostradora de productos  que surte con algunas referencias de productos y sus vecinos acuden a ella cuando necesitan dar algún obsequio y lo tienen con inmediatez.  María requiere de un capital extra para invertir en mercancías para la temporada decembrina, por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar vestidos, blusas, pantalones, brasieres, pantys y demás encargos de sus clientes. María desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y ayudar a sus hijos en la crianza de sus nietos.
texts.en:
María is a 67-year-old woman whose love of family inspired her to start her business selling a variety of items. She is married and the mother of four children whom, with the support of her husband, she has raised and educated, ensuring they have a good future.

María has 15 years of experience in catalog sales, specifically undergarments and outerwear. In fact, right in the living room of her home in Barranquilla she has installed a display case stocked with product samples, and her neighbors come to her when they need to buy gifts in a hurry.

María needs extra capital to invest in merchandise for the holiday season. This is why she is taking out a loan through Kiva, an opportunity to strengthen the connection to her financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and purchase dresses, blouses, pants, bras, panties, and other items for her clients.

María wants to increase her working capital and help her children in the care of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, blouses, pants, bras, panties, and other items for her clients.

loans.name: Macelis Isidora

texts.es: Macelis de 30 años es una emprendedora mujer, casada y madre de dos hijos menores de edad con quienes residen en un barrio de Barranquilla, ella decidió aprovechar sus conocimientos en decoración y aptitudes para la venta de diferentes artículos e inició en el año 2010 su propio negocio de arte en foamy y venta multinivel, ella combina perfectamente todos los roles de su vida para que ninguno intervenga en sus actividades diarias y pueda cumplir a cabalidad con los requerimientos de sus clientes y su familia. Su canal de comercialización es por medio de un catálogo muestrario de tarjetas, fotografías de canasticos, cuelga puertas, portarretratos, entre otras creaciones de su invención, y en cuanto a las ventas multinivel se apoya con el catálogo que le aportan por campañas. Macelis realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materiales como foamy, pinturas, pegamento, cintas de tela, y demás, y responder con encargos de productos del catálogo. Macelis a futuro se proyecta con mucha más clientela y mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Macelis, 30, is an enterprising woman, married and the mother of two minor children, with whom she resides in a neighborhood of Barranquilla. She decided to take advantage of her decoration knowledge and her aptitude for the sales of different articles, and in 2010 she started her own craft foam art business and multilevel marketing.

She combines all of her life roles perfectly such that none interferes in her daily activities and in such a way as to be able to fully meet the needs of her customers and her family. Her sales avenue is through a sample card catalog, basket photos, door hangers, frames, among other creations of her invention. And as for the multilevel marketing she relies on the catalogue advertising.

Macelis made an application for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become involved with a financial institution through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], to buy materials like craft foam, paints, glue, cloth tapes, and so on, and fill catalogue product orders. Macelis sees herself in the future with many more customers and improving her housing conditions.

loans.use: buy materials like craft foam, paints, glue, cloth tapes, and so on, and fill catalogue product orders.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena es una persona muy responsable trabaja en la venta de ropa en el mercado del municipio. La señora es muy querida entre las personas que trabajan junto con ella. doña Elena siempre tuvo el deseo de estudiar y salir adelante sin embargo por las condiciones económicas y de acceso a una educación no le permitieron cumplir sus sueños. En el año 2009 y 2010 tuvo la oportunidad de acceder a una educación alternativa de confección textil de prendas de vestir. culminando la capacitación desea abrir un taller y vender su ropas confeccionadas por ella misma pero no pudo realizar ya que también tiene otras obligaciones y gastos familiares que no le permitieron desarrollar su emprendimiento. actualmente requiere el préstamo para comprar maquinas y otros insumos para confeccionar sus propias prendas de vestir y ofrecer al mercado. doña Elena tiene 47 años y esta muy entusiasmada para poder alcanzar el sueño que tiene tener sus maquinas y confeccionar prendas.
texts.en:
Elena is a very responsible person who sells clothing at the market in her town. She is cherished among the people who work together with her. Elena has always wanted to study and move ahead; however, due to economic and accessibility issues she has not been able to accomplish her dreams.

In 2009 and 2010 she had the opportunity to enroll in a nontraditional education program for manufacturing clothing material. Now that she is completing the training, she wants to open a workshop and sell the clothing she makes herself, but she hasn't been able to do it because she also has household expenses and obligations that prevent her from developing her business.

At this time, she needs a loan to purchase machines and other supplies to produce her own clothing items and bring them to the market. Elena is 47 years old and is delighted to be able to realize her dream of having her equipment and creating her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase machines and supplies to make clothing items to sell at the market, thus generating new revenue for her family.

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es: Oscar de 19 años es un estudiante universitario que buscó alternativas de generar ingresos para costearse sus estudios, él inició su propio negocio en el año 2013, proponiéndole a sus amigos y familiares prendas de vestir por encargos. Poco a poco fue armando una base de clientes fijos y manteniendo un ingreso seguro, sin embargo su capital no es lo suficiente amplio para reinvertir, ya que debe usar una porción para sus propios gastos. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en camisas, suéteres, pantalones, bermudas y demás artículos que le encargó su clientela.  Con esta inversión Oscar obtendrá muy buenas utilidades y podrá continuar pagando sus estudios.  Su meta de negocio es captar un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en: Oscar is 19, he is a university student that looked for alternatives to generate income to pay for his studies. He started his own business in 2013, selling clothing to friends and family.  Little by little he started forming a client base and maintaining a certain level of income.  However his capital is not sufficient to invest, because he has to use some of it for his own expenses.  Currently he has requested for a credit with kiva, an opportunity to be part of the financial life through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and invest in shirts, sweaters, pants, shorts and other articles that his customers requested.  With this investment Oscar will obtain good profits and will continue to pay for his studies.  His business goal is to grow his client base.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters, pants, shorts and other articles that his customers requested.

loans.name: Jose Wualmer

texts.es: José tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la venta de hortalizas, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y llevar cada día su sustento. Él tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos uno de 18 años y los otros tres menores de edad a los que apoya en sus estudios. José desea cambiar el techo del corredor, que a la vez le sirve de cocina y comedor, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera y alambre para cambiar el techo el corredor que se observa en la fotografía.
texts.en: Jose has worked for 25 years selling vegetables.  This activity has allowed him to get his family ahead and earn a living each day.  He is 37 years old and lives with his life partner and their 4 children, one is 18 and the other three are minors that he supports in their studies.  Jose wishes to change the roof of the corridor, which also serves as the kitchen and dining room.  He requests a loan from FUSAI to buy: aluminum sheets, wood and wire to cange the roof of the corridor seen in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy aluminum sheets, wood and wire to cange the roof of the corridor seen in the photograph.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 54 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jean requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, eggs, sugar, margarine, etc. for her food production business.

Jean has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, eggs, sugar, margarine, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Ilsa Beatriz

texts.es: Ilsa es una creativa mujer que desde niña se apasionó por la moda, el diseño y la confección, ella fue la ayudante de su madre quien se dedicó  a la modistería y de ella aprendió, hoy en día a sus 57 años cuenta con una experiencia de toda la vida y en su negocio 15 años de funcionamiento.  Su taller está ubicado en su vivienda al sur de Barranquilla y sus principales clientes habitan en esta localidad, sin embargo recibe a conocidos, familiares y referidos muy frecuentemente.  Todos los días está dispuesta a recibir a sus clientes en cualquier hora del día, así mismo considera que cualquier momento es propicio para coser, sus encargos son voluminosos y debe contar con materia prima suficiente, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para abastecerse de insumos y telas de diferentes tipos.  Ilsa desea ayudar a sus sobrinas en su educación y el sostenimiento de su madre, es por ello que es tan entregada a su labor.
texts.en:
Ilsa is a creative woman, who, since childhood, has been passionate about fashion, design and tailoring. Her mother was a dressmaker, and Ilsa was her assistant and learned from her. Today, at 57 years old, she has a lifetime of experience and 15 years in her own business.

Her workshop is located in her home in the south of Barranquilla and her main customers live in the area. However, she also gets business from acquaintances, relatives and referrals frequently. Every day she is prepared to see her customers at any time. Likewise, she considers every moment to be a good time to sew.

She has lots of orders and she must have enough raw materials. This is why she requested a Kiva loan, which is an opportunity to become involved in financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The Kiva loan is to stock up on supplies and different kinds of fabrics.

Ilsa wants to help her nieces with their education and the support of their mother, which is why she is so dedicated to her work.

loans.use: to stock up on supplies and different types of fabrics.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji Y. is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Y. would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Y. can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Y. will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Y. is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Lorena Concepción

texts.es:
Lorena, de 32 años de edad, es ama de casa, está casada y tiene 3 hijos

Lorena, se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a los quehaceres de la casa, mientras su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Lorena, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para elaborar un silo para darle alimento al ganado, esto les servirá para que su ganado produzca más leche.

Lorena, sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lorena is 32 years old, she is a housewife, she is married and has three children.
She takes care of her children and the house work while her husband works in agriculture.
Lorena needs a loan to buy materials to build a silo to feed the cattle, this will help for their cows to produce more milk.
Lorena dreams with improving her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a silo to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 65 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alicia has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Alicia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ado is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ado would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ado will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ado now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia Marina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella se dedica a la crianza de animales . Con esta actividad sustenta su hogar.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Hatun Sayhua” , tiene 36 años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y ampliar su negocio.
Marina solicito el préstamo para comprar  cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está contenta  con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas previamente.
texts.en:
Marina is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She raises animals for a living. With this work, she supports her household.

Marina belongs to the communal bank "Hatun Sayhua." She is 36 years old and her dream is to improve and grow her business. She has requested the loan to buy guinea pigs and hens.

Marina is happy with the loan because with it she will continue to move ahead. She promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: La señora Leonidas vive en el área rural, su vivienda  es rustica con techo de teja española que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad lleva 30 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción en las ferias semanales de la región. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, habas, cebada y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Leonidas se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de un par de yuntas y semilla de papa, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción y mejorar su calidad de vida. Es una persona de escasos recursos que tiene mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante aunque ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien falleció hace 6 años pero eso no le detuvo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonidas lives in a rural area. Her home is rustic with Spanish tile roofing and lacks some basic services. She is hardworking and very optimistic. She works every day to obtain income for her own livelihood.

She makes a living primarily in agriculture. She has been in this trade for approximately 30 years, where she produces and sells her products at weekly regional markets. What she obtains, she takes to sell in the provincial markets of the region and nearby towns. The main products that she plants are potatoes in large quantities, and beans, barley, and others in lesser quantities, generally for her own consumption.

Mrs. Leonidas is in need of applying for a loan for the purchase of a pair of oxen and potato seeds, so as to be able to increase her production and to improve the quality of her life. She is a person of little means and lots of enthusiasm to succeed despite not counting on support from her husband, who died six years ago, but that does not stop her from moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase oxen and potato seeds in order to increase her production and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Felca

texts.en:
Felca is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felca is 53 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Felca has a food vending business in the Philippines. Felca requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials like bread, spread, plastic, etc., for her food vending business.

Felca has been in this business for 20 years. Felca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like bread, spread, plastic, etc., for her food vending business.

loans.name: Obrah Group

texts.en:
The featured member of the ‘Obrah’ group is a 35-year-old mother of three. “I can maintain my family as long as I'm in good health,” says Mary. She is pictured wearing red in the group photo.

Mary is a cook. Her husband is an electrician, it is his main source of income. She lives in the locality of Teshie with her children. Two of the children are in school while the youngest one is still preparing for school.

Mary learned the preparation of pastries by herself through watching her elders. Since childhood, she has had an interest in cooking. It was more of a hobby for her and now she cooks to generate income. She mostly uses her earnings to pay the school fees of her children. She says, “My business is popular since meat-pie products are high in demand by our society.”

She will buy a stock of flour and margarine with the Kiva loan. The profit she makes by selling the pastries will help her to pay the medical fees of her family and her children's school fees. She is thankful to the lenders for lending help to her. She says, “Thank you, Kiva.”

The rest of the group members will use the loan to help their businesses. They are all happy to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of flour and margarine with the Kiva loan.

loans.name: Guillermo Rafael

texts.es: Guillermo es un panadero reconocido en un barrio del sur de Barranquilla, diariamente los habitantes de esa localidad llegan desde bien temprano a comprar panes de distintas clases, pastelitos horneados, deditos, buñuelos, avenas y todo tipo de alimentos que acompañen bien el desayuno de cada mañana.  Sus clientes son atraídos por el delicioso olor que sale de los hornos en cualquier hora del día, puesto que su producción es continua y también la afluencia de clientes que visitan su negocio.  Guillermo ha tenido mucho éxito en su negocio y desea incorporar una nueva línea: comidas rápidas, proyecto que desea financiar a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por intermedio de un  credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera y así poder comprar su carro de preparación comidas rápidas y demás enseres. Guillermo lleva 30 años en esta actividad y tiene muy buena perspectivas con esta nueva idea.  Su meta a futuro es tener su propio local y contar con mucho más capital de inversión.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a well known baker in a neighbourhood in the south of Barranquilla. Everyday the residents of the area begin arriving very early to buy different kinds of bread, baked goods, stuffed pastries, fritters, oats and other types of foods that go with everyday breakfast. His customers are drawn by the delicious smell that comes from the ovens at any time of day, because his production is nonstop. They are also attracted by the large number of customers that visit his business.

Guillermo has had a lot of success in his business and wants to incorporate a new product line: fast food. He wants to finance this project through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo by way of a Kiva loan, which is an opportunity to become involved in financial life. With this he will be able to buy his fast food trailer and other equipment.

Guillermo has been working in this business for 30 years and has very good prospects with this new idea. His future goal is to have his own shop and to have much more capital to invest.

loans.use: to buy a fast food trailer and other equipment.

loans.name: Zubairu

texts.en:
Zubairu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Zubairu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Zubairu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Zubairu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Zubairu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Zubairu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zulai

texts.en:
Zulai is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Zulai has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zulai would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zulai can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Zulai will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Zulai is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio con 50 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborares. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor,contando a la fecha con 5 hectáreas en producción de 2-3 años de edad variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en primer y segundo año de producción. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, así mismo a la cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, menestras, pitucas y otros productos de la zona. El destino del crédito será para asumir gastos de mantenimiento de parcela agrícola de 1.5 hectáreas de café de 2-4 años de edad, plantación se encuentra en fase de espigas florales, asegurando campaña 2016 con una mejor y mayor producción reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Eugenio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca, Perú. He has very good personal and professional references. The people of this town mostly make their living in agriculture, trade and livestock.

Eugenio works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee, of the Catimor (Arabica) variety. To date he has 5 hectares in production of 2-3 year old disease resistant Catimor crops. His plantation is in its first and second years of production. He is also engaged in cattle breeding and fattening, and likewise in the breeding of small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and others) and in the farming of basic crops (cassava, beans, taro and other local produces).

This loan will be used to cover the costs of maintaining a 1.5 hectare plot of coffee farmland, that is 2-4 years old. Nowadays the plantation is blossoming, assuring a 2016 season with better and more production, which will be reflected in an increased volume of sales. Thus he will obtain more income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Eugenio is a repeat borrower for Alternative Edpyme. He will sign with his spouse.

loans.use: to cover the costs of maintaining a 1.5 hectare plot of coffee farmland, that is 2-4 years old.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Jagna, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 18, 19 and 22. Cynthia's husband is a laborer. She helps by cooking suman (rice cake made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed wrapped in buli or buri palm and sprinkled with sugar) and selling it in her community.

Her business is doing well because Jagna is a busy port where many ships wait for passengers going to other provinces. Cynthia usually spends her time selling her snacks near the place.

She is asking for a loan to buy sticky rice and sugar so she can make more suman. Once this is available, she can make more suman that she can sell, thus, increasing her sales. Her profit will take care of her food and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en:
Mamuda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mamuda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mamuda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mamuda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Mamuda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mamuda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Minda

texts.en:
Her name is Ma. Minda, aged 52, from Dasmarinas, Cavite Philippines. She is single but is contented and happy to serve her loved ones. She has a home-based business that sells dried goods, fruits and snacks where she derives income to support herself, her parents and her siblings.  

Ma. Minda is grateful that she learned about CCT and Kiva which gives moral and financial support to small businessmen like her. She has a small general store and also sells snacks such as "siopao" which are steamed buns with shredded pork filling and "palamig" which literally means coolers. Palamig are prepared beverages sold on the streets or the roadside. It usually contains sago or tapioca pearls and gulaman or jellies and flavored with syrup from different fruit extracts. 
 
To help her expand her business, she hopes that you could lend her an amount of PHP 25,000 to pay for dried goods such as noodles, fish, and fruits to sell at retail price and also siopao, tapioca pearls, jellies and fruit extracts to prepare and sell coolers. 
  
Ma. Minda  dreams of opening more food stalls in different areas so she can continue to provide assistance for her family.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for dried goods, fruits, "siopao" (steamed buns filled with shredded pork) and "palamig" (coolers) drinks.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: Devote est une femme d’affaires, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Amkeni», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont 7 scolarisés et 1est encore petit. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans la rue de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 20 paires de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari qui est hotelier. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Devote is a business woman and treasurer of the loan group 'Amkeni', which is a client of the field partner Hekima. She is thirty-nine years old, married and mother to eight children. Seven of her children attend school and one is too young for school yet.

Devote has been selling second-hand shoes on a town thoroughfare for four years. She began her business with capital provided by her husband who runs a hotel. She will use her loan to buy twenty pairs of shoes.

Her aim is to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Isa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Isa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Isa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Isa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: : to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aminu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Aminu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Aminu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dauda is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Dauda will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Dauda now has the opportunity to realize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use the additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 25-years-old. She is married and is the mother of a 5-year-old boy.  Nicolasa and her family are living in another place. Now she is learning how to be a seamstress and is making costumes for Bolivian native dancers. Nicolasa needs a loan to buy fabrics for her business. 

She hopes you can help her again. Nicolasa is assisted by her husband and her sister-in-law so she expects that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Musa will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Musa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use the additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle, 32 years old, and member of CCT, Dasmarinas Branch. She is a college graduate and happily married to Ralph, who is self-employed and has two elementary school aged children. The couple does their best to provide for their family and for their children's education.

As a Pharmacy graduate, Michelle thought of putting up a drug store. She buys various medicines from different drug companies and sells them at retail price at her small drugstore. To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy large quantities of medicines to better serve the needs of her community.

Michelle dreams of growing her drugstore and to also put in a grocery store in order to be financially stable someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a stock of medicine to sell at her drug store.

loans.name: Wariti Group

texts.fr: Muheni est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Wariti», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 43 ans, mère de huit enfants dont 6 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse des pommes de terre au domicile depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en trois sacs de pommes de terre. Elle débuta par le premier fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en:
Muheni is a trader and member of the 'Banc Villageois' Wariti, which is a client of the field partner Hekima. She is forty-three years old, married and mother to eight children. Six of her children attend school and two are still too young.

Muheni has been selling potatoes from her home for eight years. She began her business with capital provided by her husband. She will use her loan to buy three sacks of potatoes.

Her aim is to buy a plot of land, educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yahaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tujiunge Pamoja Group

texts.fr: Julienne est sociétaire d’un magasin des pièces de rechange depuis 7 ans, trésorière de la banque communautaire Tujiunge Pamoja, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 41 ans, mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle va acheter les pneus, amortisseurs, segments, coussinets et les huiles moteurs. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Julienne is treasurer of the loan group 'Tujiunge Pamoja', which is a client of the field partner Hekima. She is forty-one years old, married and mother to four children who all attend school.

Julienne has been selling vehicle spare parts from her shop for seven years. She will use her loan to buy tyres, shock absorbers, parts and motor oils.

Her aim is to have more loans to increase her business results, educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy tyres, shock absorbers, parts and motor oils.

loans.name: Mandle Group

texts.en:
Francisca is 43 years old and a single parent with one child, who is currently in school. Francisca works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in Teshie and is requesting a loan through ID-Ghana to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, and coffee to sell.

Francisca has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

She is the group leader of the Mandle group and will be much grateful if their request is granted.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yehowa Da Group

texts.en:
The group has five members, and is called Yehowa Da, which means "Jehovah's Day." They are in the Elimination of Poverty program, fighting to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Each member of this group is very hardworking. They strive and fight.

Among them, Patience stands out as the leader. She is a seamstress and a distributor of sewing accessories who makes all kinds of clothes. She states that her customers are always very content with the work she does. Patience strives to be able to support her loved ones through her work. She seeks a loan to buy fabric, threads, elastic, and other products. In this way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, elastic, and other products.

loans.name: Lucile

texts.fr:
Lucile est une femme sérieuse de 58 ans. Elle est veuve et prend seule en charge ses 5 enfants. Cela fait 10 ans qu’elle exerce une activité de vente de vêtements ou elle a pu fidéliser plusieurs de ses clients.
Lucile a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts chez Vahatra ou elle a pu augmenter et diversifier les vêtements à vendre. Pour ce prêt, elle va acheter des pantalons, des robes, des chemises pour homme et femme afin de qu’elle va vendre en ambulant.
Les bénéfices vont permettre d’assurer la vie au quotidien et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Son rêve est d’être grossiste en confection de vêtements.
texts.en:
Lucile is a responsible, fifty-eight-year-old woman. She is a widow and is solely responsible for her five children. For ten years she has been selling clothing and she now has several loyal customers. Lucile has already received several loans from the field partner, Vahatra, which has enabled her to expand the range of clothing she offers.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, dresses and shirts for men and women. Lucile makes her sales on foot. Her profits will help her improve the living conditions of her children and pay for their education. Her dream is to become a clothing wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Jeetendra

texts.en:
Jeetendra is 30 years old and lives with his parents. He works for the government, but his income is not enough to provide for his family. With support from Seva MFI he started in 2013 with the planting of rice on rental plots. This is how he increases his income. This season he lacks of finances because of the high prices of the inputs. 

He asks Seva MFI for a loan of SRD 5,000 for buying fertilizers and pesticides. Jeetendra's goal is to have his own rice plots.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita has been working in candle making since 2009. She is 28, married and living with her mother, husband and daughter in a rented apartment located in Beirut.

While her husband is a private sector employee and their three-year-old daughter goes to school, Rita works from home, designing new candles and selling them to shops in the area as well as to other interested clients.

She is asking for a loan of 2,313,613 Lebanese pounds for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. Rita will be using the loan to buy some raw material, mainly wax, that she needs to increase her production. She also needs to complete some home improvement work to the family house. 

Rita has a very good reputation in her neighborhood, her clients appreciate her taste and determination. In fact, Rita works hard in order to provide for her mother as well as her daughter. The loan will help her support her husband in covering the family expenses and improve the house before the winter season.

loans.use: to buy raw material for candle making and to improve her house.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Ее зовут Угулой. Она живет на районе Муминобод и ей 30 лет. Угулой ответственная, гостеприимная и приятная в общение женщина. Она проживает вместе с мужем и дочерью и сыночкам. Дочке всего 7 лет, сыночке 5лет,  а мужу 35 года. Ее муж находится на заработках загранице. Угулой занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она продвигает эту деятельностью много лет. Угулой обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет закончить ремонт. Она не сумела отремонтировать всего одну комнату, и фотографии была сделана в той комнате. Остальные комнаты дома уже отремонтировано, и Угулой хочется получить кредит и за счет кредита отремонтировать остальную комнату. На счет заемных средств Угуло намерена приобрести строй материалы. Она много лет жила в старом доме и несколько лет копила деньги на ремонт. Угулой была очень расстроена признав, что ее денег не хватит для завершения ремонта и для нее единственный выход получения кредита. В дальнейшем Угулой планирует приобрести новую электронную швейную машинку.
texts.en: This is Uguloy. She is 30 and lives in the Muminobod region. She is a responsible and friendly woman who is pleasant to talk to. She lives with her husband, daughter, and son. Her daughter is only 7, her son is 5, and her husband is 35. Her husband is working abroad and she sews women's clothing to order, which she has been doing for many years. Uguloy applied for a loan because she wants to finish some repairs. She wasn't able to renovate one room, and the photo was taken in this room. The rest of the rooms have already been renovated, and Uguloy would like to take out a loan to repair the remaining room. She intends to purchase construction materials with the borrowed funds. She has lived for many years in an old house and has saved money for repairs for several years. Uguloy was very upset  when she realized it was not enough money to complete the renovation and that the only way out was to get a loan. In the future Uguloy plans to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosa

texts.fr:
Rosa est une femme pleine de vie, âgée de 23 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et son fils dans un quartier semi-rural. Pour gagner sa vie, elle exerce une activité d’élevage porcin et cela depuis 2 ans.
Rosa a déjà pris des prêts auparavant dont les bénéfices avaient servi à acheter des biens mobiliers. Pour ce prêt, elle compte acheter des provendes pour engraissement et acheter les vaccins pour ses 6 porcins. Elle va les vendre au bout de 6 mois chez les bouchers du grand marché.
Elle est confiante dans son activité et va gagner beaucoup de bénéfices pour améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rosa is twenty-three years old and full of life. She lives with her husband and their son in a semi-rural area. She has been earning a living raising pigs for two years. Rosa has benefitted from other loans in the past and the profits she has earned have been used to buy furniture.

This loan will be used to buy pig feed and vaccines for her six piglets. After six months, she will sell them to butchers in the main market. She is very confident that this is a good business and she will earn enough to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for fattening up pigs.

loans.name: Lovasoa

texts.fr:
Lovasoa est une jeune femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle vit dans un quartier animé de la ville où elle tient une épicerie depuis 1 an. Elle est mariée et élève 3 enfants.
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 3 ans. Les prêts précédents lui ont permis de réhabiliter sa maison. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des produits de premières nécessitées tels que du riz, des biscuits, des haricots, du manioc et bien d’autres produits.
Elle espère constituer beaucoup d’épargne pour faire face aux imprévus et être autonome à l’avenir.
texts.en:
Lovasoa is thirty years old, married and is raising three children. She lives in a busy area of the town and has been running a grocery shop for one year. Lovasoa has been working with the field partner, Vahatra, for three years. All her previous loans have enabled her to renovate her house.

This loan will be used to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, biscuits, beans, cassava and many other products. Lovasoa's aim is to increase her savings level so she can cope with unexpected expenses in the future and become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice and biscuits.

loans.name: Dúo Bello Anocheser Group

texts.es: Dúo Bello Anochecer: este grupo esta conformado por la señora Vilma Leticia de 33 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales(ganado vacuno)se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella nececita comprar alimentos y vitaminas para sus animales, es por esa razón que está solicitando este crédito y espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
One of the members of the credit group ´Duo Bello Anochecer´ is Vilma Leticia, 23. She raises and sells livestock (mostly cattle). She has been doing this for several years.

She is asking for a loan which she hopes will help her to buy food and vitamins for her animals.

loans.use: to buy food and vitamins for cattle.

loans.name: Jean Louis

texts.fr:
Jean Louis est un homme âgé de 68 ans, marié avec 5 enfants à charge. C’est un paysan qui pratique toute sorte de culture. 
Il est emprunteur de Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Les bénéfices lui ont permis d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Jean Louis va cultiver du riz, du maïs, du haricot, de l’arachide et pour cela le prêt va servir à acheter des semences et des engrais. 
Il espère avoir une bonne récolte après 6 mois et constituer beaucoup d’épargne pour l’avenir de sa famille et l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Louis is sixty-eight years old, married and has five children in his care. He is a farmer who grows many different crops. He has been working with the field partner, Vahatra, for two years and the profits he has earned have improved the living standards of his family.

Jean Louis plans to grow rice, maize, beans and peanuts so needs to buy seed and fertilizer. He hopes to have a good harvest in six months' time and increase his savings levels. His savings will be used in the future for his family and to pay for education for his children.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, bean and peanut seed, and also buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bello amanecer
Este dúo lo integra Maira de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de refacciones como lo son: atoles, tostadas, chuchos, rrellenitos. Tiene mas de seis años con su negocio y ya tiene muchos clientes, el sueño de Maira es Tener su propio local y así ofrecer a sus clientes mejores instalaciones. No ha tenido créditos y solicita para la compra de leña, maíz, y artículos para cocinar, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria, 30, is part of the group 'Duo Bello Amanecer'. She sells snacks such as atoles (drinks), toast, tamales and stuffed plantains. She has been doing this for more than six years and she has a lot of customers.

She dreams of having her own property so she can offer her customers a better place to eat.

This is her first loan, which she hopes will help her to buy firewood, corn and cooking utensils.

loans.use: to buy food for a snack bar.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Putucusi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE PUTUCUSI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea, la socia continua con su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua cultivando  frutas para sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de cultivo de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'Nuevo Amanecer Putucusi'. They come from the district of Quellouno in the province of La Convencion. This comes under the department of Cusco.

This member is Andrea, who grows fruit and supplies her customers. She is a very enterprising and responsible woman. She would like to increase her profits so she can continue to support her family.

She is grateful for the loan system, which helps her to look after her loved ones, and she promises to pay off the instalments on time.

She will use the loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers and other things like that.

The other members of the group make a living by doing various activities such as selling animals, growing fruit, running a grocery store or selling food. They all are thankful for the loans they receive and all promise to respect the time scale for the payments.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Doranzy

texts.fr: Doranzy a 25 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant. Jeune homme très dynamique et très ambitieux, il a démarré une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires. Grace à cette activité, il trouve de quoi répondre à ses besoins et apporter son aide à ses parents. Il demande ce prêt pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de jus en bouteille.
texts.en:
Doranzy is twenty-five years old, single and has no children. He is a very dynamic, ambitious young man. He has opened and now runs a small business selling food products. Thanks to this business he can provide for his own needs and help his parents.

Doranzy has requested this loan to increase his stock levels of bottled juice.

loans.use: to increase his stock of bottled juice.

loans.name: Judithe

texts.fr: Judithe a 46 ans, elle a un enfant et elle vit en union libre. Elle est restauratrice et elle vend de la nourriture à bas prix à ses riverains. Son activité marche très bien et elle compte profiter au maximum de cette opportunité. Elle demande un microcrédit pour acheter des produits qu’elle utilisera dans la préparation des plats.
texts.en:
Judithe is forty-six years old, lives with her partner and they have one child. She runs a restaurant and sells low-cost food to her neighbours. Her business is very successful and she hopes to fully exploit the opportunities she has.

Judithe has requested this loan to buy ingredients for use in the preparation of her food dishes.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Jean Louis

texts.fr:
Jean Louis est un homme sérieux, âgé de 48 ans. Il est veuf avec 6 enfants à charge. Pour assurer la vie au quotidien, il vend des chaussures friperie en ambulant dans les campagnes et cela depuis 10 ans.
Puisqu’il vend en ambulant, il arrive à vendre beaucoup de chaussures, ce qui lui pousse à prendre un prêt. Ce prêt va lui servir à acheter 4 balles de chaussures friperie. Les bénéfices vont être utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants et à renforcer le capital de l’activité.
Jean Louis espère offrir un bel avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Louis is a responsible, forty-eight-year-old man. He is a widower and has six children in his care. He has been earning a living selling second-hand shoes on foot in the countryside for ten years. Because he is mobile, he sells many pairs of shoes and now needs a loan to buy more.

His loan will buy four bundles of second-hand shoes. The profits will pay for schooling for the children and increase the business working capital.

Jean Louis would like to be able to offer a better future to his children.

loans.use: to buy 4 bundles of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Santa Beatriz Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA BEATRIZ, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Juana  continua con su  negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua cultivando  frutas para sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'Santa Beatriz' which is based in Maranura, in the province of La Convencion. It comes under the office of Cusco.

Her name is Juana and she sells fruit to satisfy her customers' demand. She is very enterprising and responsible.

She would like to generate more profits so that she can support her family.

She is grateful for the loan system, which helps her to look after her loved ones, and she promises to pay off the instalments on time.

She will use the money to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers and things like that.

All members of the group are grateful for the loans and promise to respect the payments.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos en la actualidad vive y trabaja en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quien en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria que es el único ingreso con el que cuenta por el momento, tiene un hijo que depende de la unidad Familiar y requiere de dinero como apoyo para poder iniciar la actividad de apicultura (producción de miel) ya que cuenta con el conocimiento necesario para iniciar esta actividad por la capacitación que recibió de ONG´s, como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda en Accion Bolivia, actualmente vive en su domicilio junto con su Familia; el préstamo que requiere le servirá para implementar su producción apícola para producir miel, mencionar que dicha persona se dedicó desde joven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos Familiares y con esta nueva actividad podrá obtener a futuro un mejor ingreso económico y de esta manera poder vivir en mejores condiciones de vida junto a su Familia.
texts.en:
Santos lives and works in Cumandayti in Villa Vaca Guzman, which falls under the Chuquisaca office.

He currently works in agriculture, a trade that he learnt from a young age. This is his only source of income at the moment, which he uses to support his family and take care of the household expenses.

He has a son who is dependent on him and they live together as a family in their home.

Santos is asking for a loan to be able to start up a bee-keeping business so he can produce honey. He has had training in this activity from several NGO courses such as 'Fundacion Nor Sud' and 'Accion Bolivia', so he has the necessary skills to make it a success.

He hopes this new venture will give him a better income which he can use to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to start his bee-keeping business so he can produce and sell honey.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest..

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Speaking with Mary, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their angelic looking three children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been in agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases poses a big challenge for her and also adds to poor productivity.

Mary is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way to change Mary and her family's life. The job that she does as a smallholder farmer is worthy of applause and makes her deserving of the help that she is asking for. Go for it, make a loan

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria still remembers how the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and Kiva lenders helped her to step up on her buy-and-sell business. Prior to the approval of her previous loan, she only bought 1 to 2 pieces to sell. That’s why she wants to thank the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders for the approval of her previous loan and monetary provisions as well. She was able to buy more quantities of products for her buy-and-sell business which resulted in sales increases and enticed more patrons. Currently she is earning PHP 6,000 every month.

In a buy-and-sell business, she can’t avoid customers who’ll make late payments which she considers a challenge in her business as it affects revenue. Gregoria wants to have complete products to refill in her display cabinet. With this, she decided to apply for another loan of PHP 15, 000. She hopes that CCT would once again consider her loan application since the amount will really be of great help for the business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Gregoria spends time attending CCT group fellowship meetings that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain spiritual strength, hear testimonies from other CCT partners, hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans. She’s praying that God will continually provide good health for her family.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Giorgio Ítalo

texts.es:
Giorgio es un joven estudiante que vive junto a su padre y hermanos menores. Su madre falleció cuando él era pequeño. Su padre logró rehacer su vida con su actual pareja. Todos viven juntos formando una linda familia.

Giorgio decidió estudiar Confección de Prendas de Vestir porque le gusta todo lo relacionado a la ropa y desea seguir una línea de carrera cuando haya finalizado sus estudios. Tiene su hermano que es modelo y de ahí podrá sostenerse para promocionar su estilo de diseño.

Esta carrera lo beneficiará en lo personal y en todo sentido, ya que terminando la carrera podrá formar su propia empresa y así apoyar a su familia económicamente. También apoyará a la comunidad, dando trabajo a los ciudadanos interesados y con buen potencial para el trabajo.

Él lleva estudiando un año de su carrera, aún le faltan 2 años para culminar su carrera y subir un escalón más en su vida. Durante el tiempo de estudios, le va muy bien ya que solo se dedica a las máquinas con las que día a día aprende más cosas. Le dedica 9 horas diarias a sus estudios prácticos (máquinas) y se queda luego de sus horarios para continuar especializándose.

Cuando culmine su carrera piensa trabajar en una empresa que sepa valorar su trabajo y le permita especializarse más en el área textil.

A Giorgio le gusta muchísimo su carrera, pero el tema económico por el cual está atravesando le impide continuar sus estudios. Debido a ello, es que está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA para que pueda continuar con sus estudios y no truncar sus sueños de ser un gran empresario en el rubro textil. El cambio que generaría en él, es que le permitirá tener mayor conocimientos en el ámbito empresarial textil. Al obtener este crédito, se siente bien consigo mismo porque siente que es una gran ayuda, porque le permitirá continuar sus estudios hasta finalizarlo en el tiempo estimado.

El mayor sueño en su vida es apoyar en su hogar teniendo su propia empresa, con la cual también pueda apoyar a ciudadanos y familiares. El mayor obstáculo que tuvo es el económico, porque el dinero de su padre no le alcanzaba para continuar con sus estudios y sentía que se rendía, que no quería estudiar. Gracias a sus tutores entendió que a más horas de prácticas, mejor mantenimiento y uso de máquinas de textil. 

Para finalizar, Giorgio quiere expresarles unas palabras: "Me siento realmente bien, al saber que personas de todo el mundo me brinden su confianza, el cual lo sabré apreciar esforzándome cada vez más con mis estudios. No los defraudaré, no se arrepentirán de haberme apoyado. Al contrario se hará un buen uso a su inversión, porque al terminar mis estudios prestaré servicios a los más necesitados."
texts.en:
Giorgio is a young student who lives with his parents and younger siblings. His mother died when he was young. His father managed to get his life back on track and now has a new partner. They all live together as a happy family.

Giorgio decided to study a course on clothes-making because he has always liked the world of fashion and he would like to follow a career path in this industry in the future.

He has a brother who is a model who can give him some support and push his designs.

This course will help him in many ways, both for the personal satisfaction in setting up his own business, and also economically as it will allow him to contribute to the family expenses. He also plans to help the community by offering work to those who show interest in what he is doing.

He has completed one year on a three-year course, which on completion will take him to the next stage in his life. He spends all his time practising with the machines, up to nine hours a day on practical work and then more time afterwards to study other things.

If he works for another company, he will only go to one which values his work and allows him to specialize in textiles.

Despite his love for his studies, he is faced with the problem of not having enough money to be able to continue working towards his dream. His father is unable to pay for it and he lost motivation at some point feeling that it was not possible to complete the course.

That is why he is asking for a loan from Kiva so he can carry on studying to be a successful businessman in the fashion industry. He would be very grateful for this assistance, as he learnt from his tutors that the more time he practises with the machines, the better he will become.

His ultimate dream is to have his own business and be able to look after his family. He tells us: "I feel very honored that many people want to offer me their support and I will strive every day to make the most of it. I will not let them down, so they won't regret aiding me. In fact, it will be a good investment, because I plan to offer my services in the future to those who are most at need."

loans.use: to pay to finish his studies as a tailor.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали из Истаравшана 42 года и он хочет расширить свою деятельность в области растениеводства. Нурали занимался этим делом с детства и посей день. Как Нурали считает, что земледелие не даст бездельничать и лениться. Нурали хотелось бы научить своих внуков этим видом деятельности и передать свой опыт. Пока они маленькие, Нурали решился расширить свой бизнес и довести до совершенства, до взросления внуков. Он планирует расширить земельный участок, купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Nurali is from Istaravshan.  He is 42 years old and he wants to expand his agricultural activity.  He has been involved in farming since his childhood and, to this day, he still works in the same field. According to him, you don't get any time to sit back and be lazy when you're a farmer.  Nurali would like to teach his grandchildren what he knows about being a farmer and he also wants to transmit his experience to them.  Although his grandchildren are still young, Nurali is already thinking of the day when they are all grown up and, for them, he has decided to expand and improve his farming business.  He is planning to get more land and would like to buy some seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), Batasan branch. She is 57 years old and currently runs a variety store or a 'Sari-sari' store business. “Sari-sari” is a Tagalog word which means “variety of choices” where you can buy grocery items by piece or volume such as kilos of rice and bottled drinks. She’s able to somehow sustain her day-to-day expenses through her business.

Sally takes advantage every time CCT conducts business mentoring. During mentoring, they also inform members about how Kiva can help entrepreneurs who are lacking capital to sustain their business and how lenders are considerate in helping new entrepreneurs. This is why she applied for an amount of PHP 10, 000 which will allow her to add grocery items for her variety store business.

She dreams of having her own house in the future so she's determined to succeed in her business. She prays that CCT will consider her loan application since it would be of great help if granted. She wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders and CCT in advance.

Sally is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word conveyed to them every week.
