loans.use: To add grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner wants to thank the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders for their consideration of his previous loan application and story on the Kiva website. Without this amount, he would not know how to survive in the business every time something needs to be fixed on the vehicle, since he lacks supplementary capital. The amount that he applied for previously was used for the maintenance of his tricycle unit and to purchase grocery items for his variety store business. Each month he’s earning for approximately PHP 10, 000.

Abner has applied for a loan of PHP 40, 000 as a revolving fund for the maintenance of his tricycle unit and since Christmas is now approaching, he also wants to buy more grocery items for his variety store.

He perseveres to earn for his family as he wants them to maintain good health every day. He’s praying that God will touch the hearts of people who have the capability to help and return abundant blessings to them.

On a weekly basis, Abner regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for the maintenance of his tricycle unit and to buy more stocks of supplies of grocery items for his variety store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie’s previous loan with Center for Community Transformation (CCT) really sustained her junk shop business. She was able to buy large quantity of reusable materials which she sold and turned into a profit. Though business’s revenue is not that large compared to other businesses, she is able to run the business and support her family through her strengths which are hard work and patience.

Rosalie wants to have her businesses expanded and she also aims to support her children’s education and provide for her family. Aside from hard work and patience, capital is one of the foundations for business success. That’s why Rosalie decided to apply for a PHP 35, 000 loan that will be used as additional capital to buy large quantities of scrap materials like plastic, metal, steel, carton and glass. The remaining portion will be used as a revolving fund for the business.

Rosalie regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials from collectors for her junk shop.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly wants to thank the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving her previous loan of PHP 10, 000 which she used as additional capital for the business. She noticed that her daily sales increased as she’s now able to provide a bulk quantity of orders. She believes that God will return the favor for those people with considerate hearts. Jelly is challenged as to how God uses people as an answer for her prayers.

Jelly wants to succeed in her business so that she’ll be able to continually support her family. She wants to have supporting capital so that every week she’ll be able to buy additional products for her buy and sell business and to have her own store as well. With this, she applied for a loan amount of PHP 20, 000 and is hoping that lenders will once again consider her story.

On a weekly basis, Jelly regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Lourenca

texts.en: Lourenca is requesting a loan of $ 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including rice, nuts, biscuits, sugar, salts, soaps, candle, eggs, cooking oils and shampoo to sell. She has been in this business for a few years now and surviving with her own working capital. She wants to open a big store in the future so she is taking this loan.  She wants to manage and improve her business. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, nuts, biscuits, sugar, salt, soaps, candle, eggs, cooking oils and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Marisol is grateful that her prior loan of PHP 8,000 was approved with the help of the Lord and by using Center for community Transformation (CCT), which was a great help for her business to be stepped up. Mirasol once again wants to express her gratitude to all the lenders who helped her financially.

Despite competition in the same business line, still God supplies customers which increases sales. Approximately PHP 17, 500 are her monthly earnings which become one of the sources for the day-to-day expenses to support her family.

She wants her children to finish college and to add new products like a variety of street foods. More products will indeed increase sales and profit. She decided to apply for a loan of PHP 25, 000 as a revolving fund for her current business.

Mirasol has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, which has made her to become strong spiritually, and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to pay for grocery food items to sell.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en: Adelaide lives in Liquisa and is a business woman. She has been involved in business activities a few year now and has made the best of it with her own working capital. She is very interested in doing business. Adelaide has an small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $ 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She will use this loan to buy items to keep in her store including sugar, cigarettes, cooking oils, sardines, candies, candle and tea to sell.  She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, cigarettes, cooking oils, sardines, candies, candle and tea to sell.

loans.name: Inka Cancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INKA CANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Virginia  continua con su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo  zanahorias, tomates y pepinos  entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas pepinos entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the community bank "INKA CANCHA" ['Inca Court']. This bank is located in the district of Taray, belonging to Calca province and the department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Virginia. She continues her vegetables sales business. The partner is a very entrepreneurial and responsible woman. The partner hopes to obtain more profits in her business and in this way continue supporting her family. She continued selling carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers, among others, for customers who request them. The partner feels thankful for the loan extended and agrees to comply with the established installments, feeling in this way that she is moving her family forward.

The partner requests a loan in order to purchase onions and cucumbers, among others.

The other partners make a living in the vegetable sales business, the agriculture business, the grocery store business, and the food sales business.

The partners in general are grateful to those who are part of this dream and they undertake to comply with the payment of their installments by the established date.

loans.use: to purchase onions and cucumbers, among others.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Rosas De San Juan Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Rosas de San Juan Este grupo se integra por las señora Magdalena, como representante del grupo se dedica al comercio desde  hace 12 años en su negocio ofrece artículos de consumo diario, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de productos por catalogo, venta de regalos para todo tipo de ocasión, venta de refacciones por las mañanas y tarde como también los fines de semana y  ahora quiere agregar la venta de calzado de dama, ve la oportunidad de obtener ganancias a través de la venta de calzado  ya que le proveen la mercadería directamente de la fábrica de calzado,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos varios como, productos comestibles,compra de ropa y cosméticos para vender.
texts.en:
Rosas de San Juan solidarity group

This group includes Magdalena as the representative of the group. She has worked at sales for 12 years in her business, the sale of daily use products, the sale of baby clothing, the sale of catalog products, the sale of gifts for all sorts of occasions, the sale of snacks in the mornings and in the afternoon and also on the weekends and now she wants to add the sale of women's shoes. She sees the opportunity of getting earnings through the sale of shoes since they provide the merchandise directly from the shoe factory. She is asking for this loan to purchase a variety of products such as food products, clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to purchase food products, clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 24 años de edad, trabaja en una moto taxi todos los días de la semana, está soltero y aun no tiene hijos.

Julio, se dedica a trabajar de esta manera desde que tenía 18 años de edad y su hermano menor le enseño a manejar este tipo de vehículos, para que tuviera ingresos y pudiera cubrir sus necesidades.

Julio, necesita el préstamo para reparar la moto-taxi y para surtir la tienda de su madre, porque le ha pedido apoyo.

Julio, sueña con tener su propia casa y su propia familia.
texts.en:
Julio, 24 years old, works in a motorcycle rickshaw every day of the week, he is single and doesn't have any children yet.

Julio has worked in this way since he was 18 years old and his younger brother taught him how to drive this type of vehicle so that he had income and could cover his needs.

Julio needs the loan to repair his motorcycle rickshaw and to stock his mother's store because she has asked him for support.

Julio dreams of having his own house and his own family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle rickshaw and to stock his mother's store.

loans.name: Dúo Luz De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Julieta, quien es de 31 años de edad, tiene dos hijas y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica variada, como cortes típicos, blusas, güipiles desde hace 7 años, también vende utensilios de cocina de plástico y de  catalogo a muy buen precio como pachones, picheles, vasos, cubetas para azúcar.  Ella también se dedica a la venta de cosmético y está muy agradecida con Dios por el regalo hermoso que le ha dejado su madre el de saber vender y ser una gran comerciante.  Las fechas de ventas de fin de año se aproximan y es hora de comprar muchas cosas para el negocio como cosméticos ropa típica y utensilios de plásticos para vender. y así poder ofrecer variedad a todos los clientes.  Ella no tiene el dinero necesario y por eso necesita otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y tener mucha venta.  Les agradece por las oportunidades ya brindadas y espera seguir contando con su apoyo, les desea bendiciones.
texts.en:
Luz de San Pedro duo

The one in charge of this group is Julieta, who is 31 years old, has two daughters and has the unconditional support of her husband. She has worked selling a variety of traditional clothing such as traditional Mayan skirts, blouses, and güipiles [embroidered blouses] for the past 7 years. She also sells plastic kitchen items from a catalog at very good prices such as water bottles, pitchers, glasses, and sugar containers. She also works selling cosmetics and is very grateful to God for the lovely gift that her mother has given her of knowing how to sell and be a great businesswoman. The dates of the end-of-year sales are approaching and it is time to purchase many things for the business such as cosmetics, traditional clothing and plastic items to sell, and so to be able to offer a variety to all her customers. She does not have the necessary money and for this she needs another loan to purchase what she lacks and have a lot of sales. She is grateful to you for the opportunities already offered and hopes to continue counting on your support, she wishes you blessings.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, traditional clothing and plastic utensils to sell.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, de 43 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tienen una hija que ya está casada; en su casa solo vive un sobrino que ella cuida.

Reina, tiene una tienda en casa en su casa desde hace 12 años, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros; decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia con los gastos y necesidades del hogar.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, aceite, sal, huevos, entre otros productos para mejorar la venta y tener mejores ingresos. 

Reina, sueña con tener un negocio para ofrecer mejores productos y cubrir la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Reina, 43 years old, didn't go to school, she is married and her husband works in agriculture and they have a daughter who is already married, only her nephew who she cares for lives in her house.

Reina has had a store in her house for the past 12 years, where she sells basic products such as rice, sugar, oil, and more. She decided to work at this business because she didn't find any other way to help her family with the household expenses and needs.

Reina needs the loan to purchase sugar, oil, salt, eggs, and other products to improve sales and have more income.

Reina dreams of having a business to offer better products and meet the demand she has.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, salt, eggs, and other products to improve her sales and have more income.

loans.name: Enemesia

texts.en:
Enemesia is 57 years old and married with 6 children.

Enemesia operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) to help her husband, a driver, generate an income to support their family. Enemesia wants to see all her children finish their schooling which is why she works hard. She opens her store at 4 in the morning to sell instant coffee, bread and cooked breakfast as well as runs her sari-sari store (small grocery store) and closes at 11 every night.

Enemesia is requesting a loan amounting to 12,000 PHP to buy 3 dozen units of coffee, 1 sack of rice, noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other items as additional stock to sell in her store.

Enemesia hopes to expand her store to add shelves and more stock to help her family more with expenses and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen units of coffee, 1 sack of rice, noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other items as additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Syliana

texts.fr: Syliana a 32 ans. Elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite boutique où elle vend des produits alimentaires et quelques produits cosmétiques. Elle vend aussi des fournitures scolaires telles que des cahiers, des stylos, des taille-crayons, des craies, etc. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Syliana is 32 years old. She is single and has no children. She owns a small shop where she sells food products and cosmetics. She also sells school supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencil sharpeners, chalk, etc. She is requesting a micro-credit loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: buy school supplies

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 4 años y un varón de 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de frutas, actividad que lleva realizando dos años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con este negocio. Ana desea invertir en variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para comprar variedad de frutas para vender como: papaya, manzana, uvas, sandia, entre otras.
texts.en: Ana is a hard-working woman, 30 years old, who lives with her life partner and two children, a 4-year-old girl and a 15-year-old boy. She is a hard-working woman who works selling fruits, a business which she has been doing for two years, for which she is very happy to be able to have this business. Ana wants to invest in a variety of fruits to offer her customers, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase a variety of fruits to sell such as: papayas, apples, grapes, watermelon, and more.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to sell such as: papayas, apples, grapes, watermelon, and more.

loans.name: Rolando Jr.

texts.en: Rolando is a 41-year-old married man with 4 children. He borrowed a loan to buy materials for his ice cream business. He raised his family through this business by making and selling ice cream in the street. He was able to supply the needs of his family and support the education of his children through this business. His two sons help him sell ice cream too. He wanted to expand his business, give his family a better life and help others by hiring them.

loans.use: to buy materials for his ice cream business.

loans.name: Janeth Isabel

texts.es: Janeth de 44 años reside en un  barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla en donde funciona su panadería, negocio que emprendió en compañía de su cónyuge en el año 2009, ellos laboraron por años en negocios de este mismo formato y adquirieron la experiencia necesaria para iniciar su sueño de prosperidad.  Ellos son padres de dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad y su meta familiar es comprar una vivienda y un vehículo en el que puedan realizar las compras de materias primas e insumos para su negocio.  En su vivienda está instalada la panadería y diariamente atienden durante 16 horas en jornada continua, en la actualidad requieren más capital y por ello Janeth realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas: harina, huevo, queso, leche, levadura y refrescos como gaseosas y jugos naturales. Con esta inversión su negocio seguirá creciendo y se acercaran más a lograr sus metas.
texts.en: Janeth, 44 years old, lives in a neighborhood located in the municipality of Barranquilla where her bakery is located, a business she undertook with her spouse in the year 2009. They worked for years in businesses of this same format and got the necessary experience to begin their dream of prosperity. They are the parents of two children, ages 17 and 12, and their family goal is to purchase a house and a vehicle in which they can shop for their raw materials and supplies for their business. In their house, the bakery is installed and they work it daily for 16 hours without a break, and currently they need more capital, so Janeth applied for a loan, a Kiva loan, and opportunity to become part of the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase raw materials: flour, eggs, cheese, milk, yeast, and drinks such as soft drinks and natural juices. With this investment, her business will continue growing and she will get closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials: flour, eggs, cheese, milk, yeast and drinks such as soft drinks and natural juices.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is requesting a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she is still happy to do her business. Joana has been involved in these business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said with this loan she will improve her management of her business in the future. She is taking this loan because she wants use it to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta has been involved in business since a few years ago. She started her business with her own working capital. She also cultivates animals such as pigs, chickens and dogs. Jacinta is married and husband is in agriculture. Jacinta has a shop. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to what people like. These include noodles, water, cooking oils, sugar, milk, coffee, cigarettes, sardines, tea, biscuits, soft drinks and hard drinks. She will increase her incomes with this loan.

loans.use: to buy items such as noodles, water, cooking oils, sugar, milk, coffee, cigarettes, sardines, tea, biscuits, soft drinks and hard drinks to sell.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en: Olandina is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to improve her business of selling kerosene. She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more kerosene. She started to sell kerosene a few years ago with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from this business. Every day she brings her kerosene to resell in the market. Many people come to buy her kerosene. She wants to expand her business but her money is not enough, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital which she will use to buy more kerosene.

loans.use: to buy kerosene.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
Encarnación es una mujer de 59 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 3 hijos varones de 20, 30 y 32 años y una hija de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es constante, fuerte y muy independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la zona Sur, caracterizada por ser una zona residencial de casas grandes y lujosas, de clima templado y seco.
Encarnación es de tez morena cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura y forma de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su vida la comparte con sus 2 hijos menores que estudian y trabajan, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida como ‘el thimpu’ cocinado a base de carne de cordero, chuño, arroz, papas, y otros condimentos, “el thimpu se sirve con caldo y es muy conocido por su poder sanativo de la resaca…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque la comida que vende es accesible a todo bolsillo. La ventaja  de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y los fines de semana cocina nuevos platos, la desventaja es la falta de insumos como aceite, fideo, arroz, papa y otros para cocinar diariamente. Su sueño es refaccionar su vivienda, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Encarnacion solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar comida tradicional a diario.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a 59-year-old woman, divorced, who has 3 sons ages 20, 30 and 32 and a daughter, age 17, and her business is selling food.

She is persevering, strong and very independent. Her business is located in a market in the southern zone, characterized by being a residential zone with large and luxurious houses, with a warm and dry climate.

Encarnación has dark skin, long black hair she keeps braided, is short, and dresses traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]). She shares her life with her 2 younger children who go to school and work, they live in a rented room built of brick which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling food such as "el thimpu", cooked with a base of mutton, freeze-dried potatoes, rice, potatoes and other seasonings. "Thimpu is served with a broth and is very well-known for its curative powers for hangovers..." she says. Her business is successful because the food that she sells is accessible for all wallets. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily and on the weekends, she cooks new dishes. The disadvantage is the lack of supplies such as oil, noodles, rice, potatoes and others to cook daily. Her dream is to repair her house, and she wants to purchase cooking supplies. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 25 years that she has done this work.

For these reason, Encarnación asks for a loan to purchase cooking supplies to cook traditional foods daily.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies to cook traditional food daily.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 39-year-old vegetable vendor from the town of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She is a hard working woman and is raising nine children aged two to sixteen. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. She will do anything to help her husband to ensure that they can provide for their children's school needs. She is asking for a loan to buy garlic, onion, squash, string beans and okra. Marina hopes to manage her business well for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy onion, garlic, squash, string beans and okra.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlen works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Arlen is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Arlen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Camela

texts.en:
Camela is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Camela is 52 years old now.

Camela has a food vending business in the Philippines. Camela requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish and meat for her food vending business.

Camela has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Camela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish and meat for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ceferina is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Ceferina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Ceferina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ceferina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 36 years old and has six children who are in school.

Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mosoc Runa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC RUNA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la señora Patricia, la socia sigue dedicándose al  negocio de venta de plantas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo sus plantas  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia sacas adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, ferretería, carpintería.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud, los socios se comprometen salir todos juntos en la foto para la próxima reunión.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Mosoc Runa communal bank, the bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, and Cusco department.

The borrower is Patricia, the borrower continues working at her business selling plants, the borrower is an enterprising and responsible woman. The borrower hopes to get more earnings in her business so, in this way, to be able to continue supporting her family. The borrower continues selling her plants to the customers who ask for them. The borrower is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments, being in this way that the borrower gets her family ahead.

The borrower requests the loan to purchase seeds, manure, and more.

The other borrowers work selling clothing, in hardware, and in carpentry.

The borrowers who are in the attached photo asked permission to arrive to the meeting late due to work and health reasons, the borrowers promise to be together in the photo for the next meeting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure and more.

loans.name: Chhanny

texts.en:
Chhanny is a single, 18-year-old, in her freshman year at university. She is from Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in the city.
Her parents earn their main income from rice farming. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances needed to pay her tuition fees from first to second year, Chhanny would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully.
Chhanny wants to become a staff member in a bank, therefore she will be able to save money to build a proper house. If she has any children later on she wants them to pursue bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees at the university.

loans.name: Bautista

texts.es: El Sr. Bautista vive en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quien en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único ingreso con el que cuenta por el momento, tiene dos hijos pequeños que mantener por lo que requiere de dinero como apoyo para poder iniciar la actividad de apicultura (producción de miel) ya que cuenta con el conocimiento necesario puesto que este recibió capacitación de una ONG, como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda de Accion Bolivia, actualmente vive en su domicilio junto con su Familia, el préstamo que requiere es para implementar su producción apícola para producir miel, vale hacer conocer que dicha persona se dedicó desde muy jóven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos de la Familia, con esta nueva actividad obtendrá mayor ingreso y de tal manera poder vivir en mejores condiciones de vida con toda su Familia.
texts.en: Bautista lives in the community of Cumandayti in the municipality of Villa Vaca Guzmán, Chuquisaca department, who currently works in agriculture and raising livestock and it is the only income that he has for the moment. He has two young children to support so he needs money as a loan to be able to begin apicultural work (honey production) since he has the knowledge necessary since he got training from an NGO such as Fundación Nor Sud and Ayuda de Accion Bolivia. Currently he lives in his home with his family, the loan that he needs is to begin his apicultural production to make honey. It is worth knowing that this person has worked since he was very young in agriculture and raising livestock and it is the only means he has for his daily sustenance and other family expenses, with this new work he will get more income and in this way will be able to live in better living conditions with his whole family.

loans.use: to begin his apicultural production to make and sell honey, in this way generating more income for his family.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Three years ago, 42-year-old Mary Grace successfully started her own business. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells varieties of goods. She has been doing this to help her husband in raising their children. They have four teenage children to support. Their children are 14, 12 and 11-year-old twins. Mary Grace's only wish in life is to become a successful businesswoman someday. All of this is for her children. She wants to give them a better life and enable them to finish their studies. To do this, she needs a bigger amount of loan to buy commodities that will help her augment her earnings. She needs to purchase items such as biscuits, candies, chips, bread, juice, fruits and school materials. Aside from this, she also wants to buy piglets. She is planning to start a hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy commodities such as biscuits, candies, chips, bread, juice, fruits and school materials; and to buy piglets.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 60-year-old, married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Luzviminda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, meat, vegetable, etc..
Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, meat, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 60-year-old, widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Margarita sells personal care products in the Philippines. Margarita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, lotion, etc..

Margarita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 51-year-old a married woman with four children. Three of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leonida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices and seasoning for her food production business.

Leonida has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices and seasoning for her food production business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Catalina is 57 years old now.

Catalina has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. Catalina requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Catalina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en: Vet is a 48-year-old widowed homemaker with two children. She resides in Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She has mainly been earning income from selling porridge and Khmer noodles since 2011. Her two children are working in a factory and another one is working as a black blacksmith. Vet and her children can earn approximately 14 USD each day. Now Vet would like to request loan to buy a motorcycle for her son, who works in the factory, to commute to work. This loan will help her son to reduce travelling expenses and have better travelling conditions. In the future, Vet is going to expand her business, so she will be able to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son, who works in a factory, to commute to work.

loans.name: Carlos Hilario

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la venta de hot dog desde hace 12 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran clientela que solicita sus productos. Él tiene 53 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 15 años de edad que es su  mayor alegría. Carlos desea  invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar materia prima para su venta de hot dog.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hardworking man who has been making a living at selling hot dogs for 12 years. He has built a large clientele that seeks out his products. He is 53 years old and lives with his life companion and his 15-year-old daughter, who is his greatest joy.

Carlos wants to invest in his business, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy supplies for his hot dog business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for selling hot dogs.

loans.name: Fuerza Compartida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA COMPARTIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Pavel es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, durante todo el día, para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
El socio tiene 34 años y dos hijos por quien luchar día a día.
El socio solicito el crédito para comprar repuestos para su auto como llantas y retrovisores.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de restaurante y brindar servicios en empresas privadas.

El socio agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito concedido, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Fuerza Compartida communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The borrower is Pavel, a hard-working person who works offering a taxi service, all day long, to be able to get his family ahead.

The borrower is 34 years old and has two children for whom he struggles day by day.

The borrower asked for the loan to purchase parts for his vehicle such as tires and mirrors.

The other borrowers work at a business selling cell phones, a business selling cakes, a grocery store business, a restaurant business, and offering services in private businesses.

The borrower is grateful to the Kiva investors for the granted loan and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to purchase tires and mirrors.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: As a married mother to three children, Delma who is 43 years old, works hard to provide for them. She has a food vending business in Jagna, Bohol. This is her source of income which supplements her husband's pay from carpentry. She cooks suman (a snack made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed wrapped in buli or buri palm leaves, usually eaten sprinkled with sugar). She usually sells this dish in the terminal and pier located in Jagna, for the passengers going on a ferry to other provinces. She is asking for a loan to buy sticky rice and sugar to further increase her production. Her profit will be used for the family's day-to-day expenses like food and the school fees of her children aged 11, 16 and 19.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sheila Marie

texts.en: Sheila Marie is a 39-year-old married woman with 7 children. She borrowed a loan to buy goods for her sari-sari business. Through this business she was able to help her husband financially. She wanted to support her children in terms of education and getting jobs in the future, expand the business and uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old and married with two children. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items such as toothpaste, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee and sugar to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items including toothpaste, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee and sugar. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as toothpaste, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corazon is 33 years old now.

Corazon has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married, 44 years old and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Myrna requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Myrna has been in the business of pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 40 years old, and married with five children. With four children in school, Tita works very hard to provide for them.

Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Tita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 55-year-old widow with four children.

Milagros alone has raised and supported her children after her husband died 9 years ago. Her eatery and sari-sari store (small grocery store) is their only source of income until her two oldest children graduate and can help her with their expenses.

Milagros will still have 2 more children in college, and she is working hard going to the market buying ingredients, cooking and selling until 8 pm every night.

Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for to increase her menu items.

Milagros hopes to expand her menu further and add other items in her store like rice, to increase her income. This will help the family even more.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her eatery.

loans.name: Dúo Helens De San Bartolome Group

texts.es:
DUO HELENS DE SAN BARTOLO
Este dúo está  formado por doña Helens Siomara ella tiene 39 años de edad y se dedica desde hace cinco años  en el servicio de corte de cabello, tintes, manicure, pedicure, venta de cosméticos de belleza venta de zapatos, en su salón ubicado en San Bartolomé  Milpas Altas , ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de cosméticos para su salón de belleza, su mayor deseo es tener bien surtido su salón para aprovechar la temporada navideña que ya se acerca,espera que la puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
HELENS DE SAN BARTOLO duo

This duo is formed by Helens Siomara. She is 39 years old and has worked for fifteen years in hair cut, dye, manicure and pedicure service, selling beauty cosmetics, and selling shoes, in her salon located in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas. She is asking for the loan to invest in cosmetics for her beauty salon, her greatest desire is to have her salon well-stocked to take advantage of the Christmas season which is near, she hopes that you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Dúo La Libertad Comunidad Group

texts.es:
DUO LA LIBERTAD COMUNIDAD
Teresa de 37 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos menores de edad los cuales van a la escuela y el negocio al cual ella se dedica es a la venta de ropa americana desde hace ya varios años. Teresa menciona que le ha sido de mucha ayuda el negocio, pues con él  a logrado salir adelante junto a su familia.
Teresa solicita un crédito para comprar nueva mercadería en ropa Americana pues a sus clientes les gusta la variedad que ella ofrece en su negocio. El sueño de Teresa es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
LA LIBERTAD COMUNIDAD duo

Teresa, 37 years old, is the mother of 4 children who are minors and who go to school and the business where she has worked for some years now is selling American clothing. Teresa mentions that the business has been a lot of help to her since, with it, she has managed to get ahead with her family.

Teresa asks for a loan to purchase new merchandise in American clothing since her customers like the variety that she offers in her business. Teresa's dream is to manage that her children become professionals and have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase American clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mercado Chojolon Group

texts.es:
DUO MERCADO CHOJOLON
María Herminia es casada,  de 41 años de edad  es madre de 4 hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian en una escuela de su comunidad. María se dedica a la venta de sandalias y algunas prendas de vestir para niños. Hace ya 4 años que tiene su negocio y dice irle muy bien pues con él a logrado salir adelante apoyando a su familia. María solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería (sandalias y ropa nueva para vender)pues se acerca una buena temporada para sus ventas y necesita surtir su negocio. El sueño de María Herminia es llegar a comprar su casa y espera lograrlo muy pronto.
texts.en:
Mercado Chojolon duo

María Herminia is married, 41 years old, and the mother of 4 children who are minors and who study at a school in her community. María works selling shoes and some children's clothing. She has had her business for 4 years now and says it is going very well because, with it, she has managed to get ahead supporting her family. María asks for a loan to purchase merchandise (shoes and new clothing to sell) since a good season for sales is approaching and she needs to stock her business. María Herminia's dream is to purchase a house and she hopes to manage it very soon.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Dorena

texts.en:
Dorena is 40 years old and married with four children. As all four children are in school, Dorena works very hard to provide for them.

Dorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as bread, beverages, dried fish and other groceries to sell.

Dorena has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Dorena would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as bread, beverages, dried fish and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessica Yesenia

texts.es: Jessica es una joven luchadora que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante, ella lleva 2 años y medio elaborando y vendiendo variedad de zapateras de tela, lo que le permite obtener lo ingresos económicos necesarios para su hogar. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos un varón de 7 años y una niña de 5 años de edad a los que cuida mucho. Jessica está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar más materia prima para elaborar zapateras e iniciar la elaboración de columpios para niños.
texts.en: Jessica is a determined young woman who works hard each day to get ahead. She has been making and selling a variety of fabric shoe racks for two and a half years, which allows her to get the income necessary for her household. She lives with her life partner and 2 children, a 7-year-old boy and a 5-year-old girl, who she cares for a lot. Jessica is asking for a loan from FUSAI to purchase more raw materials to make shoe racks and begin making swings for children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make shoe racks and begin making swings for children.

loans.name: Milton Omar

texts.es: Milton tiene 19 años de edad y vive con su madre y su grupo familiar, en vivienda propia desde hace 10 años, él se dedica a la venta de dulces y zapateras de tela, lo que le permite salir adelante y apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Milton desea invertir en materia prima para su negocio, ya que sabe que entre más productos tenga mejores serán las ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de zapateras de tela para vender.
texts.en: Milton is 19 years old and has lived with his mother and his family in their own house for the past 10 years. He works selling candies and fabric shoe rackss, which allows him to get ahead and support his mother with the household expenses. Milton wants to invest in raw material for his business since he knows that with the more products that he has, the better his earnings will be, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase raw material to make fabric shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make fabric shoe racks to sell.

loans.name: Lherissia

texts.fr: Lherissia est âgée de 33 ans.  Elle vit en union libre et a cinq enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de Petit-Goâve avec son compagnon et les enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires à domicile. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie et trouve de quoi nourrir sa famille. Son rêve est d’avoir assez de revenus pour donner à ses enfants de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des caisses d’huile.
texts.en:
Lherissia is 33 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship and has five children. She lives in the town of Petit-Goâve with her partner and children.

She resells food products from her home, which is how she makes a living, sufficient to feed hr family. Her dream is to have enough income to provide her children with better living conditions. She is requesting a loan to buy crates of culinary oil.

loans.use: buy crates of culinary oil

loans.name: Aurora María

texts.es: Aurora de 34 años es ama de casa y está a cargo de la crianza de sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, ella está comprometida y vive con su familia en un barrio del sur de Barranquilla.  Ella considera que es el pilar fundamental de la educación de sus hijos y que son lo más importante en su vida, sin embargo es una mujer muy dinámica y emprendedora que busco alternativas de generar recursos sin dejar de lado sus compromisos familiares y encontró en el multinivel una oportunidad de negocio.  Ella aprovecha su tiempo libre y promueve la oferta del catálogo entre sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos, en cuanto logra el tope de venta esperado realiza su pedido.  Sus ventas generalmente son a crédito y sus clientes le cancelan quincenalmente, es por ello que debe ampliar su capital y realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar productos de tocador: polvos, perfumes, splash, cosméticos y demás encargos.  El principal desafío por el que ha tenido que pasar es que su cónyuge no cuenta con un trabajo estable y sus ingresos no le permiten adquirir compromisos  a largo plazo, pero ve en su negocio una oportunidad para estabilizar la economía de su familia.
texts.en: Aurora, 34 years old, is a homemaker and is in charge of raising her two children, ages 10 and 5. She is partnered and lives with her family in a neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla. She believes that she is a fundamental pillar in the education of her children and that they are the most important thing in her life. However, she is a very dynamic and enterprising woman who sought out alternatives to generate resources without neglecting her family responsibilities and found in multi-level marketing a business opportunity. She takes advantage of her free time and promotes the offerings of the catalog among her neighbors, friends, family members, and people referred to her. When she achieves the expected amount of sales, she makes her order. Her sales are generally on credit and her customers pay off their credit every two weeks. For this, she wants to increase her capital and she applied for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become part of the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase dressing table products: powders, perfumes, spalsh, cosmetics, and other orders. The primary challenge which she has had to go through is that her spouse doesn't have a stable job and his income doesn't allow them to make long term commitments, but she sees in her business an opportunity to stabilize the family's economy.

loans.use: to purchase dressing table products: powders, perfumes, splash, cosmetics and other orders.

loans.name: Marilú Del Rosario

texts.es:
Marilú, de 34 años de edad, es sastre de profesión, está casada y es madre de 2 pequeños hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Marilú, se dedica a la confección de uniformes estudiantiles y trabaja con el programa de gobierno para elaborar estos uniformes, de esa forma ella contribuye para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, su esposo por su parte apoya con la cosecha que obtiene de su milpa y sus frijolares los cuales sirven para consumo de la familia y para vender.

Marilú, necesita el préstamo para comprar tela y para comprar insumos agrícolas para poder elaborar los uniformes y para ayudar a su esposo para que siembre.
texts.en:
Marilú, 34 years old, is a tailor by profession, married and is the mother of 2 young children, her husband works in agriculture.

Marilú works making student uniforms and works with the government program to make these uniforms, in this way she contributes to covering the family needs. Her husband, for his part, supports with the harvest that he gets from his cornfield and bean field, which serves for family consumption and to sell.

Marilú needs the loan to purchase fabric and to purchase agricultural supplies to make the uniforms and help her husband to plant.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and purchase fabric to be able to make uniforms.

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es:
Eriberto, de 67 años de edad, se dedica a cultivar la tierra y a criar cerdos en su casa, está acompañada y tiene 1 hijo.

Eriberto, se dedica a cultivar la tierra y a criar cerdos en su casa, en esta actividad le ayuda su esposa y a veces su hijo también le ayuda.

Eriberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y herbicidas para su milpa y la frijolera, además de para comprar cerdos para engordar.
texts.en:
Eriberto, 67 years old, works cultivating the land and raising pigs at his home, he is partnered and has 1 child.

Eriberto works cultivating the land and raising pigs at his home and in this work, his partner helps him and sometimes his son helps him as well.

Eriberto needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies and herbicides for his cornfield and the bean field, in addition to purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and herbicides for his cornfield and bean field.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 37 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su vivienda, la cual realiza desde  hace 9 años, contando con una sólida clientela que siempre compra sus tortillas, Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar maíz por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias en la venta de tortillas.
texts.en: Rosa is a hard-working woman who, at the age of 37, lives with her life partner and two children, a 2 year old girl and a 7 year old boy. She is an admirable woman who works selling tortillas from her home. She has been doing this for 9 years and has a solid customer base who always buy her tortillas. Rosa is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn in bulk and improve her earnings from selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and improve her earnings from selling tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es: María, a sus 52 años se siente con más motivación que nunca para seguir trabajando, la venta de productos cosméticos es su principal ingreso, es por esto que María solicita un crédito, para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, tales como, perfumes y cremas, que le generen ganancias y que le permitan continuar las mejoras de su casa; ya que, con las ganancias del crédito pasado pudo reparar algunas averías que habían en su hogar.
texts.en: María, at 52 years old, feels more motivation than ever to continue working. The sale of cosmetic products is her primary income, and it is for this that María asks for a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products such as perfumes and creams, which generate earnings for her and allow her to continue with the improvements on her house since, with the earnings of the last loan, she could repair some broken down things that were in her house.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of products such as perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su municipalidad, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años con lo que logra sostener a su familia. Ella tiene 46 años de edad que vive con sus dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Ana desea invertir en su venta de verduras, ya que sabe que en época navideña las ventas aumentan y ella desea tener suficientes productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, cebollas, chile verde, papas, entre otros productos para su negocio.
texts.en: Ana is a hard-working woman who works selling vegetables in the market in her municipality, work that she has done for 5 years, and with which she has managed to support her family. She is 46 years old and lives with her two children, ages 22 and 18, who she has managed to get ahead as a single mother. Ana wants to invest in her sale of vegetables, since she knows that in the Christmas season, sales increase and she wants to have enough products to offer to her customers, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in tomatoes, onions, green chilies, potatoes, and other products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, onions, green chilies, potatoes, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es: José cuenta con una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años, por lo cual cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos por sus precios accesibles y la frescura de los mismos. Él tiene 50 años de edad y vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 19 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace varios años. José desea surtir su mercadería y para ello solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita invertir en frutas y verduras por mayoreo para su negocio.
texts.en: José has sold fruits and vegetables for 20 years, so he has a large quantity of customers who ask for his products due to his accessible prices and the freshness of the products. He is 50 years old and has lived with his life partner and 19-year-old son in their own house for a number of years. José wants to stock his merchandise and for this he asks FUSAI for a loan which will allow him to invest in fruits and vegetables in bulk for his business.

loans.use: to invest in fruits and vegetables in bulk for his business and, so, to increase his income.

loans.name: Martha Elsa

texts.es: Martha es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 24 años de edad se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, detergentes, productos de cuidado personal entre otros, con lo que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella cuenta con 24 años de edad y vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 6 años de edad al que trata de brindar todo su apoyo para que estudie. Martha desea invertir en productos para su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: granos básicos, comida para perro, detergente, galletas, golosinas entre otros productos solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Martha is a hard-working woman who, at 24 years old, works selling basic grains, detergents, personal care products and more, with which she manages to bring sustenance to her home. She is 24 years old, and lives with her life partner and 6-year-old child to whom she tries to bring all her support so that he studies. Martha wants to invest in products for her business, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase basic grains, dog food, detergents, cookies, and candies among other products asked for by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, dog food, detergent, cookies, candies, and other products asked for by her customers.

loans.name: Dúo Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Dúo las Flores
Doña josefina tiene 35 años de edad es la de blusa azul tiene 3 hijos de 3,  17, y 11 años vive con su esposos e hijos su negocio es de venta de leña  entre otras cosas ella quiere su crédito para poder invertir en comprar más leña  inicio vendiendo chocos y helados  pero la leña se vende mas ya que sus clientes son vendedoras de tortillas es por ello que necesita surtir de leña  sus metas son mejorar la calidad de vida, ofrecer mejor producto, fortalecer el negocio agradece a fape y a kiva por la ayuda
texts.en:
Las Flores duo

Josefina is 35 years old, is the one in a blue blouse, has 3 children ages 3, 17, and 11 and lives with her husband and children. Her business is selling firewood among other things. She wants her loan to be able to invest in purchasing more firewood. She began selling chocolates and ice cream but she sells more firewood since her customers are tortilla saleswoman and for this she needs to stock up on firewood. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, offer a better product, and strengthen her business. She is grateful to FAPE and Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Las Palmas Group

texts.es: Dúo las Palmas Doña Romelia tiene 41 años de edad es la señora de la blusa rosada ella tiene 3 hijos de 22, 16, y 11 años de los cuales 2 estudias ella tiene su negocio de vender ropa deportiva y producto de catálogo  ella inicio vendiendo solo catalogo y de ahí fue prosperando el negocio ahora  ella necesita el crédito para poder invertir en comprar uniformes deportivos, pelotas, y producto de catálogo, sus clientes son deportistas de su colonia y vecinos sus metas son mejorar la calidad de vida, ofrecer variedad de productos, mejorar los ingresos económicos es el primer crédito kiva y espera la ayuda de fape y kiva  agradece la oportunidad de el crédito.
texts.en:
Las Palmas duo

Romelia is 41 years old and is the woman in the pink blouse. She has 3 children, ages 22, 16, and 11 of whom 2 go to school. She has a business selling athletic clothing and catalog products. She began selling only from the catalog and from there, the business prospered and now she needs the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of sport uniforms, balls, and catalog products. Her customers are athletes in her colony and neighbors. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, offer a variety of products, and increase her income. This is her first Kiva loan and she hopes for the help from FAPE and Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase athletic clothing to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca vive en el municipio de Entre Ríos, del trópico de Cochabamba, junto a su esposo con quien trabajan dedicando al área agrícola, en su terreno propio que lo adquirieron en la colonización con mucho esfuerzo migrando de las provincias de Cochabamba, donde no contaban con una fuente de ingresos sustentables en el trópico se dedicaron a producir plátano y yuca, estos cultivos son su fuente de ingreso con los cuales se mantienen y compran lo necesario para su sustento económico diario,  el cultivo de plátano cosechan 2400 racimos de 2 hectáreas y la yuca cosechan 400 quintales de 1 hectárea, la comercialización es en su misma actividad económica a comerciantes de productos de temporada. La señora Francisca vio que el manejo del cultivo de plátano es más practico, por lo cual quiere el préstamo para ampliar la producción así de esta forma quiere mejorar sus ingresos con lo cual podrá cumplir los objetivos propuestos.
texts.en: Francisca lives in the municipality of Entre Ríos, in the tropics of Cochabamba, alongside her husband with whom she works in the area of agriculture, on their own land which they got in the settlement program. With a lot of effort, they migrated from the provinces of Cochabamba, where they didn't have a sustainable source of income. In the tropics they worked producing plantains and yucca. These crops are their source of income with which they support themselves and purchase what they need for their daily economic sustenance. They harvest 2400 bunches of plantains from 2 hectares and they harvest 400 quintales of yucca on 1 hectare. The sale is part of the same work, selling seasonal products to salespeople. Francisca saw that managing the plantain crop is more practical so she wants a loan to expand the production so, in this way, she wants to increase their income with which she can achieve her proposed goals.

loans.use: to expand and improve her products and in this way increase her income for her family.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez, 74, is widowed and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and has borrowed once previously from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

Mercedez has now requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marie Maude

texts.fr: Marie Maude a 33 ans. Elle est mariée et elle a cinq enfants. Elle vend des sucreries et c’est grâce aux revenus de cette petite activité qu’elle arrive à faire vivre sa famille. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. À l’avenir, elle espère offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Maude Marie is 33 years old. She is married and has five children.

She sells sweets and thanks to the business' small income she manages to support her family. She is seeking a micro-credit loan to increase her stock. In the future, she hopes to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: increase her supply of candy

loans.name: Osvald

texts.fr: Osvald a 31 ans, il a un enfant, et il est divorcé. Il vend des céréales par sacs. Il a beaucoup de clients mais n’a pas toujours suffisamment de marchandises en stock pour répondre à leurs besoins. Il demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Oswald is a 31-year-old divorcee with one child. He sells bags of cereal.

He has many customers but not always sufficient goods in stock to meet their needs. He is requesting a micro-credit loan to increase his stock supply.

loans.use: buy bags of cereal

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Vilma es una persona trabajadora, ella se dedica a su negocio de venta de chicha, con productos ancestrales como maíz y otras plantas secas. 
La socia tiene 52 años y lucha día a día por sus sueños de tener un mejor futuro para su familia.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo y leña, ya que son indispensables para que realice su bebida.
los socios que están adjuntos en la fotografía grupal , llegaron tarde por motivos familiares.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurante.

Los socios están contentos con el préstamo adquirido y agradecen a los inversionistas de KIVA por su apoyo.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the La Ñusta III communal bank. This bank is located in Calca district, which is part of Calca province and Cusco department.

The borrower, Vilma, is a hard-working person. She works at her business selling chicha, with ancestral products such as corn and other dry plants.

The borrower is 52 years old and struggles day by day for her dreams of having a better future with her family.

The borrower asked for the loan to purchase yellow corn and firewood, which are indispensable in making her drink.

The borrowers who are attached to the group photo arrived late due to family reasons.

The other borrowers work at a business selling candy, a business selling clothing, a grocery store business and a restaurant business.

The borrowers are happy with the loan they got and grateful to the Kiva investors for their support.

loans.use: to purchase yellow corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase carrots and more.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn, 36, is married with three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rovelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos through Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She will use the loan to buy a new fish net for her business.

Rovelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net.

loans.name: Guirlene

texts.fr: Guirlene, 33 ans, est mère de trois enfants. Elle vit en union libre. Elle revend des pains pour pouvoir gagner un peu d’argent. Elle s’approvisionne dans des boulangeries de la ville et revend son stock à domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Guirlene is a 33-year-old mother of three. She lives in a common-law relationship.

She sells bread in order to generate some income. She gets her supplies from bakeries in the city and resells from her home. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: buy bags of bread

loans.name: Olmata

texts.fr: Olmata a 26 ans et elle est célibataire. Elle a démarré son activité en vendant des noix de coco et des produits alimentaires. Cela fait plus de 4 ans qu’elle gère cette activité. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Olmeta is 26 and she is single. She started her business by selling coconuts and food products, and has been in business over the past four years. She is requesting a micro-credit loan to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: buy a supply of coconuts

loans.name: Kasih Ibu Ii Group

texts.en:
The Kasih Ibu Ii group, or Mother’s Love in English, is composed of five women who have their own businesses. Derosila (in the middle), 30 years old, has been appointed by the members as the leader of group.

She is married to Mon, a 40-year-old farmer. They are blessed with two children: Echa, 7, in the third grade of elementary; and King, an 8 month old.

Derosila owns a business of selling meals, which are composed of yellow rice with side dishes. She used to work at a private company for a few years but she resigned as she was expecting the second child.

She spends the days with her children and running the business. Every day she produces 60 packs of yellow rice and leaves them at two kiosks. She is grateful for having a profitable business; the income generated enables her to manage their daily needs.

Derosila wishes to produce about 120 packs of yellow rice. However, she needs more money to buy more ingredients and also add some other snacks as well.

When she and other members learned from an account officer about the TLM group loan product, they then formed a group and requested a loan totaling IDR 8,750,000.

The other women also want to invest their portions for business improvement. Derosila and the members were happy for Kiva, through TLM, to give them a chance to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients so she is able to produce about 120 rice packs and add a new product, corn snacks.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is 61 years old and lives in Solana with her family. She is married to a farmer and together they have been managing a farming business for more than 20 years. In the farming business, they plant and harvest rice to sell. They also plant vegetables and corn as additional income. 

Emiliana is now asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. She hopes to manage their business well so it will continuously give them a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Terry is 32 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Terry has a fishing business in the Philippines. Terry requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through GDMPC to buy new fish net for her business. Terry has been in this business for 8 years. Terry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new fish net.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 47 years old and married. She has eight children. With three children currently in school, Primitiva works very hard to provide for them.

Primitiva runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, coffee, etc.

Primitiva requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

In the future, Primitiva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 48 years old now.

Erlinda has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Erlinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, dresses, etc.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca es una mujer  luchadora es viuda tiene tres hijos de 11, 14 y 21 años la hija de 14 años está embarazada y su madre es quien le está apoyando, ella vive en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos Recinto Chipal este sector tiene un clima cálido húmedo y su gente es muy unida por ser una comunidad pequeña. 
Doña Blanca trabaja de cocinera en el campamento del Concejo Provincial pero desea emprender en el negocio de producción de pollos esta actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia buscando la manera de tener otro ingreso para dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos a esta actividad le dedicará 4 horas diarias y sus hijos serán quienes le ayuden a cuidar cuando ella tenga que salir a trabajar y no alcance a regresar pronto, las entregas de pollo lo hará en tiendas del sector.
Con este crédito emprenderá en este negocio y en algún momento espera dedicarse solo a esta actividad para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.
Blanca  agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada
texts.en:
Blanca is a determined woman, she is a widow and has three children ages 11, 14 and 21. The 14-year-old girl is pregnant and her mother is the one who is supporting her. She lives in San Miguel de los Bancos, in Chipal precinct. This area has a warm and humid climate and the people are very close because it is a small community.

Blanca works as a cook at the provincial government building but she wants to undertake a business producing chickens. She learned this work by her own initiative, seeking the way to have another income to give a better future to her children. She will work 4 hours daily at this activity and her children will be the ones to help her care for them when she has to go to work and isn't able to come back soon. She will deliver the chicken to stores in the area.

With this loan, she will undertake this business and at some point she hopes to work only at this activity to spend more time with her children.

Blanca is thankful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the offered support and help.

loans.use: to undertake her own business raising chickens and in the future to have more time to share with her children.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 38 years old and married with five children. With her five children currently in school, Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

Angelita has been in this business for four years, and she sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc.
