In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including aqua, biscuits, cooking oils, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things for resale. 

She has been doing business since 2010, with her own working capital of 250 USD. She has a big store, but she has no good management for business, so she is taking this loan. She will use the profits to improve upon her management in the future. 

She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy aqua, biscuits, cooking oils, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things for resale.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
Sreypao is 26 years old, and a married mother with a dependent child in her care. She earns her main income from selling cosmetics at the market, and she has been in this business since 2012. Her husband is 26 years old and is a tailor. The family resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sreypao and her husband can make around $17 per day. She wants to improve her family’s finances, so she seeks a loan to buy clothes and lotion for resale. In the future, Sreypao wants to save enough money to be able to expand her business, buy more soil to fill in the yard around her house, and support her small child going to school.

loans.use: to buy clothes and lotion for resale.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret is a 53-year-old married homemaker with four children. She lives in a community in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Her three children are factory workers and another one attends school. Her husband is 57 years old and he is a civil servant. The family can make approximately $23 per day.

Ret’s wooden house is old, so now she is requesting a loan because she would like to buy construction materials to build a proper house. With this loan, she will be able to have a proper house and live in better conditions.

In the future, she is going to open a grocery store and support her youngest child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a proper house.

loans.name: Dúo Guapinol Group

texts.es: Dúo Guapinol Karen Dayana 21 años de edad, Empeco su negocio como vendedora ambulante de ropa, inicio hace 2 años y gracias al prestamos de kiva su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para vender, esperando que le ayuden con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Guapinol duo

Karen Dayana, 21 years old, began her business as a traveling clothing saleswoman. She began it 2 years ago and thanks to the Kiva loans, her business has grown little by little. At this time she is asking for this loan to purchase new clothing to sell, she hopes that you will help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Vilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old and married. Teresa works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

Teresa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Mryna is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 56 years old now.

Mryna has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline and other supplies for farming fish.

Mryna has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and other supplies for farming fish.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en:
Ilda has been involved in a business of selling tobacco for a few years, and most of her daily income is from selling tobacco. She started with her own working capital of $200.

She is busy with her business, because she must going to other places to buy tobacco. She is earning a good income from this business because many people like to buy it, so she still happy to do her business.

When Tuba Rai Metin offered a loan to her, she felt very happy because she can be improving her business. She is taking this loan of $1,000 to buy more tobacco and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tobacco.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: Luz es una mujer de 42 años madre cabeza de familia de tres hijos de 19, 14 y 2 años, ella se dedica al comercio de electrodomésticos menores, ropa, calzado y artículos por intermedio de catálogos, actividad en la que ha encontrado un ingresos seguro para sacar adelante a su familia. Reside en compañía de sus hijos en un humilde barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, allí se consolida la mayoría de sus clientes  a quienes les vende con facilidad de pago.  Luz cuenta con cuatro años de experiencia y su clientela es cada vez mayor, sin embargo su capital no respalda en su totalidad la demanda, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo e invertir en cafeteras, licuadoras, prendas de vestir como blusas, pantalones, vestidos y calzado. A futuro Luz desea volver a tener un almacén misceláneo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Luz is a 42-year-old woman, the female head of household, mother of three children, ages 19, 14, and 2. She works selling small appliances, clothing, shoes and items through catalogs, work in which she has found secure income to get her family ahead. She lives with her children in a humble neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad, there she finds the majority of her customers to whom she sells with payment terms. Luz has four years of experience and her customer base is growing, however her capital doesn't completely support the demand, so she applied for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to enter into the financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and invest in coffeemakers, blenders, and clothing such as blouses, pants, dresses and shoes. In the future, Luz wants to have a miscellany store and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in coffeemakers, blenders, and clothing such as blouses, pants, dresses, and shoes.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
NAZIA is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s food business; he sells Nimko. Nimko is a popular recipe in the Pakistan subcontinent as well as regions with immigrants from the subcontinent. Nimko is made of gram flour, spices and salt with other ingredients that vary by recipe. He fries Nimko in a pot under high temperature cooking oil, after this he packs it into the polythene and supplies it to the retailers. Due to good taste he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. He wants to offer his recipe from a small stall instead of to the retailers but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a wooden stall and more ingredients for making Nimko.

Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a wooden stall, gram flour, spices, salt, etc. Nazia feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. Nazia wants to save the excess profit amount so that she could utilize these savings for future sudden needs.

loans.use: to buy a wooden stall, flour, spices and salt for her husband's Nimko frying, packing and selling business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Rosita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as detergents, hand and body lotions, candles, pens, medicines, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010, with her own working capital of $300. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day and she can help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy detergents, hand and body lotions, candles, pens, medicines, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 40 years old, married and has children attending school. He needs to support them so they will achieve their dreams some day.

Marlon gets his finances from the farming business he manages. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been doing this for more than ten years now.

He would like to continue improving crop production and nourishing them with enough farm inputs. So he is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and to pay labor costs in farming.

In the future, he will continue improving his business and gain good profits for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana has been involved in a business of selling gasoline for a few years. She started with her own working capital.

Her life is every day selling gasoline because she is earning a good income from this business. She lives near many people, so they come to buy her gasoline every day, so she still happy to do her business.

Adriana is requesting a loan of $700 to improve her business. She was happy when Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, because she can use it to improve her management and to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa works hard to support her family. Melissa is married and has a buy and sell coconut shell business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Melissa requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of coconut shell to sell.

Melissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconut shell to sell.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima was born in 1963. She is married and her husband is a worker.

Fotima is a higher educated woman. She works at the university as a librarian. Fotima has worked in this field more than 10 years and she knows her business well. Fotima has a small salary so she is poor.

Fotima sometimes suffers from toothache. She has not enough money to treat her tooth and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to treat her tooth. Fotima awaits the generosity of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to treat her tooth.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 50-year-old married woman who has five children. Two of her children are still attending school.

She raises and sells hogs. Her husband's way of earning a living is through farming. He grows and sells rice.

She lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

She is a hard worker and also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI, to buy feed and piglets. These are very vital and could boost her income as she raises quality hogs.

Arsenia hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing in other business ventures to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda, 57 years old, is married and has 6 children whose ages range from 18 to 34. Minda takes care of her husband, who is now an invalid due to illness, while she operates her sari-sari (small convenience store). Although three of her children are helping her with expenses, she still has three children in school and the high expense of her husband's maintenance medicine, which the family is barely able to sustain.

Minda's income from her store helps support the family's daily expenses, which is why Minda still works hard buying stock in the market and retailing it. Minda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy 5 cases of soft drinks, 3 boxes of canned goods, 1 sack of rice and other additional items to sell in her store.

Minda hopes to expand her store and add more items to continuously help her with the family's expenses and, more importantly, for her husband's maintenance and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of soft drinks, 3 boxes of canned goods, 1 sack of rice and other additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Adeela

texts.en:
Adeela’s age is 23. She is married, living with her husband and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her financial condition is neither good nor bad. Her husband earns not enough to meet household expenses.

He is a carpenter and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables and benches on order. Nowadays, he has a contract from a school for benches making and painting. This is the reason he needs wood and cans of paint so he can fulfill his new contract.

Therefore, Adeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy material such as wooden planks, nails, glue and paint to fulfill his contract.

Adeela thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and feels happy after this loan.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks, nails, glue and paint for her husband so he can fulfill his benches contract in due time.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella tiene 54 años  de edad es casada. Se desempeña como secretaria en un taller automotriz desde hace dieciséis años. Padece de miopía y astigmatismo, casi toda su vida ha usado lentes, depende para todo de ellos, esto le esta ocasionando problemas en el desempeño de su trabajo. Para poder corregir su padecimiento necesita someterse a una cirugía que desafortunadamente de momento para ella es imposible solventar.
texts.en:
She is 54 years old and married. She has been working as a secretary at an auto shop for 16 years. She has myopia and astigmatism. She has worn glasses almost all of her life, and she is dependent upon them for everything. This is causing her problems doing her work.

In order to be able to correct her vision problems, she needs surgery. Unfortunately, it is not now possible for her to pay for it.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, 43 years old, is the mother of five children and she lives near her husband's clothing shop. Since this shop is the family's only source of income, Safia's husband devotes all of his all efforts and time to the garment shop.

The shop is situated under the clothing market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more effort. Safia's husband has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing for his shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Safia's husband's major problem is that the winter season is starting and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy clothing related to it. If he cannot replace last season's clothing with this one's, it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and his monthly income.

Therefore, Safia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy winter clothing. Safia hopes that her husband will purchase clothing according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with market competition and grow his income, as well. She thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for her husband's garment store.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is age 24. She is a mother of two children and living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives like to purchase from his general store.

He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Sobia requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Sobia hopes that her husband will use the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of their family.

Sobia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Gull Pari

texts.en:
Gull Pari is the age of 41, living with her children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband packs tea into printed packing and then sells it to the retailers. She helps him for the completion of his daily tasks. He uses crushed tea leaf, printed packing and impulse sealer and aluminum sheets to protect the product from moisture and sunlight for extended use. He takes order from wholesalers and retailers.

Lately, he has been fulfilling many contracts, but this time he has gotten a much bigger contract than earlier. The major problem is that he does not have enough cash in hand to buy materials to continue his tea packing business.

Therefore, Gull Pari has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy materials such as crushed tea leaves and printed packs for his tea packing and selling business.

loans.use: to buy crushed tea leaves and printed packs for her husband's tea packing and selling business.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old married woman who has two children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Shazia's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can sell the maximum amount of fruits by the evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.

Shazia applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly sales. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business, where he sells phone accessories and also operates an M-pesa business. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of phone accessories for resale. His business goal is to be a large-scale distributor of phone accessories within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be intelligent. 

Justin operates a photography business. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals. 

Justin will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy photography materials.

loans.use: to buy photography materials.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, 56 years old, is a widowed mother with two children. She buys rice and sugar to resell, and has been in this business since 2008. Her two children both work, one as a factory worker and the other as a construction worker. Together, they earn approximately $ 11 per day. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Vanny would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to carry rice and sugar to sell in the nearby neighborhoods. This loan will help her earn more income in order to improve her living conditions. In the future, Vanny is going to expand her business and she will be able to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to carry rice and sugar to sell in the nearby neighborhoods.

loans.name: Roberta Mardaly

texts.es:
La señora Roberta  es una mujer  muy emprendedor y dedicado al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio el cual es la venta de abarrotería como ser: churros, arroz, manteca, azúcar, refrescos  y productos lácteos.
Doña Roberta este negocio lo atiende de manera personal desde hace 1 años siendo sus mayores clientes las personas que viven en su colonia así como también personas que visitan la colonia debido a que su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la calle principal, como ingreso adicional también cuenta con la venta de joyería como ser: aretes, pulseras, cadenas, dijes, etc.
Doña Roberta  solicita el apoyo del Préstamo para la compra de abarrotería para su negocio como ser: manteca, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, huevos, queso, pan, también productos lácteos y carnes ya que para esta temporada aumenta la demanda de carnes de cerdo y res
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en el uno de los más grandes de la colonia 

Danli, Honduras - Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Roberta is a very enterprising woman, and she devotes herself to commerce. Her main source of income comes from her business. She sells groceries like churros, rice, shortening, sugar, soft drinks, and dairy products. Roberta has personally tended to this business for one year. Most of her customers live in her neighborhood. She also has customers who come to the neighborhood as her business is located on the main street. As an additional income she also sells jewelry like earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and charms, etc.

Roberta is requesting the support of the loan to buy groceries for her business. She will buy things like shortening, sugar, rice, beans, eggs, cheese, bread, dairy products, and meat. The demand for pork and beef increases during this season.

She dreams of expanding her business and converting it into one of the biggest in the neighborhood.


Danli, Honduras - October, 2015

loans.use: to buy shortening, sugar, rice, beans, eggs, cheese, bread, and dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 30-year-old woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children have started to going to school. She wants to have some savings so that she can provide a better education to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Nusrat's husband has been driving auto rickshaws for many years, but his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw, but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to fix problems with it. Therefore, Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can fix the rickshaw and its body and can drive his rickshaw with full dedication.

Nusrat hopes that she will be able to have enough savings until the time of her children's marriages. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband in repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Kauser

texts.en:
Kauser, age 32, has been involved for about five years in a business where she sells embroidered clothes. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to be starting, and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

Kauser has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy inventory of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Kauser thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy winter season clothes for resale from her home

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
La señora Reina de 69  años de edad,  no tiene hijos que dependen  de ella, tiene casa propia ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de lácteos como quesos, leche, cuajada, mantequilla.
Doña Reina es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción como grava, cemento, ladrillos, arena, etc.  Para terminar de construir  una cocina y también para compra de leche para seguir trabajando en la producción de  quesos, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar su casa y su negocio, es su cuarto crédito que solicita.  Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener una mejor salud.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Reina, age 69, does not have dependent children. She has her own house, which is located in a community in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For five years she has been selling dairy products like cheese, curds, and butter. Reina is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials like gravel, cement, bricks, and sand, etc. to finish building a kitchen. She will also buy milk in order to continue working in cheese production. With the support of this loan she plans to improve her house and her business. This is the fourth loan she is requesting.

Her dream is to improve her house and to have better health.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, bricks, sand, and milk for her house and her business.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is a 49-year-old woman from Estancia, Iloilo. Like other people in their community, Rolinda and her husband are engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. They have proficiently run this business for thirty years to support their six children, four adult and two-school-aged children.

Rolinda wishes to augment their livelihood to have enough money to send all of her school-aged children to school. She wishes for them to finish their studies and become professionals someday. To make it happen, this woman is requesting a larger loan amount to buy additional fishing nets to help them enhance their catch and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a cheerful woman from the town of Carmen, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is married woman and has two school-aged children. It has been for one year that she has been running a sari-sari (general) store, serving neighbors in her place.


She has encountered financial shortages, and is in need of support to boost her livelihood. Analyn wants to purchase soft drinks and  groceries, such as beverages, noodles, and toiletries. In that way, she could manage the inventory of her stocks and handle it efficiently. With the sale of these items, she would continue to provide for the needs of her family, as well as her children's respective studies.

She is hoping and doing her very best to expand her business in order to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and  groceries, such as beverages, noodles, and toiletries.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes, sugar and other items. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her family's biggest challenge to be lack of sufficient clean water. She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to pay for jeepney tires and the repair of its passenger seat. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Belinda is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 30,000 PHP loan. This new loan will be used for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. By improving upon her transport service, Belinda's profits will significantly increase, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Belinda to sustain her family's needs.

She dreams to buy another unit of jeepney to use as additional transport service. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Veatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz, es una persona trabajadora de 41 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, es de construcción rustica con material local a la vez cuenta con el servicio básico energía eléctrica y agua el domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Huacawasi de la Provincia de Tiraque, su actividad económica es la agrícola en tal sentido produce papa, arveja en vaina verde, cebada, maíz en grano, todos los productos mencionados son cultivados en una superficie de aproximadamente 2.5  has. Los cuales cuentan con riego, ya que es aplicado por inundación. En ese sentido la señora se ve con una necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y la compra de semilla de papa, con la producción en el futuro, así a la vez poder mejorar  sus ingresos y mejorar económicamente para una mejor vivencia familiar.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking 41-year-old. She is married and has three dependents. She obtained until the primary education. She lives in her own house which is rustic and built with local materials. It has basic electricity and water utilities and is located in the community Huacawasi of the Province Tiraque.

She earns living in the agriculture of potato, green pea pod, barley, and maize grain. All products mentioned are grown on an area of approximately 2.5 hectares which have been irrigated by flooding.

Beatriz requests a loan to buy organic fertilizer (manure) and potato seed. Future production will improve income and the family life economically.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed to improve the production. This will in turn improve the income and the family life economically.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is only one of those entrepreneurs who face everyday challenges in business and life. She believes that one should endure any hardship and difficulty with footsteps before reaching on top. And she aims to be on top, which is why she is really working hard to build a stable source of income for her family. Her cloth, thread and rug business is helping her to provide for their daily needs.

Cherry wants to prosper through this business and she automatically grabs every opportunity that comes her way. She has already borrowed her first loan through Kiva and repaid it successfully. She is once again asking for your support to be able to raise the necessary amount needed to buy more supplies of cloth, thread and materials for making more rugs. A PHP 50,000 loan will definitely increase her inventory, which means a bigger return on her investments.

Cherry wants to someday meet a supplier who would fit her demands. She dreams of giving her family a happier and better life in the future. Cherry meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics, thread and other materials to make doormats.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 37 years old, and is a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides passenger transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw during the day and evening. He has been continuously driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw. Her husband wants to maintain the engine and body of rickshaw. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to her husband's business.

Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan granted to him in the amount of PHP 150,000. He used it to buy 50 boxes of canned goods, 70 boxes of noodles, 50 boxes of bottled products, 20 boxes of coffee, 20 boxes of bar and powder soaps, and materials needed for the renovation of his store. Bryan's store now has storage at the back for more inventory. Bryan also hired two more helpers to operate his store and to deliver his goods to customers. Together with low pricing and delivery, Bryan now has more customers in a wider area. He is starting to build a store in another area.

Bryan's hardware products have also been in demand these days because a large fire burned most of the houses near his community, and homeowners need to reconstruct their homes. Bryan wanted to charge them a low price for the hardware, but the prices by the manufacturer are so high that he cannot cut his prices without losing income. Bryan found a large manufacturer that sells wholesale hardware tools and materials like cement, steel, and sand.

Bryan is now requesting a loan for PHP 150,000 to buy cement, steel, sand, nails and other hardware tools and carpentry equipment for his customers.

Bryan still has high hopes to expand and become a wholesale distributor in his community. He wants to continue to help his community and generate more employment.

loans.use: to buy cement, steel, sand, nails and other hardware tools and carpentry equipment for his customers.

loans.name: Nuraly

texts.en:
Nuraly was born in 1974. He lives with his wife and two children in the northern part of Tajikistan. Nuraly is a higher educated man. He works at the university, where he is head of the Literature department. Nuraly has worked in this field for more than 19 years. He is very clever and smart, and has the respect of his colleagues. 

Nuraly for many years has been ill and that’s why he must get treatment for his health problems, but he has no money to do so. Nuraly is asking for a loan of 12,000 TJS to buy medicines for his treatment. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
La señora María de 43  años de edad, tiene  dos hijos que dependen de ella  vive con su esposo en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas, es un buen cliente.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz y leña para tener materia prima para elaborar su producto con el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es una buena clienta con varios ciclos de trabajar con Prisma, su sueño es mejor su casa y tener un mejor negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and has two dependent children. She lives with her husband in a community of San Lorenzo, south of Honduras. She has her own house and earns living making and selling tortillas for 10 years. She is a good client of the loan partner.

María requests a loan to buy corn and firewood as the raw material to make her products. With the support of this loan, she wants to get ahead and be able to improve the quality of life.

She is a good client with several loan cycles with Prisma. Her dream is to improve her home and to have a better business. San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Lindo Amanecer De San Martin Group

texts.es: Dúo Lindo Amanecer de San Martin: este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Felicita de 49 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral. se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hacer varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales de corral para la crianza(pollo), ya que se acerca la época de fin de año y es cuando mas se venden estos animalitos, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito Solicitado.
texts.en: The group Duo Lindo Amanecer de San Martin has as a member Maria Felicita, 49. She raises and sells poultry. She has done this work for several years. Now she is requesting this loan to buy chickens to raise, since the end of the year is approaching and that is the time of highest sales for these animals. She helps you can help with the loan she has solicited.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is only one of those entrepreneurs who are facing everyday challenges in business and life. She believes that one should endure any hardships and difficulties with footsteps before reaching the top. And she aims to be on top; that is why she is really working hard to build a stable source of income for her family.

Her cloth, thread and rug business is helping her provide for her family's daily needs. She wants to prosper through this business and she automatically grabs every opportunity that comes her way. She already obtained her first loan through Kiva and repaid it successfully. So this time, she is asking again for your support to be able to raise the necessary amount that she needs to buy more supplies of cloth, thread and materials needed for making more rugs. A 50,000 PHP loan will definitely increase her inventory, which means a bigger return on her investments.

Ma. Cristina wants to meet a supplier someday who would fit to her demands. She dreams to give her family a happier and better life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cloth, threads and other materials needed to make rugs.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora  Martina de 59  años de edad  es casada y  vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación , no tiene hijos y se dedica a su pulpería,  donde vende  todo lo relacionado a las canasta familiar,  cuenta con un molino donde sus clientes le visitan todo los días por la mañana para moler maíz y poder elaborar  tortillas.
Doña Martina sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, se dedica a su negocio desde hace 16 años está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles,  café, harina, huevos, etc.  Está  contenta de poder contar con el  apoyo que se le brinde.
Su sueño es  surtir mas su negocio  y obtener mejores ingresos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Martina, age 55, is married and lives with her husband in her house. She does not have children. She has a grocery store where she sells everything having to do with basic needs products. She has a mill that her customers come to every day. In the morning she grinds corn to be able to make tortillas. Martina's customers are all of her friends and neighbors in her community. She has been engaged in this business for 16 years.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, coffee, flour, and eggs, etc.

She is happy to be able to have the support being provided to her.

Her dream is to stock her business more and to get better earnings.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, coffee, flour, and eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 51 years old, and a mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son has owned a nursery farm business for the past ten years, selling different kinds of plants. Mostly, he focuses on flower plants, fruit plants, and some export-quality plants to sell to his customers. He prefers quality instead of quantity in his nursery farming business. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this nursery farm business. 

Now, the needs of his family have increased suddenly and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize sales from the business.

Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy more plants to sell. Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more types of plants for her son's plant nursery business for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Veenas

texts.en:
Veenas, aged 56, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and get tutored in the evening. It is challenge for them to afford the school and tuition fees.

Veenas' daughter is working hard to contribute to the household expenses. She owns a small beauty parlor at home and contributes her full income to the household. With the passage of time, her beauty products will soon run out and she wants to buy more cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

Veenas has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her daughter can buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs for her salon. She hopes that this loan will enable her to enhance her services. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic goods for her daughter's beauty salon.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 48 years old, married and has eight children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop, which he has been doing for many years. His business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family. It is necessary to expand the business to meet the family's needs but a lack of capital is the major problem for him. 

Noreen requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of clothing for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Aurora is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.  She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Melfa

texts.en:
Melfa is 32 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a used clothing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 14 years. 

Melfa requested a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
Urbana es una mujer de 62 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen 5 hijos de 18, 20, 26, 30 y 35 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de colchones de paja.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población y por el comercio informal gracias a la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que ronda los 30 grados centígrados.
Urbana es de baja estatura, cabello negro lo usa largo y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus 2 hijos menores que estudian y trabajan, el resto son independientes y tienen sus propias familias, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de colchones de paja, desde la madrugada comienza su trabajo, sentada a un lado del camino y junto a su vivienda, supervisa la llegada de la paja brava, primero se corta la paja de los cerros de la cordillera, luego se realiza el tejido y se lo empaqueta en forro de yute, “Yo usé toda la vida sólo el colchón de paja, que es duro, no te incomoda y nunca sentí dolores de la espalda ni de la columna…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los colchones que fabrica son de bajo costo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar paja y yute por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de colchones, ella desea comprar paja y yute por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Urbana solicita un préstamo para comprar paja y yute por mayor para fabricar colchones.
texts.en:
Urbana, age 62, lives with her life partner. They have 5 children; ages 16, 20, 26, 30, and 35. Her business is making straw mattresses. She is enterprising, independent, and very tenacious. She conducts her business in the southern part of the city. It is known for having most of the population and for its informal commerce, thanks to the manufacturing production in all areas. It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature of around 30 degrees centigrade.

Urbana is short and has long, black hair. She has a sturdy build, and her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business. She shares her life with her life partner, who works in the same business, and with their two minor children who go to school and work. The rest of the children are independent and have their own families. They live in rented quarters made of brick with a laminated tin roof. They have running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her business is making mattresses from straw. She starts her work at sunrise, seated at the side of the road by her house. She supervises the arrival of the 'paja brava' [Bolivian straw material]. It is first cut from the hills of the mountains, and then the weaving is done. It is then packed in a jute cover. "All of my life I have only used a straw mattress. It is hard, comfortable, and I never get back or spinal pain," she says.

The advantage of her business is that the mattresses that she makes are inexpensive. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy straw and jute wholesale.

Her dream is to open a mattress store.

She wishes to buy straw and jute wholesale, This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Urbana is requesting a loan to buy straw and jute wholesale in order to make mattresses.

loans.use: to buy straw and jute to make mattresses.

loans.name: Wausi

texts.en:
Wausi is a married woman. She has 11 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

Wausi will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is 24 years old. He is clever and hardworking. Alijon is a single and he lives with his parents.

Alijon now is a student of the Medical University of Tajikistan. He is one of the best students and he studies well. Alijon reads many books and he tries to be a good specialist in the future. Alijon’s parents are workers and their salary in not enough to pay for his university tuition. So, Alijon is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 48 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom attend school. She lives in the town of Bagohoy, Bohol. She is a farmer, growing and selling vegetables such as ampalaya (bitter gourd), tomatoes, and squash, which she has been doing for four years. She sells to the locals in her town. 

Rosalinda requested a loan from CEVI, which she will use to purchase fertilizers. With the loan, she can produce a bountiful harvest and improve her financial gain. In the future, she hopes that she will be more productive in managing her day to day livelihood activity to become sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

Beatrice operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Beatrice will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruit. Her business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 29 and lives in the Lahore area. Her husband owns a workshop in a nearby town; he provides dent removal and painting services for damaged bodies of vehicles. He has been doing this for many years and has a good reputation in the market. He appointed a helper to look after his workshop and to draw in customers from outside. The number of customers has increased due to his good attitude and impressive dealing.

To maintain his reputation and meet the increasing demand, he has urgent need of paint. Samina's husband is a poor person; due to household expenses he does not have enough savings to buy the desired materials and dent removal tools for his workshop.

Therefore, Samina is trying to help her husband in the form of a loan. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to the business and in the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy different colors of paint for her husband's dent removal and painting workshop.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guadalupe logro estudiar hasta 9 grado, esta acompañada y su esposo es empleado del sector publico, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar y son las únicas persona que depende económicamente de ellos, en su casa solo vive ella con su esposo y sus hijos.

Guadalupe tiene un cafetín donde vende comida desde hace 2 años, esta actividad la aprendió con la anterior dueña ya que era su empleada y cuando la dueña se retiro Guadalupe decidió hacer ella el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tendría la oportunidad de ganar mas, ella vive a una distancia de 3 kilómetros desde su casa  hasta su negocio y para llegar tiene que tomar transporte y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio, con esto atenderá mejor a su clientela y le ayudara ha incrementar sus ingresos ya que podrá atender  mas clientes.

Guadalupe desea que su negocio crezca ya que ella sueña con sacar a sus hijos adelante en sus estudios y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, todo esto lo lograra con las ganancias que le genere el credito.
texts.en:
Guadalupe studied up to ninth grade. Her husband works in the public sector and they have three children in school, who are their only financial dependants. She lives with her husband and children only.

Guadalupe owns a small café where she has been selling food for two years. She learned this activity from the previous owner when she was her employee, and when the owner retired, Guadalupe decided to take over the business herself to help her husband with household expenses, as it would give her an opportunity to earn more. She lives three kilometres from her business and has to use public transportation to get there. She works from Monday to Saturday, from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

She will use this loan to buy tables and chairs for her business. This will allow her to provide her customers with better service and will help her to increase her earnings, as she will be able to serve more customers.

Guadalupe wants her business to grow, as her dream is to support her children in their studies so that they can have a better quality of life. She will achieve this using the earnings generated by the loan.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Jerusalén De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Jerusalén de San Bartolo
Este dúo está formado por doña Elvia, ella tiene 46 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, para dama , caballeros, y niños, así como la venta de cosméticos, mochilas, comida y tortillas ubicada en su  domicilio, en el are de San Bartolomé Milpas Altas  desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ropa para dama, caballero, y niños, para surtir su negocio para las fiestas de fin de año, su mayor deseo es satisfacer los gustos  de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dúo Jerusalén de San Bartolo

One member of this group is Elvia. She is 46 years old and has been working for several years selling clothes for women, men and children, as well as selling cosmetics, backpacks, food and tortillas from her home in the San Bartolomé Milpas Altas region. She is requesting this loan to buy clothes for women, men and children to supply her business for end-of-year parties. Her greatest wish is to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children. She describes herself as kind.

Everline operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Everline describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that, in the future, she will become a successful business woman. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a 49-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in a town of Estancia in Iloilo, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman, while Melinda is running a sari-sari (variety) store business. She and her husband work hard to sustain themselves every day and to support their children. They have two children: one adult and one school-aged child.

She is asking for a loan to improve their livelihood and augment their earnings. Thus, she will use the money to buy commodities for her store, such as spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods and drinks. Aside from this, she will also buy new fishing nets and a fishing boat engine.

In this way, she and her husband will be able to improve their sales and their profit as well.

loans.use: to buy commodities for her store, such as spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods and drinks; she'll also buy new fishing nets and a fishing boat engine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 61 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Josephine has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Molly requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and beauty products for her business.

Molly has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and beauty products for her business
